loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 48 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 01 que esta bajo su poder y estudia. Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella misma, emprendió su pequeño negocio de venta de comidas, con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la rica sazón, que le pone a sus comidas;  sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente. Posteriormente, agrego a su negocio la venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa. En la actualidad continua con sus dos negocios, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá, en la compra de insumos, para preparar sus comidas.Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the "Maria Auxiliadora" community bank in the Tarapoto district in the San Martin province and department. She is single, is 48 years old and is mother to four children, one of whom is in her care and studies. Before needing to provide the family income and motivated by her own desire, she started her small business selling food. With her first loan of S. 300, she obtained very good results due to the rich flavors that she injected into her dishes, her low prices and the attention she paid to her customers. Later, she added grocery sales to her business, which is located in her home. Currently, she is continuing with both businesses, where her main customers are her neighbors. With this loan of S. 1,500, she will purchase more products with which to stock her business such as kilos of rice and sugar, eggs, cleaning products for the bathroom and house, sodas in packets, candy and other products that make her customers happy. Part of the money will also be invested in the purchase of ingredients to prepare her dishes. Today, she feels happy about her work and the service she provides and she is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the support it gives to people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes it continues for a long time and helps many families and entrepreneurial women.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase more groceries to increase her product stock.

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin T., age 39, is widow with three children: two daughters and one son. All of them are in school. She lives on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophoin has been a silk weaver since she was 17 years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market. One of Sophoin’s daughters just finished her baccalaureate degree and she hopes continues her bachelor degree at university in Phnom Penh.

Hence Sophoin is requesting a loan of 500 to pay school fees for her daughter and she will use a part of her loan to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Enkhtaivan produces the inner and outer coverings for gers (traditional Mongolian nomadic tents). Enkhtaivan’s ger covering business has been so successful that, not only does she support her daughter and parents, she has also been able to attend two years of business school. Before she started her ger covering business, she and her sister began by making deels (traditional Mongolian clothing) in 2000. The success of that business enabled her to begin her own business several years later.

Enkhtaivan is a 35 year old single mother who lives with her parents and young daughter in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger. She is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~420 USD) loan to purchase supplies and tools for her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and tools

loans.name: Nakhmat

texts.en:
Nakhmat M. is an entrepreneur who started his own business selling foodstuffs two years ago, as a way to help his family which consists of his wife and three daughters. With hard work and a lot of effort, he has succeeded in growing his business. This is also thanks to daily improvement in the quality of the service and products he offers his customers.

His children are his motivation for continuing to improve and grow his business. To cover current demand from his customers, Nakhmat is requesting a loan of 1607 AZN. With your help, Nakhmat will improve the quality of the service he offers his customers and will continue to grow his business. He appreciates the opportunity your support offers him.

loans.use: purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Abdul Y.

texts.en: Abdul K. is a 47-year-old businessman. He and his wife have seven children, one of whom is married and six who attend school, ranging from the nursery to secondary level. Abdul is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 from SMT and Kiva lenders in order to help him pay the school fees and related costs for his children.

loans.use: School fees and related expenses

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mable is a 25 year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works to support her husband to provide for the family. Mabel is a trader in the palm oil production business. She buys fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. Mabel also sells at the local market. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bulk palm nuts.

loans.name: Rosebel

texts.en: Rosebel is a 29-year-old rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has six kids. Her oldest child is only twelve. She aims to improve her family’s living conditions. Rosebel is now preparing her farm for planting. She will need seed, fertilizer, and other farming supplies. Unable to finance her farm, she sought the help of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines and also a KIVA partner. She applied for a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos, which she will use to finance her farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies and payroll

loans.name: Filyaz

texts.en: Education is the most important gift Filyaz M. can give their three dear children. They believe this because they are responsible parents who work very hard at farming so their children can finish school, an opportunity they never had because they were so poor. Filyaz has worked in agriculture since her wedding, and with the unconditional help of her husband, also buys and sells sheep to meet the family’s other needs. Despite this, she now finds herself with more expenses than expected, and would like a loan to increase the size of her flock. Filyaz and her family are hoping for a favorable response to their request.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 9 años atrás, del distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene 06 hijos, de ellos 2 están a su lado. Ella estudió primaria completa, tiene su tienda de abarrotes.

Francisca nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  arroz,  azúcar, fideos, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave y así vivir feliz con su familia. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que gana y las reuniones con las socias
texts.en:
Francisca, 49, has been a member of the “Generación 2000” communal bank, which is in the Santa Rosa district, El Collao province, Puno department, for the last 9 years. She is married and has 6 children, 2 of whom are still dependent on her. She finished elementary school and has a grocery store. Francisca tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She now is asking for 2000 new soles to buy rice, sugar, pasta, etc. Her dream for the future it to have her own house in Ilave and to live happily with her family. What she likes most about her communal bank is the savings she makes and the get-together with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eustaquio vive en el municipio de El Torno, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  su actividad es la de mototaxista, su esposa se dedica a vender refrigerio en  mercado central esta actividad le ayuda para colaborar a su esposo y asi poder mantener a sus 4 hijos,  tienen su domicilio en el barrio Naciones Unidas, es casa propia que compraron con mucho esfuerzo.

El Sr. Eustaquio es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora, con el dinero del credito hara un mantenimiento a su motocicleta ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y no le permite trabajar de forma normal, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Eustaquio lives in the town of El Torno. He is married and has four school-age children. He is a moto-taxi driver and his wife sells refreshments in the central market; together they support their four children. They own a home in the Naciones Unidas neighborhood which they were able to buy though much hard work. Mr. Eustaquio is a responsible and hardworking person. With the loan he will maintain his motorcycle which has recently begun to have some problems that prevent him from working as he normally would. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust and support given through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance

loans.name: Ndieme Paye

texts.fr: Madame Ndieme D. Habite à Yoff  Ndeungagne. Elle est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est membre de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis novembre 2003. Elle a déjà bénéficié  de 2 prêts  antérieurs. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 6 mois et 12 ans. Elle évolue  dans le commerce d’habits et de chaussures depuis 2007.C’est a travers la motivation de sa tante qu’elle a opte pour cette activiste. Ce qui l’intéresse  c’est faire des bénéfices. Ainsi elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour l’achat  de marchandises. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité  et améliorer  la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndieme D. lives in Yoff Ndeungagne. She is 31 years old and has been a member of the U-IMCEC Yoff branch office since November 2003. She has already benefited from two previous loans. She is married and the mother of four children, ranging from 6 months to 12 years of age. Ndieme has been progressing in the commerce of clothing and shoe since 2007. Motivated by her aunt, she opted for this work. Making a profit is the most interesting thing to her about it. And so, she is requesting a loan of 100,00 francs for buying merchandise. Her goal is to bolster her business and to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Savoen

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoen K. is 50 years old and is a villager who lives in Phlov Trei village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Ol Nov, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mrs. Savoen K. is also a food and cucumber seller who earns a small income to support her family.

Mrs. Savoen K. is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her crop.

Mrs. Savoen K. is the mother of four children, three of whom are farmers who support their parents’ farming, while the other one is a student in the local school. Mrs. Savoen K.’s husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline for her rice farm

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: This group loan has three members who live in Chrey Young village in Kandal province. Mrs. Phat C. is the group leader who has been selected by the members who will use the loan for different purposes. She is a chicken seller and a pig breeder also. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. Thus, Mrs. Phat C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more chickens to sell. She is a widow who lives in a five-member household.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Good Family Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Good Family” group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,600,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. 

48-year-old Musu M. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of the group. She was born in Waterloo and is a widow with six children. One of her children is in class IV and the rest are in college. She has been a businesswoman for more than 20 years now. Musu owns a bar where she sells both soft and hard drinks. In her bar, she also sells provisions: luncheon meat, baked meat, peak milk, sardine, etc. Musu will use this loan to further expand on this business by buying drinks such as Star beer (a popular local brand), stout, Heineken, Codys, Carlsberg, etc.

loans.use: To buy drinks such as Star beer, stout, Heineken, Codys, Carlsberg, etc.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo P. wan born in 1952 and she lives in Angk Ta Phouk village in Takeo province. She is a widow with three children who are seamstresses in a garment factory. Mrs. Keo P. is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family living, and on the side she is a chicken breeder at her home also.

Mrs. Keo P.'s problem is that the workplace of her children is a long way from her home. So to improve the family's living conditions, she is seeking a loan to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo V. is 56 and is married. She resides with her husband and seV.-year-old child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia: an area known for being the most populated city in the country. She sells grilled pork for an income of about USD 15 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3.5 per day to help cover the family expenses.  


V. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a cart to transport her products to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a cart to transport grilled pork to sell

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia C. is from the village of San Isidro. She is 48 years old and married with five adult children. Anastacia sells crops from her farm which she has done for over four years earning approximately 8,000 PHP a month. She is also engaged in buying and selling copra.

In 2006, Anastacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anastacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,950 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase rice. Anastacia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for farming. This will be the tenth loan Anastacia has taken out from PMPC. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for farming

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is divorced with a grown son. She is an entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk. Yelena sells toys and children's merchandise in a small vending pavilion at the central market of her home town. She can boast the character of a hard worker and positive thinker. Yelena has been in this business for 4 years. Presently, she has 30,000 Grivnyas invested in merchandise. Her income is about 10,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Yelena is requesting a loan of 8,200 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and boost her sales this summer. She also works as an elementary school teacher. However, her tiny salary of 900 Grivnyas can hardly help her family survive which is why she was forced to launch a small vending venture. Yelena's teaching experience has helped her better learn children's mentality and psychology, as well as inculcated a love for children in her. We believe Yelena will make good use of the current loan and repay it promptly.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom T. is 40 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its nine members who are located in Pou Khvet village, Takeo province. The members of this village loan will each use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Sokhom T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, she also sells groceries in the local village and is able to earn a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Soeun Heng, is a fisherman and also supports his wife on the farm. This couple has three children: one is a farmer and the other two are students in the local school.

In order to support her husband’s business, Mrs. Sokhom T. will use the loan to buy a fishing boat. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for her husband and more groceries to sell

loans.name: Juan Julio

texts.es: El Señor Juan es cliente antiguo de emprender trabajo anteriormente en el grupo Alalay, desde el año 2003,hasta el año 2006, retornando con este crédito para invertir en la compra de llantas para su transporte y otros accesorios,  el se dedica a la mecánica y al transporte urbano tiene su  taller en su domicilio donde vive con su esposa, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y con sus 2 hijos que se  encuentran en  edad escolar,  es una persona muy responsable en sus pagos, y muy trabajador, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Juan is an old client of Emprender. He previously worked in the group Alalay from 2003 to 2006. He has returned for a new loan to invest in the purchase of tires and other accessories for his vehicle. He works as a mechanic and in public transportation. His workshop is located in his home where he lives with his wife, who sells clothes, and with his two school age children. He is very responsible with his payments, a very hard worker, and is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given him in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by David Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda L. is from the village of Cabantian, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old and is separated from her spouse. Erlinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 19 years old. Kevin is single. To make a living, Kevin operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Kevin also loves to bake and he recently started baking bread that he sells around his neighborhood. He has plans for opening a bakery someday.

Kevin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kevin has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Kevin is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. He also plans to buy flour, sugar and other baking ingredients. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Kevin from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support his family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers and also buy flour, sugar and other baking ingredients

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
El Señor pastor Cuizara P. tiene 23 años vive en concubinato y es padre de un hijo, actualmente el vive en la casa de su tío el cual lo apoya y ayuda en la vida que lleva; él desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar en diferentes actividades tales como ayudante de albañil y como jornalero, actualmente el trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato “CARRASCO”  en el cual esta hace mas de 3 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo, cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.

Cabe señalar que el señor Pastor Cuizara P. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución
texts.en:
Mr. Pastor Cuizara P. is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in his uncle’s home, whom he supports and helps. He started working a variety of jobs when he was very young; things like a working as mason’s assistant or as a day laborer. He currently works as a taxi driver for the “Carrasco” union, and has been an active member for more than three years. His services are profitable because of the quality of people who request this service, given its convenience, speed, and efficiency. The union provides stops and shifts for each member, in different locations around Ivirgarzama, where people gather to request services.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice M. A. is 30 years old and married. Her husband works as part of an air crew.  They have one three-year-old child  whom they hope to provide with a good education to the university level. Her business is located at the Central Business District of Nairobi in a commercial building known as Development House. Her business name is Eugeon Agencies. She supplies toners and cartridges to government institutions. Eunice has been in this business for the past six years. She says that the business is profitable but the major challenge she has is delay in payment. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business does well. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy more toners and cartridges to supply to more institutions. She hopes to diversify into other businesses. She sees herself become very rich in future. Eunice describes herself as active, honest, and dedicated to her business.

loans.use: To purchase toners and cartridges.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario A. is from the village of Estrada. She is 42 years old. Rosario is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosario owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Rosario from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her  business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is an active member of Motemomwamu group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya where he has been farming for fifteen years. His mixed farm produces maize, tea and bananas which are all sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to fulfill the needs of his family. 

Boaz is 39 years old. He is married with five children who are now between the ages of 7 months and 12 years. Three of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children. However, he faces the challenge of the lack of finances to buy enough farm supplies. He hopes that in the future he will be able to acquire more dairy cows and expand his farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Osman Alberto

texts.es: Osman Alberto tiene 27 años, su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues desde muy joven busco la forma de mejorar su actividad. Es un joven muy emprendedor, por lo que siempre se preocupa por proporcionarle a su esposa e hijo lo más necesario, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes conocen muy bien que él es un joven muy responsable con los productos que ofrece. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cerdos y así destazarlos para realiza la elaboración de los derivados del cerdo. Su deseo es que su hijo logre convertirse en grandes profesionales.
texts.en: Osman Alberto is 27 years old and his economic activity is butchering pigs. He has dedicated himself to this business for over five years and since he was young he looked for a way to improve his business. He is a very enterprising young man and always worries about providing the necessities to his wife and child. The majority of his clients know that his very responsible with the products that he offers. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase pigs so that he can butcher them and make pork products. His hope is that his son is able to become a great professional.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 63 years old. Lucia is married and has 10 children. Her eldest child is now 45 years old, while the youngest is 22. To make a living, Lucia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lucia also raises hogs for fattening and sale. She hopes to earn better and be able to support her family financially.

Lucia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Orieta

texts.es:
Orieta forma parte del banco comunal “Brindando Esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella vende ropa, perfumes (para adultos y niños) y joyas, desde hace 12 años, a domicilio y en algunas instituciones como por ejemplo bancos, el colegio de su hijo y la iglesia en la cual participa. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería, papeles y cintas de regalo para prepararse para la época navideña. Ella viaja una vez al mes a Santiago a comprar sus productos. Cuenta con el apoyo de su marido con quien tiene 2 hijos, uno de 4 y otro de 9 años. 
El sueño de Orieta  es tener una boutique.
A Orieta le han sido muy útiles las enseñanzas que le han entregado en las reuniones de Fondo Esperanza, sobre cómo administrar su negocio, además que le es muy grato compartir con sus compañeros de grupo. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Orieta is a member of the “Brindando Esperanza” (Giving Hope) community bank, in the city of Concepción.  She has been selling clothes, perfumes (for adults and children) and jewelry for 12 years.  She sells her products from her home and in some institutions such as, for example, banks, her son's school and her church.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise, gift wrap and ribbons to get ready for the Christmas period.  Orieta travels once a month to Santiago to buy her products.  She has the support of her husband with whom she has 2 children: one aged 4 and one aged 9.

Orieta's dream is to own her own store.

Orieta has found the training given in Fondo Esperanza's meetings on how to run her business to be very useful.  She is also very pleased to be sharing with her fellow group members.

Concepción is located at the mouth of the River Biobío, one of the biggest rivers in the country, in the south of Chile, in Biobío region.  Historically it has a very important place in our history.  It was the site of important battles and notable settlement, especially during the War of Arauco as it was right on the border of Mapuche territory.  Currently the city is well developed both economically and demographically.  It is now considered one of the most important demographic, administrative, financial and commercial urban centers in Chile after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: clothes, perfume, gift wrap and ribbons

loans.name: Sulfecia

texts.en:
Sulfecia A. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 60 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Sulfecia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Sulfecia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Sulfecia joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Sulfecia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as snack foods and beverages. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Bokk Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK LIG. est crée le 14 mai 2010. il est composé de 12 femmes qui habitent le même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de GABAR

Madame NDEYE D. debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter des moutons qu'elle revendra au bout de 05 à 06 mois

Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale
texts.en:
The Bokk LiG. cooperative group was created on May 14, 2010.  It is made up of twelve women from the same village who came together through proximity and affinity.  The group is a part of the Gabar Banc Villageois.

Mrs. Ndeye D., standing at the right of the photo, is the group leader.  She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of seven dependent children.  She fattens sheep, and her new loan will allow her to buy sheep which she will resell after five or six months.  Her goal is to strengthen her savings and support her husband in the care of their family.

loans.use: Purchase of sheep to fatten for market

loans.name: Victoria Adelante 2 Group

texts.en:
Felicia is the coordinator of her group Victoria Adelante 2 (Victory Ahead 2). She is a young mother with a child and she lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner. Her dream is to have more children and have a successful family. She enjoys cooking and studying.

Felicia is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza. She successfully repaid her first loan that was used to expand her clothing business. She started her business with her own savings and has been running it for almost two years. Felicia plans to use this loan to purchase a variety of sizes and types of clothing for men, women, and children.  

Felicia joined Esperanza to get capital to improve her business. Her story is representative of her fellow group members and of Esperanza’s Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Felicia’s group is located in a rural area of San Pedro de Macoris, surrounded by sugar cane fields. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water—none of which is potable.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Nou Ri/tina, 29, is the mother of three school-aged children who are all under her care. To make a living, Nou Ri/tina weaves and sells cradles made from small pieces of clothing. She saves up many sets of cradles before selling them to retail vendors in the local market for a profit. Nou Ri/tina has been married for years to Mat Lim, a sugar cane juice seller in and around his community, using his motorbike. Unfortunately, an existing motor broke while Mat Lim was in the selling process. Since her husband often spends money on bike repairs, Nou Ri/tina will use her loan to buy a used motorbike to replace the broken one so that her husband can continue with his sales.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike to continue working

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas M. is from the village of Serran, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 58 years old. Felicitas is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felicitas owns & operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) shop.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Felicitas has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 13000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Felicitas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicitas is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Felicitas from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Sheema's Group

texts.en:
Sheema is 41 and a housewife. She got married when she was only 19 years old to A. G., who is a tailor by profession. He is known as an expert in his field and provides his customers good quality services. 

Sheema belongs to Depalpur, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family in the small colony named Fazal Elahi for the past 12 years.
 
She has two sons and a daughter. Her sons had to leave their education early to support the family financially. Her elder son is also a tailor, while her younger son is a bus conductor. Her daughter is getting religious education.
 
Sheema has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s tailoring business. With the loan, he will buy an over-lock machine (a machine to sew over the edge of one or two pieces of cloth for edging). This will enable him to offer this service to his customers. In the past, for this work they used to approach other tailors who had over-lock machines.
 
Sheema is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sheema.

loans.use: To buy an over-lock machine for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory by buying more uniforms and soccer accessories.

loans.name: Jose Edilberto

texts.es:
José, de 32 años de edad, se dedica a prestar servicio como motorista de una moto taxi, dando el transporte a las personas del lugar, reside en Usulután, junto a su esposa y una hija de cinco años de edad, él trabaja desde hace un año en su propio medio de transporte, todos los días de la semana de 6:00am a 6:00pm.
Él necesita un préstamo para pagar la reparación de la moto taxi, ya que presenta problemas de los cuales debe un mecánico revisar y reparar, con este préstamo solventara esta necesidad y dará el cuido y mantenimiento necesario a su medio transporte, ofreciendo mayor seguridad a los clientes que viajan con él.
Su objetivo es trabajar de forma amable y honesta con los clientes, ya que el sostiene a su familia
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and runs a moto-taxi service for people living in his area.  He's been in business for a year, using his own transportation, and works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.   He lives in Usulután with his wife and five-year-old daughter.

He is in need of a loan to pay for repair and maintenance of his moto-taxi due to problems that arise requiring mechanical checkup and repair.  He plans to use the loan for this purpose so he can maintain his vehicle and provide his customers with a safe mode of transportation.

His goal is to be kind and honest with his customers so he can support his family.

loans.use: To pay for repair and maintenance of his moto-taxi

loans.name: Katebo Basooka Kwavula Group

texts.en: 38-year-old N. Anet is affiliated with Katebo Basooka Kwavula group and has been a fish monger for the past decade in Katebo-Mpigi. Anet, a single mother of 4, was previously doing subsistence farming. She now mostly does commercial farming as a means of supplementing on her profits. Anet says she envisions better prospects for her business in the coming future as long as she continues with her diligence-driven attitude that she uses in her business. Weekly, she says this business generates shillings of 60,000 as profit. She says with this loan, she wants to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.use: to purchase of more fish to resell

loans.name: Rentsen

texts.en:
Rentsen is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and two sons in a ger, Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. Rentsen’s wife is unemployed and his two sons go to a local secondary school. For the past three years, he has run a photo service business. In order to increase his family’s earnings, Rentsen also started a taxi service business last year. 

Rentsen is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase a printing machine and some materials for his photography business. He is a good person who says, “I want to buy a printing machine with the loan.”

loans.use: to purchase a printing machine and photography materials

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad, vive con su único hijo y esposo en su casa propia la cual cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz, en donde acondicionado la su sala un lugar para colocar su tienda, ubicado en la zona rural del Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la comunidad de Arin a unos 15 minutos del distrito de Calca a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad, agrícola, ganadera y turística que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Feliciana ha puesto en su casa su tienda, en cual sus vecinos encuentran toda clase de productos comestibles (leche, azúcar, arroz, azúcar, todo tipo de golosinas, etc.), con el pequeño negocio que ha colocado Feliciana en su casa trata en lo posible de brindar un mejor nivel de vida para su familia mediante los ingresos de sus ventas diarias. Feliciana también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como pollos, ella tiene en el interior de su domicilio tiene granjas de pollos.  

Mediante una visita a la Asociación Arariwa, Feliciana trata de adquirir un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda de más insumos y así pueda satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, y de paso incrementa sus ingresos.

Feliciana es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre responsable con el objetivo de que como familia salgan adelante apunta de esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 49 years old, and lives with her husband and only son in their own house which has the basic services of water and light.  A room in the house has been set up as her store.  It is located in the rural area of Valle Sagrado de los Incas in the community of Arin, about 15 minutes from the Calca district and 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.  This area is characterized by its high activity in farming, livestock, and tourism that the population engages in.  

Feliciana has put a store in her home, where her neighbors find all kinds of food products (milk, sugar, rice, all types of snacks, etc).  With the small business she has in her home and the income it provides, Feliciana tries to provide her family with a better quality of life.  Feliciana also works raising small animals like chickens.  She has a chicken farm in the interior of her home.  

Through a visit to the Asociación Arariwa, Feliciana wants to get a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to stock her store with more merchandise.  She will be able to satisfy the needs of her customers and slowly increase her income.

Feliciana is known by her neighbors to be a happy woman who is always ready to help others, and who is a responsible mother who wants her family to succeed through effort and work.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with merchandise.

loans.name: Reluz Miñope Paulita

texts.es:
Paulina tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposo  y 02 hijas que están
en edad escolar. Su vivienda está ubicada en un caserío llamado valle hermoso en el distrito de  Monsefú, que es una pequeña comunidad rural que está ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Esta zona se caracteriza por dedicarse a la agricultura y ganadería.

Paulina desde hace 20 años se dedica ala crianza de ganado vacuno, labor que le permite obtener ingresos de la venta de leche, la cual realiza en sus comunidad u en zonas cercanas a su comunidad. También se dedica a la artesanía (elaboración de sombreros de paja y palma), de la cual también percibe pequeños ingresos Estas actividades le permiten solventar algunos gastos diarios del hogar, ya que lo que gana su esposo como peón agrícola no es suficiente, para cubrir los gastos familiares.

Los pastos para alimentación de ganado han escaseado por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de S/.1000 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de alfalfa y alimento balanceado para su ganado y por consiguiente una mayor producción de leche.

Su más grande sueño es darles a sus hijas una educación de calidad,  Paulina es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y responsable, cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus amigos y vecinos.
texts.en:
Paulina is 55 years old, and lives with her ​​husband and 2 school-age daughters.

Her house is located in a village called Valle Hermoso (Beautiful Valley) in the Monsefú district.  It is a small rural community that is located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. This area is characterized by agriculture and livestock breeding.

Paulina has been raising dairy cattle for 20 years.  This work allows her to earn income from the sale of milk, which she sells in her community or in areas close to her community. She also works in handicrafts (making sombreros from straw and palm), from which she also earns a small income.  These activities allow her to manage some of the daily household expenses, as what her husband earns as an agricultural laborer is not enough to cover the family expenses.

Pastures for feeding the cattle have been scarce, which is why she has seen it necessary to apply for a loan through Edpyme Alternativea for 1,000  New Soles.  The money will be invested in the purchase of alfalfa and balanced feed for her livestock, therefore resulting in increased milk production.

Her biggest dream is to give her daughters a quality education.  Paulina is a hardworking and responsible mother, who has good references from her friends and neighbors.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals and materials for making her products.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, a 54-year-old entrepreneur is married to Fransina, a 43-year-old lady. Moses has 4 children. They are:
1)\tMarlen, 22 years old, who works as a shopkeeper, 
2)\tConstantino, 20 years old, who works as a motorbike taxi driver 
3)\tMolano, 14 years old, who attends the second grade of junior high school, and 
4)\tRichard, 4 years old. 

Moses runs a rice milling business. He has been running the business since 2005. He initiated the business by using his own capital. His business runs quite well but several competitors have arisen near his village. Moses plans to enlarge his business by selling rice as an additional business.  

Unfortunately, his milling machine has broken so he cannot run his business well. He has to replace a spare part on the machine as soon as possible, as his family depends on the business. However, the spare part is quite expensive to buy. So Moses is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He would like to spend the loan on the spare part and paddy (unprocessed rice) to be milled.  He will then sell the milled rice on the market.

He is expecting that TLM will help him by approving his loan application so he will be able to run his business as usual.

loans.use: To purchase a spare part and paddy to be milled

loans.name: Segundo Simon

texts.es:
Segundo Simon tiene 50 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  SAGRADO CORAZON  se encuentra ubicada en el sector Cuatro Esquinas perteneciente al cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 12 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de los mismos y otras actividades que da utilidades.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz, además tiene 4 cabezas de ganado. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener casa propia y aumentar sus ingresos.

Le gusta conversar con la familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Simon is 50 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.  

The members of the Sacred Heart Communal Bank meet in the sector of Cuatro Esquinas, which is part of the canton of Guaranda and located 15 minutes from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The Communal Bank consists of 12 members who engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, the sale of their products, and other profitable activities.

Segundo is a farmer who grows potatoes, wheat, and corn. He also has four heads of cattle.  Segundo purchases his supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells his products at the wholesale market in the same city. 

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges he faces include diseases that could impact his crops.  His dreams including owning a home and increasing his earnings.  

Segundo enjoys talking with his family.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 4 children.  Monica has a food shop that sells rice & cheese cakes. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients for the rice & cheese cakes.

Monica has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Monica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for the rice & cheese cakes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 28 years old, married, and a father of one child. Joseph owns a retail shop in Kongowea, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for the last two years and it has been successful.

This marks his first loan from KADET to finance his business. With this loan, Joseph plans to add more stock of sugar, maize meal, rolls of tissue, wheat flour, margarine and cooking oil. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, maize meal, tissue, wheat flour, margarine and cooking oil

loans.name: Zainat

texts.en:
Zainat is a 25-year-old mother of two children. Her husband is a school teacher and they live in Al Karak.

Zainat wanted to help her husband support the family by doing something while she is at home taking care of the kids. She decided a year ago to start a small retail business selling home/kitchen tools and products at home such as pans, plates, trays, etc. 

Through this past year, Zainat was able to participate in raising their family's monthly income, which gives her a great feeling of being productive and helpful. Now she has applied for a loan to get more products to have most of the basic tools needed in a kitchen.

loans.use: to buy more of the basic kitchen tools to sell

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with five children, one of whom still attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a cloth ("Kikoi" used for clothing) sales business; she sells along the beach shores to tourists at the beach. Mwanajuma also does weaving of mats for sale as her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality due to low and high seasons in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of cloth for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth for resale.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Este cliente es profesora de primaria  trabaja para un colegio que pertenece al municipio del crucero,  se le han financiado varios crédito los cuales los ha utilizado para mejora de vivienda y gastos personales le han ayudado de mucho ya que ha podido solventar problemas de salud que se le han presentado de emergencia se siente muy bien trabajar con nosotros.
texts.en: This borrower is a primary school teacher and works in a school that belongs to the Cruzero municipality. She has already been given several loans which she has used to improve her house and for personal expenses. The loans have helped her a lot as she has been able to solve emergency health problems. She feels very comfortable working with us.

loans.use: to pay for a medical examination and buy medicine.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet is 45 years old and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She is married and has two children.
Nguyet and her husband run a business selling food from a stall in a local market. They sell many kinds of food, including rice cakes, beansprouts and fresh and dried noodles. 
Nguyet requires a loan to increase the turnover of her business by purchasing a greater range of basic foods. In this way she will be able to serve her existing customers better and attract new customers. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income, which will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.ru: Абдурауф проживает в городе Истаравшан. Возраст, 31 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством, а его дети учатся в школе. Сам Абдурауф занимается торговлей тканей. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки разноцветных тканей. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Abdurauf lives in the town of Istaravshan.  He is 31 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is involved in household work, and his children attend school.  Abdurauf is involved in selling fabrics.  He has been in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of multiple-color fabrics.  He wants to expand his merchandise assortment.

loans.use: to purchase multiple-color fabrics

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mary Joy, a 22-year-old married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a food shop or carenderia selling viands such as adobo and pancit bihon for 5 years. A new member of HSPFI, Mary Joy is requesting  a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Veronica Shirley

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica es  una joven casada con un hijo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante y superarse cada día mas; ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa, eligió este trabajo porque le gusta vender, lleva trabajando alrededor de 1 año, gana semanalmente S/. 260 nuevos soles. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de una computadora ya que necesita para sus estudios que esta siguiendo por las noches en un instituto de la cuidad. Su principal sueño de Verónica es tener su propio spa en su casa y ser una profesional. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que con ello va a poder alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Verónica is a married young woman; she has a son.   She’s a very hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead and improve herself more every day.  She sells cosmetics and clothes.  She chose this work because she enjoys selling.  She’s been working for about a year and earns 260 new soles per week.

The loan was granted to buy a computer that she needs for her school work since she’s going to night classes at an institute in the city.  Verónica’s main dream is to have a spa at home and to become a professional. She’s very grateful for the loan granted because she’ll be able to reach her goals with it.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Tural

texts.en: Tural is a 21-year-old dentist who just graduated from university and has a diploma in dentistry.  He is single and has two years of practice in this field. He opened his dentistry office a year ago and already can generate income from it, about 250 AZN per month. He has a lot of clients because he is very accurate and friendly towards his clients. Now he has applied for 600 AZN to purchase newer tools and improve the quality of his work. This will be his 2nd loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase newer tools and improve the quality of his work.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 31 años es una mujer alegre. Vive junto a Edson, su esposo desde hace 11 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Kevin, Cristian y Joseph a los que cuida en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Intihuatana. Su trabajo se centra en lo artístico. Ellos incursionaron en el alquiler de vestuarios de diferentes danzas originales del país. Además su esposo trabaja como instructor de danza por lo que brindan un servicio completo. Ya que las personas que llega a su taller, también requieren los servicios de su esposo. Los meses donde tiene más acogida son en mayo y junio. Le va muy bien en su negocio, pues ella misma elabora las prendas para los bailes, con la creatividad que posee realiza muy buenos y hermosos vestuarios. Además ganan un dinero extra con la costura de ropa, pues sus vecinas conocedoras de las manos prodigiosas que posee, también llevan sus prendas para que ella arregle. Ahora desea mejorar su tienda con vestuarios nuevos y llamativos. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Norma, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales como: telas, hilos, encajes, blondas y demás adornos para realizar sus vestuarios.
texts.en:
31-year-old Norma is a cheerful woman.  She lives together with Edson, her husband of 11 years.  The couple have three children: Kevin, Cristian and Joseph, who they care for in a rental house which is located in the town of Intihuatana.  Norma's work is artistic.  She started hiring out clothes which are used in different national dances.  In addition, her husband works as a dance instructor, so they provide a complete service as the people who come to her workshop also need her husband's services.  Their busiest months are May and June.  Norma's business is doing very well.  She makes the garments for the dances herself.  With her creativity, she makes very nice, beautiful clothes.  She also earns extra money sewing clothes as her neighbors, knowing that she is incredibly talented with her hands, also bring their clothes to her for mending.  Norma would like to improve her store with new, eye-catching outfits.

This is Norma's sixth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your support so that she can carry out her plans.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she has with her previous loans.  Norma enjoys being a member of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  With your support, Norma will invest the money she has requested in buying materials such as fabric, threads, lace, edging materials and other decorative items for making her outfits.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, lace and edging materials

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Richel is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Richel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Richel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Richel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Maria Barbara

texts.es: Con su nuevo credikiva, Maria comprará refrescos y bebidas, además invertirá en adecuaciones locativas, para deleitarse brindando a sus clientes todo lo que les gusta y en un ambiente confortable. Ella envia el siguiente saludo a sus financiadores: " Un saludo especial y muchas gracias a todos las personas que a través de su apoyo económico hacen posible la financiación de nuestros negocios". Con su anterior credikiva preparó nuevos alimentos y compró refrescos y bebidas que vendiendolas, le ayudaron a incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: With her new Kiva loan, Maria will buy soda and other drinks.  She will also invest in making structural changes to her business so that she can provide her customers with everything they enjoy in a comfortable environment.  Maria sends the following greeting to her lenders: "A special greeting and many thanks to all the people who, through their financial support, are helping to finance our businesses".  Maria used her previous Kiva loan to prepare new food.  She also bought soda and other drinks to sell.  This helped her to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy soda and other drinks, and to invest in making structural changes to her business

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en:
Ashkhen was born in 1961; she is a widow and lives alone in Azatamut village, Ijevan area. Ashkhen's three daughters are already married and now she has four grandchildren.

For a long time Ashkhen was a worker at different factories, but since 2002 Ashkhen has been running her own shop, where she sells food, household goods and children's clothes. She says it's very hard to manage the business single-handedly, but she doesn't complain about it, and Ashkhen is very proud that she was able to bring up three children, educate them and organize their weddings thanks to her business. 

Like her first Kiva loan, now Ashkhen wants to increase her shop assortment before the New Year's holidays. Now she is asking for a 300,000 AMD loan to buy various beverages, foods, confectionery, canned food and household goods for her shop.

loans.use: to buy various beverages, foods, confectionery, canned food and household goods for her shop.

loans.name: Blanca Hortencia

texts.es:
Blanca Hortensia  tiene 21 años es soltera, vive con sus padres. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Blanca Hortensia  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte.
texts.en:
21-year-old Blanca Hortensia is single and lives with her parents. She lives in Recinto Aguas de Mocache, in Cantón Mocache.

The communal bank 'El Progreso' is located in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, this bank supports agricultural work such as planting short-cycle maize, rice.

Blanca Hortensia grows corn and rice on her own land. She buys her goods in Mocache sells the crops in Mocache market. She has requested the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and manure for her crops. The loan will help to increase her family's income and allow her to invest in planting crops. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

In her free time, Blanca enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos

loans.name: Khamisi

texts.en: Khamisi owns a retail shop in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He took a loan, which helped him start the business one year ago. Khamisi is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock, e.g. bread, soap etc. The main challenges Khamisi faces are price fluctuations and some clients not paying on time. He looks forward to establishing a wholesale business. He will save the additional income from the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more retail stock such as bread, soap, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 53 years old and is a married woman with a 6-year-old child. She is engaged in fish selling. Her husband, who is a fisherman, operates their fishing boat. Delia sells her husband's catch at the market and also buys more fish from other fishermen. She also sells crabs. Each month, Delia earns about 7,000 PHP from this business.

Delia has asked for a loan to purchase fish nets, hooks, and crab traps. Delia hopes for this loan to help increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets, hooks, and crab traps

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es muy conocida en su lugar de vivienda ya que desde muy pequeño ha residido  ahí, vive junto a su esposa e hijos quienes le ayudan con el negocio. Él se dedica a la siembra de  maíz y frijoles, un negocio muy rentable en su lugar de vivienda, ya que cuenta con varios clientes quienes siempre compran sus productos. Mercedes es muy responsable y trabajador con deseos de mejorar su trabajo, él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para comprar insumos para realizar la limpia a los frijoles ya cultivados, y debido a que la cantidad es bastante grande también invertirá en mano de obra para realizar esta actividad. Con esto Mercedes logrará sacar su trabajo más rápido lo cual lo beneficiará mucho y así mismo beneficiará a otras personas brindándoles empleo temporal.
texts.en: Mercedes is very well known in the place where he lives, since he has lived there since he was very young. He lives with his wife and children, who help him with the business. He plants corn and beans, a very profitable business in the area where he lives, since he has a number of customers who always buy his products. Mercedes is very responsible and hard working, with the desire to improve his work. He is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to pay for the supplies to clean the beans that are already planted, and since the amount is big enough, he will also invest in labor to do this. With this Mercedes will be able to do this work more rapidly, which will help him a lot, and at the same time it will benefit other people by offering them seasonal employment.

loans.use: pay for labor to clean his beans

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Although Florence has received some formal education as a middle school-leaver, she is a petty trader in Elmina. She specializes in selling bags of rice and sachet water. She has been involved in this enterprise for many years. 

Florence is divorced and has five children. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her cover the family’s general expenses and pay for the children’s school fees. 

She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of sachet water and rice for sale to aid her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of sachet water and rice for sale.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es una joven de 28 años, nació en la provincia Andres Ibáñez de Santa Cruz de la Sierra – Bolivia, trabaja como administradora en un Minimarket, lo que le ha permitido encontrar su vocación y elección por la carrera de Administración de Empresas; para concluir sus estudios solicita un crédito educativo ya que los ingresos que genera solo le alcanzan para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.

Marleny se siente motivada al ver que cada paso que da y cada decisión que toma, le acercan cada vez más a alcanzar sus sueños que es tener su propio negocio y así de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor motivación son sus padres ya que ellos tuvieron que luchar para salir adelante en la vida, por solo el hecho de no tener los suficientes recursos económicos para poder estudiar y ser profesionales. 

Marileny se siente muy agradecida y satisfecha porque ve cerca la culminación de una de sus metas que es de salir profesional. Menciona además que el mejor dinero invertido es el que uno da sin esperar nada a cambio, ese que ayuda a los que no tienen, a tener una vida más digna y con mejores oportunidades.

loans.use: para pagar la carrera de Administración de Empresas

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Ayoko est une femme mariée résidant à Baguiuda avec cinq enfants à charge. Ayoko est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Ayoko  nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leurs enfants.

loans.use: Acheter 09 sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert W. is a dedicated and talented young artist who joined Life in Africa in 2005. He was very excited to join since LiA offered him the opportunity to develop and use his artistic talent as well as to earn an income. He proved to be a fast learner and very quickly earned a job with the Invisible Children Bracelet project where he works as a sander.

This income is very important to him. He is just a young man but when his father died he was the oldest and it was up to him to take over the responsiblity for his mother and younger siblings. He tried at first to do this by selling his artwork. He quickly found that selling art is not like selling food or charcoal which are needed on a daily basis. Art is more of a luxury and this made their life very difficult. But he is determined to do right for his family and he came up with a plan.

His plan is to cash in on the high demand for decent housing by building three rooms to rent out. He and his brothers have worked very hard and have made 7000 bricks by hand that are now ready to be fired. He knows that once this project is complete the income will greatly improve their lives and will insure that there is sufficent money for school fees and medicine for his younger siblings. He is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000 which will fire the bricks and build the house up to the beams. He will be able to repay this loan in 10 ,months.

His budget is as indicated below:

Burning Bricks --------- Ushs.150,000

Cement 10 bags --------- Ushs.190,000

Sand 2 trips --------- Ushs.160,000

 Concrete stones -------- Ushs.100,000

Tranport --------- Ushs. 60,000

Water --------- Ushs.20,000

 Labour --------- Ushs.100,000

Incidentals --------- Ushs. 20,000

Total --------- Uhs.800,000

He wants to repay this loan in 10 months and his expenses verses income is 100,000.

WE Team to Benefit: Internet4change

loans.use: Buying material for building setting up rental rooms.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Recently married without children Christina’s husband doesn’t work. They live with her husband’s extended family, a normal practice in Samoa. Christina believes in independence and wanted to set up a business to provide a good future for her husband and her self. With no children she wanted to start saving and building a good stable home before children arrive into the picture. So she joined the programme in 2003. Her first loan was used to start a small grocery store, which was operated from at home. The only grocery shop in her neighborhood Christina was able to use the following loans to build a permanent place for the shop in front of their home. Being the sole breadwinner of the family, she carefully budgets her earnings to sustain her family needs and set aside some cash for savings and loan payment. It is quite difficult for her to support an extended family but expanding her grocery will help ease her burden. Christina hopes to use her loan to improve her small grocery store and purchase more stocks.

loans.use: To improve existing grocery store and purchase additional stocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Manufactures beads.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru:
Sanavbar K. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 4 years. She has been in business for no less than 10 years. She is married and has 3 children. Her children are in college. Sanavbar K. began her business by selling clothing for men. She buys her goods in Bishkek. She asks for $300 loan to increase the volume of the goods sold.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Санавбар, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 4 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 10 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Дети учатся в ВУЗ-х. Свою деятельность начала с продажи мужской одежды. За товаром ездит в Бишкек. Ей необходимо 300$ для увеличения товарооборота.

loans.use: To increase the volume of the goods sold

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia is divorced. She has an 8 year old son and a little daughter who is not yet a year old. She started selling shoes by catalog 2 years ago. At the time, her plan was to help her husband with the household expenses, but family problems presented themselves later, and she divorced her husband and found herself alone with full responsibility for her two children. In order to give them all that they need, Amalia has continued with her business and has incorporated cheese sales into her work, which has yielded very good results.

Moving her family ahead has required all of Amalia's effort but her love for her children motivates her to improve her business every day. She is now applying for a loan of $925 with which she will buy merchandise, with the aim to offer a wider variety of shoes to her clients. She commits to repaying the loan in 6 months. Be an important part of this business. Decide to support her.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Amalia es divorciada, tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad y una pequeña de apenas un año. Ella inició con la venta de calzado por catálogo hace dos años, en ese momento fue para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pero después se presentaron muchos problemas familiares, se divorció y quedó sola a cargo de sus dos pequeños, para poder darles todo lo necesario Amalia ha continuado con su negocio y ha incorporado la venta de quesos donde ha recibido muy buenos resultados.
