Para sacar adelante a sus hijos Amalia ha tenido que esforzarse mucho pero el amor hacia sus pequeños la impulsa a mejorar cada día. Ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecerles una mayor variedad de calzado a sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante de este negocio, decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Business Description

Carlos started his business five years ago. He sells breakfast, lunch, and fried foods. He attends clients personally every day from 6 to 3.

Loan Use

Carlos needs the loan in order to buy materials and furniture so that he can fix and improve his business. He will also buy the ingredients that he needs in order to make his delicious dishes. This way he can offer a new image and a more diverse menu to his clients.

Personal Information

Carlos is 58 years old. His wife works with him in the business. They have a 16 year old son that is studying. Carlos started his business with his savings. His business is located in his home. He wishes to improve his business and keep on fighting in order to sustain his family with his own work.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Carlos inicio su negocio hace 5 años. Los productos que vende son: desayunos, almuerzos y fritadas. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 6-a -3pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Carlos necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales, muebles para arreglar y acondicionar de mejor manera su local. También adquirir productos básicos para la preparación de sus deliciosos platos. De esta manera ofrecer nueva imagen y variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Carlos tiene 58 años. Tiene 1 hijo de 16 años que estudia. Con su esposa trabajan juntos en el negocio. Carlos inicio con un pequeño capital ahorrado .Su negocio ocupa parte de su vivienda. Anhela mejorar su negocio y seguir luchando y mantenerse de su propio trabajo.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, furniture and ingredients to improve his business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia U. is 26 years old; she lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells drinks and has been in this business since 2006. She is in need of US$250 to enable her buy more drinks for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. wants to open up a new business alongside the existing one (a restaureant) to improve her income level.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To invest in another business venture

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Irma is married to a cattle rancher and together they have two children. The children are dependent on her and her husband because they are still attending school. In order to help pay the bills, Maria began her own drug store in 1992 with a loan she took out with her mother from Fundación Paraguaya. Quickly her pharmacy became very important and well known in the town and sales rose quickly.

She thanks the loan from the Fundación because it gave her an increase in her business, the ability to send her children to school and gave her an all around increase in the quality of life for her and her family. Now 15 years after that initial loan, she is asking for another loan to continue to increase in the size and quality of her business. With the loan she will buy more goods and medications for her drug store.

loans.use: To buy medications.

loans.name: Nasihat

texts.en:
Nasihat Toshamtova sells fruit, like apples, pears, and oranges, in the market of the Asht region, a remote area of Tajikistan. She usually purchases the fruit wholesale from the central market of Khujand in the center of  northern Tajikistan. She has run her business for eleven years. The business is stable and allows Nasihat to make a considerable contribution to the family budget.

IMON has made loans to Nasihat since 2005 and she has demonstrated herself to be a reliable client. She will use this loan to buy a wider variety of fruit to sell.

Nasihat is 47 years old. She is married with three school-age children. Nasihat promises to be precise in her loan payment and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Purchase fruits to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Y. is a 53-year-old widow who earns $1.67 per day renting music and movie CDs in Sre Village of Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Y. has seven children, four of whom are married and two of whom are students. Her son, Mr. Oeun Sokthy, is a 20 year-old construction worker earning $3 per day.  Mrs. Y. works hard everyday In order to support her large family, and now requests a loan of $500 to buy a plowing machine. With this machine, she can earn money by plowing for her neighbors

loans.use: To purchase  a plowing machine

loans.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.es:
Mrs. Bertha and her husband are in the taxi business. They have been in this business for the past two years after they sold some land and bought a car with which they provide their taxi services. Both of them dedicate a lot of time and effort to their business, and they want at some point to change their car for a newer one. That is why they have started to save some money so that at some point in the future they will be able to buy a new car. Mrs. Bertha is 44 years old. She lives in the neighborhood of Monseñor Lezcano, and has an 11 year old son who is currently studying. She asks for a loan in order to change the roof of her house (currently it is made out of tile and she would like to make it out of zinc).

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Bertha junto a su esposo se dedican al negocio de TAXI, tienen 2 años de pertenecer a este negocio, el cual empezaron cuando vendieron un terreno y compraron un vehículo para usarlo en el servicio de Taxi. A mbos dedican mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a este trabajo, desean cambiar su automóvil por uno más actual es por eso que empezaran a ahorrar de sus ganancias, para en un futuro poder comprarse un auto más moderno. Doña Bertha tiene 44 años de edad, habita en Monseñor Lezcano y tiene un hijo de 11 años quien se encuentra estudiando. Requiere del préstamo para cambiar el techo de su casa, actualmente es de tejas y quiere cambiarlo a zinc.

loans.use: To change the roof of her house

loans.name: Noy

texts.en:
Mrs. Noy M., 45, and her husband, Mr. Phun Kheav, 56, were married in 1993 and have eight children, five sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married, one of whom lives outside the family home. Two of their sons are construction workers and the other three children are in school. The youngest son stays at home. Phun has been fishing and growing rice since 1979. The family is about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Noy has been growing rice since 1979. The commodity's increasing price makes this a good time for her to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides as well as pay for the plowing of her rice field.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides, and pay for rice field plowing.

loans.name: Pin

texts.en:
Mrs. Pin V. E., 52, is an oxen merchant, working together with her husband. They travel around and purchase oxen, then resell the cattle for profit. Their combined income is approximately $8.80 per day. The couple has four children, two of whom are married. They live in Oreang Village, Kampong Thom Province.

They are requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase their working capital for their oxen business. The loan will allow them to have increased flexibility in the quantity of oxen which they purchase. They hope that the loan will allow them to expand their business and thereby increase their household income.

loans.use: To increase the working capital for their business buying and selling oxen

loans.name: Kari Marina

texts.es:
Mrs. Sanoval is the owner of a small grocery store located in her house. She has more than 8 years running her business. She lives in her own house and has three children, two are currently in high school and one in primary school, all attending private schools. Her partner works as a used car salesman, and he helps with the support of the children. She lives in the 1 Mayo region.

Her business is directly managed by her and her adolescent chidlren. Her sales are carried out in cash and on credit to the people in the area.

Her living conditions are such that her house is made of cement blocks and the floor is made of bricks. 

Her greatest dream is to expand her business to offer more products.  This way she will be able to acquire more goods for her children and provide them with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora sanoval, es propietaria de una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitación, teniendo mas de 8 años de tener dicho negocio, vive en casa propia tiene tres hijos, actualmente dos cursan secundaria y uno primaria, en colegios privados, su compañero trabaja como vendedor de autos usados, quien le ayuda en la manutencion de los hijos, ella vive en el reparto primero de mayo.
En cuanto su negocio es atendido directamente por ella y sus hijos adolescentes, sus ventas son de contado y credito a personas del sector.
En cuanto a sus condicones de vida su casa es de bloque y zinc, piso de ladrillo.

Su mayor sueño, es ampliar su negocio y poder ofertar mas productos, así como poder adquirir otros bienes para sus hijos y darles mejores condiciones.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Née en 1929 à Aklakou, Madame D. Ayélé est revendeuse de gâteau depuis 30 ans. Elle est mariée et a deux personnes à charge qu’elle entretient avec le maigre bénéfice qu’elle tire de son activité.

Actuellement, sa clientèle a presque quadruplé mais sa capacité de production de gâteau reste constante en raison du faible fonds de commerce dont elle dispose. Pour sortir sa famille du seuil de pauvreté, elle décide d’augmenter sa capacité de production aux fins de maximiser de bénéfice en satisfaisant toute sa clientèle.

Pour y parvenir, elle sollicite un prêt devant lui servir également de fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Born in 1929 in Aklakou, Mrs. Ayélé D. has been selling cakes for 30 years. She is married and has two dependents whom she supports with the meager profits she makes from her business.

Currently, her clientele has almost quadrupled, but her cake production has not changed due to her small operating budget. To improve her family's poverty-level status, she has decided to increase her production capacity in order to increase profits while meeting the needs of all of her clients.

To achieve this, she is requesting a loan that will also provide her with working capital.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat flour and oil

loans.name: Marguérite

texts.fr: Dame K. Marguérite est née vers 1931 à Porto-Novo, la capitale administrative du Bénin. Actuellement elle est veuve et mère de deux enfants qui sont plus à sa charge. Elle a été le chef quartier de Djidjè où elle vit et vend des condiments depuis 30 ans. C'est pour varier les produits qu'elle vend et satisfaire davantage ses clients qu'elle  sollicite ce prêt. Elle est à son septième prêt à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ms. Marguérite K. was born around 1931 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. Currently, she is a widow and the mother of two children, who are no longer in her care. She has been the district head of Djidjè, where she lives and has been selling condiments for thirty years. Varying the products she sells and satisfying her customers more are the reasons why she is requesting this loan. She is on her seventh loan with Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of corn, a basket of tomatoes, and a drum of peanut oil

loans.name: Mim

texts.en: Mrs. Mim M. was born in 1963 and she now lives in Chan Teab Village in Takeo Province. She is a grocer and her husband, Mr. Nop Klot, is a farmer. Although they have different businesses, they cannot support their family well. Thus, Mrs. Mim M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income after her cow has been sold. Mrs. Mim M. has three children who are all enrolled in the local school. Her husband is present in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Los Responsables Group

texts.es: LOS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO LOS RESPONSABLES  REPRESENTADOS POR LA SEÑORA MIRIAM SON GENTE QUE  SE CONOCEN YA QUE RECIDEN EN EL MISMO BARRIO. ELLOS SE GARANTIZAN Y SE COMPROMETEN EN PAGAR  LAS CUOTAS PUNTUALMENTE Y A QUE TIENEN EXPERIENCIA TRABAJANDO CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS. TODAS LOS MIEMBROS DEL GRUPO TIENEN SUS PEQUEÑOS NEGOCIOS D. LOS QUE OBTIENEN SUS INGRESOS COMO SER LA VENTA D. ROPA, VENTA D. PRODUCTOS PARA EL HOGAR Y COMESTIBLES, PRODUCTOS COSMESTICO, VENTA D. COMIDA Y  ALGUNOS POSEEN CENTROS D. INTERNET .COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA PERO TODOS ELLOS DESEAN SUPERASE EN SU NEGOCIO.EL GRUPO LOS RESPONSABLES MANIFIESTA QUE EL CRÉDITO OTORGADO POR AGROCAPITAL SERÁ DESTINADO PARA AUMENTAR INSUMOS A SU NEGOCIO Y MEJORAR EN LA CALIDAD D. SUS PRODUCTOS.LA MAYORIA D. LOS SOCIOS TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN SUS RUBROS Y CAPACIDAD PARA ADMINISTRAR EL CAPITAL OBTENIDO.
texts.en:
The group members of "Los Responsables" (The Responsible Ones) are neighborhood friends and are represented by Mrs. Miriam. They back each other up, are committed to pay the payments on time, and have experience working within solidarity groups. All of the group members have their own small businesses, which serve as their income, such as selling clothes, housewares, cosmetics, food, and some have internet centers. As in all business there exists the competitiveness of supply and demand, but all of them wish to excel in their business. The group "Los Responsables" assert that the loan received from Agrocapital will be used to augment raw materials for their business and improve the quality of their products. The majority of the members are experienced in their businesses and are capable of administering the capital obtained.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is married to Reynaldo N., who is a farmer and a public servant in their village. She is a member of Green Ladies' Association, a group that advocates for the clean and green program. Pacita sees to it that she can help her fellow villagers as best she can when crises arises.They live in a village that is a relatively agricultural area where corn and rice grow in the mountainside of the village.

With the help of her husband, Pacita sells banana cue on sticks, banana sweets, and sometimes, when she has extra time, she processes banana chips and sells them in front of the elementary school in their village. In order to increase her profits, she needs additional products to sell to her customers. She can only do that if she can borrow Php5,000.  

Moreover, she thinks that selling fish, after she has sold all of her banana products, can also bring her income. The increased capital will definitely earn her more profits and, therefore, more savings for her family's future.  She expects that her weekly net income will be as high as Php1,500, if her plans would come true.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Teresa Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresa Jesús P. V. tiene 53 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal  Las Emprendedoras y vive en la calle Libertad 657 del Puerto  Marítimo de Salaverry de la provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió Nutrición en el Instituto Superior Tecnológico y se casó  a los 21 años, ahora tiene 4 hijos y se separó del esposo. Dos de sus hijos son estudiantes y dependen de ella.
Trabaja en la Municipalidad del Puerto, pero como es una mujer luchadora también hace negocio, vende productos de Unique, en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas compró ofertas de uniqué para obtener stock.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, lo invertirá en comprar ofertas de Navidad y ropa.
Teresa sueña con tener una gran tienda para la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Teresa Jesús P. V. is 53 years old, and she belongs to the Banco Comunal Las Emprendadoras. She lives at Calle Libertad 657 in the Puerto Marítimo de Salaverry in the Trujillo province, departemento de La Libertad, Perú. She studied nutrition at the Instituto Superior Tecnológico. She married at age 21. She has four children, he is now separated from her husband. Two of her sons are students and depend on her. She works in the Municipalidad del Puerto (the municipal governing board for the port), but because she is a strong woman, she also runs her own business, selling cosmetics from her home.

With her first loan of 300 soles, paid off in four installments, Teresa purchased cosmetics at sale prices to increase her stock. With this loan of 1200 soles, which will be paid off in six installments, she will invest in Christmas items and clothing for her to sell along with her cosmetics. Teresa dreams of someday owning a big store that she could sell her products in.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de diversos productos navideños y prendas de vestir para la venta.

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.en:
Bahriniso Z. is 53 years old. She is a very wise and hard-working woman. She is married, with three children. This entrepreneur dedicates herself to the sale of clothing for women: jackets, sweaters, suits, skirts, etc. She started her business 5 years ago. Little by little, she has expanded her inventory, and thanks to the good service she offers, her business is growing rapidly. She says that with income from her business she is able to provide education and food for her children.

Now Bahriniso needs a loan of 1200 USD which she will use to buy clothing in order to fulfill her customers' orders. She is committed to paying back this loan in 12 months. This is the time to help someone who needs it. Please do not hesitate to help improve the quality of life of this family!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seasonal clothing for teenagers for sale

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma  inició el negocio porqué su esposo es pescador y en las temporadas de veda, que son muy largas, se quedaba sin trabajar y el dinero que guardaba no les alcanzaba para sobrevivir todo ese tiempo, por lo que decidío apoyarlo iniciando su negocio de promotora de calzado.  Comenzó el negocio en Junio de 2003 gracias a que una compañera con la cual solicito un crédito, vio la necesidad que ella tenía de obtener un ingreso para apoyar a su esposo y le comentó que ella era promotora de calzado, fue entonces que la acompañó a pedir informes y le pareció un buen negocio por lo que se decidío a trabajar en esto.    

En los casi seis años que tiene dedicandose a esta actividad ha aumentado considerablemente su cartera de clientes por lo que en la actualidad ya maneja un número importante lo cual le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $10,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas  para adquirir más mercancía que le permitirá atender mejor los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Irma has a business selling shoes. She began her business because her husband is a fisherman and they were never able to save enough money to cover their expenses during the long off-season when he was unemployed. A friend recognized her need for additional income and encouraged her to seek a loan to start her business.

Irma began her business in June 2003, and in the almost seven years since she has greatly increased her client base, which has enabled her to increase her income. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Mexican pesos (US $700), to be repaid in 10 installments, to purchase more merchandise to better meet her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en:
Flordelis A. is a vendor who sells fish, which she buys from fishermen in her village.  She delivers them to her regular buyers and earns enough money to cover daily family expenses.

She is 52 years old and has 3 children.  Aside from fish, she dreamed of having another business.  In the future she wants to have a small store so she can give more support to her family.

Flordelis is asking for a loan of 15,000PHP from CEVI.  She will use the loan to buy additional fish nets, bait and to repair her boat.  Fishing is her only means of livelihood. The loan will truly help Flordelis sustain her business and start a new business.

CEVI helps its clients start and have their own business. They give them credit, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, bait and repair her boat

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia LUCILA; nació en la provincia de Calca, ella tiene 55 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos de ( 30, 27, 24, 16) años de edad.

La socia alterna sus labores de ama de casa con la actividad del comercio  minorista, ella tiene en sus casa un pequeño negocio, vende platos típicos y chicha, la chicha es una bebida a base de maíz macerado; para lo que nuestra socia necesita el capital de trabajo lo cual le permitirá implementar su pequeño negocio y comprar maíz, e insumos básicos.

La socia Lucila agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este nuestro medio y  se compromete al pago del mismo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Lucila was born in the province of Calca. She is 55 years old, married and has four children, aged 30, 27, 24, and 16.

Lucila alternates her work as a housewife with retail trade. She has a small store in her house. She sells traditional dishes and chica, which is a fermented corn drink. For this, Lucila needs capital that will allow her to set up her store and buy corn and basic ingredients and materials.

Lucila is grateful for this loan and promises to pay it back within the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling traditional dishes and chicha

loans.name: Ni Made Mey Arianti

texts.en:
"Mey Arianti - (DNR.M-0636) is a 35 year-old female living in the town of Dsn. Pangkung Liplip, Ds Kalikah.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Mey Arianti owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Mey Arianti has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 900,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2008, Mey Arianti joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve  his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mey Arianti has successfully repaid a previous loan of 450,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.  Mey Arianti is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Mey Arianti plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Mey Arianti - (DNR.M-0636) merupakan 35 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Dsn. Pangkung Liplip, Ds Kalikah.  Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Mey Arianti memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor ritel.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuka toko umum.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual produk makanan & barang kebutuhan sehari-hari di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Mey Arianti sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Mey Arianti menghasilkan sekitar 900,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2008, Mey Arianti bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Mey Arianti meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli peralatan & perkakas baru untuk mengembangkan bisnis.  Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli produk tambahan untuk dijual.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Mey Arianti berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fakhraddin

texts.en: Fakhraddin was born in 1966 and is married with two children. They live in the village of Zardabi in the Guba region. He has been in the dairy business for six years.  He needs a loan to buy two cows to build up his dairy business.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Reyna De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Reyna de los Ángeles R. F., tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio , Juan Ramón Padilla en el municipio de Ticuantepe  junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo cinco hijos , dos de ellos trabajan y son casados y tres están a su cargo , los pequeños actualmente estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ella desde hace diez años , tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación , ya que esta al pendiente de sus pequeños y la vez trabajando . Con el financiamiento ella va a incrementar su negocio comprando granos básicos, lácteos, carnes para ofertar a sus clientes variedad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna de los Angeles R. F. is 36 years old and lives in the neighborhood Juan Ramon Padilla, in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband, who works to assist with the household expenses. They have five children two of them work and are married but they are in charge of the other three who are small and go to school. Their plans are to improve their family conditions of life. She has had a grocery shop in her residence for the last ten years. She can take care of her children while she works. She is asking for a loan to buy grains, dairy and meats to offer more variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains, dairy and meats .

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es: El señor José Humberto B., tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio , junto a su esposa , la cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas y las actividades del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo tres hijos, de 19,18,15 años, todos estudiante de secundaria y en tiempos libres le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 20 años don José se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo .Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar el cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha. Da las gracia Afodenic por la facilidad de pago y por las proyecciones que esta logrando con los financiamiento.
texts.en:
José Humberto B. is 49 years old and lives in the San Caralampio neighbourhood with his wife who helps him with the farm and house work. They have three children who are 19, 18 and 15 years old; they all attend secondary school and help out on the farm in their free time. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions.
José has worked in agriculture for 20 years and crop infestations have been the biggest problem. He will purchase fertilisers and supplies that will produce a good harvest. He thanks Afodenic for their easy repayment terms and for giving him the financing that is helping him achieve his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilisers for his crops

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en: Kamila S., 26, is single and has one child. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people two days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 180 Tala (~$120 USD). SPBD loans are Kamila’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use the loan to purchase items such as weed killing spray, chemicals, bush knives, planting instruments, and an axe for her plantation.

loans.use: Purchase weed killing spray, chemicals, bush knives, planting instruments, and an ax

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Ana Julia M. se dedica a laborar arduamente en su actividad de venta de frutas y verduras y esencialmente la venta de naranjas comercializadas a diario en el mercado. 

Debido a que a diario son muchos los clientes que visitan el Mercado, ella decidió acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las naranjas con el propósito de ofrecerlas en sus hermosos canastos y así satisfacer la petición de los clientes que le visitan.
texts.en:
Ana Julia M. Works arduously selling fruits, vegetables, and especially oranges. She sells daily in the market. Because so many customers visit the market every day, she decided to ask Ceprodel for a loan to buy oranges. She will sell them in her pretty baskets and satisfy the requests from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma M. is a woman with a M.. This 63-year-old married mother of six adult children works very hard to help support her family by selling fish door to door in her community. Norma has been running her business for the last twenty years. Although she is getting old, she persists as long as she is able to carry her baskets of fish because it is a great help to their family as it earns her an average profit of PHP 3,000 per month. The PHP 15,000 that Norma is borrowing for her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon will allow her to buy more fish to sell around her community. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lita

texts.es: La señora Lita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de Guadalupe II”, Distrito de Bagua Grande, Provincia Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es conviviente, tiene 38 años tiene 2 hijos, 01 varón y 01 mujer,  todos aun en etapa escolar.  Lita, es una mujer muy jovial, alegre y optimista que se inicio  gracias a la ayuda de sus amigas  quienes fueron sus primeras clientas, viendo que si le hacían los pedidos es que se animó a hacerlo ahora cuenta con buena clientela,  ella vende  aprovecha las ofertas para hacerse de sus productos y venderlos  precio de catálogo y poder ganar mas.En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada, ella vende al contado y al crédito con pagos de manera diaria, semanal quincenal o mensual.Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00, comprará productos de belleza como colonias, esmaltes, bijuoteria  como aretes, collares y anillos, así como perfumes para varón que salen en ofertas, quiere tener surtido su negocio y dar una buena  atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. Lita, sueña con crecer en este negocio y llegar a ser una vendedora estrella para ganar buenos premios. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.

loans.use: Comprará productos de catalogo, para aumentar su stock.

loans.name: Sayuni Group

texts.en:
Nashivai is a member of the Sayuni borrower group in Sakina, Arusha. She is 40 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 5 children. Her children are 20,19,15,12 and 9 years old.

Nashivai has owned a food business selling  vegetable for 8 years. She works 12  hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 170,000 Tanzanian  shillings.

This is Nashivai first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she quested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more fruits and vegetable for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Nashivai hopes to save money and expand her business.


Magreth and Luciana are also the same member of the same borrower group, they also requested the loan amount 150,000 each one in order to expand their crops  business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetable

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
Agatha J., a 36-year-old widow with three children, buys rice by the bag and sells by the cup to the residents of West Point. Agatha talks to her customers politely and sells her rice in a bigger cup – other vendors sells in a little smaller cup than hers and that’s the secret to her business success. Agatha started her business with a small amount of money given to her by her late husband’s family and this has been the only source of income for her family for more than three years.

Agatha and her children have been struggling with a little help from family and friends. Her children are between 1 and 6 years old, in nursery school through 2nd grade respectively. Agatha did not complete high school because she lacked financial support when she was younger; she had no choice but to drop out of her 9th grade class. She lives and works in West Point, close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia. West Point is a very crowded community where life is very hard. As a result of hardship and poverty, the crime rate is very high; therefore, most people living there wish they could afford to relocate. 

Agatha's business enables her to feed and care for her children. She dreams of giving her children a better education, feeding them on time and giving them good medical attention. She is aiming to establish a big rice store in the future. Agatha needs this loan to be able to purchase rice wholesale so she can serve her customers.

United Women is a group of five borrowers led by Agatha J..

loans.use: To purchase rice wholesale

loans.name: Luz Divina 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the group coordinator of the group Luz Divina (Divine Light). Her story is representative of the other members of her group as well as of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whome recently moved from Haiti to the DR) clients more generally. Rosa's group is based in the industrial town of Los Alcarrizzos, a dusty city north of the capital where both running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home in a simple structure of cement walls and a tin roof with her husband and five school aged children. Her business is also located in her home.

Rosa has shown herself to be a reliable Esperanza client by completing one loan cycle with out problems. She is excited to take her next loan and with it she plans to invest in her business by purchasing a hair dryer, curling iron and hair products to sell in her store. She believes this will improve her profits and with those profits she plans to purchase school supplies for her children and hopefully a computer so that they will be able to learn about technology. In the future she hopes that God will help lead her children down the correct path and that He will bless her with the ability to provide for her children what they need. She tanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Hair dryer and hair products

loans.name: Mayi

texts.en:
Mayi is 28 years old and married with three children aged between 5 and 10 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she is staying with five people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Mayi takes care of additional family members.

Mayi owns a restaurant in Makerere Kikoni and pays for transport costs to and from shopping. Mayi works six days a week. On average she receives 20 customers a day. She works on the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for four years and with MCDT eight years, and she is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group-mates.

Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and buying medications. Her challenges include defaulters and increasing costs of foodstuffs. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow stronger and starting selling on a wholesale basis only.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: En'am

texts.en: En'am is 41 years old and married with 8 children. She is a tailor. En'am loves her work and has several loyal customers.Today she needs the loan amount of US$ 3000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sustain and develop her tailoring business. She is grateful to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has been married to her husband Ronie for 24 years now. She is 40 years old and takes care of her eight children. The oldest of her kids is now 23. She invested in rice farming. She is more than happy to share that her last harvest was good. She hopes to double up her harvest this time.

As a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., she applied for a loan of PHP9,000. She will use this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and other items that will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
el sr. Sebastian M. tiene 64 años de edad, vive en la Aldea El Comercio de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, Sebastian es un sr. de edad y este es el unico trabajo que puede realizar para ganarse la vida.
Sebastian esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas su pulperia ya que en estos momentos no tiene mucha variedad de productos.
Sebastian vive con su esposa y los dos pasan felices en su hogar.
cuando Sebastian tiene que salir a comprar alguna mercaderia para su negocio, su esposa se queda al cuidado del negocio.
esta es la unica fuente de ingresos de los dos.
su meta es poder acondicionar mejor su negocio y tenerlo bien surtido.
texts.en:
Sebastian M. is 64 years old. He lives in Aldea El Comercio, in the city of San Lorenzo. He sells products for popular consumption. He has a general store in his home. Sebastian is a senior, and this is the only job that he can do to earn a living.

Sebastian is requesting a loan to stock up his store, which currently doesn’t have a large variety of products.

Sebastian lives with his wife, and they are both happy in their home.

When Sebastian has to go out to buy some merchandise for his business, his wife takes care of the business.

This is the only source of income between them.

His goal is to equip his store and have it well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toilet paper, corn and wheat flour, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, candles, soups, spaghetti, juices, sodas, sardines, chiles, salt, tortillas, cookies

loans.name: Teresa Lavis

texts.es:
La señora  TERESA LAVIS G. F. tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito De Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL ÉXITO II. La socia presenta estudios  hasta 4to de Secundaria, es  madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 depende de ella económicamente. La socia se dedica ha atender la tienda que tiene en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para la compra de arroz, azúcar, carne, pollos, verduras, menestras, aceite, papas, etc. para surtir su tienda.
Con este crédito de 1,000.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra de pollo, carne, atún, arroz, papas, menestras, leche, jugos, gaseosa, cerveza, etc. Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa Lavis G. F. is 49 years old and lives in the District of Trujillo, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Éxito II” (Women of Success II). Teresa completed her education through the fourth year of secondary school. She is a single mother of three children of whom one is still financially dependent on her. Teresa manages a store out of her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, she was able to buy rice, sugar, meat, chicken, vegetables, canned stew, potatoes, and other products to restock her store.

With this loan of 1000 soles, Teresa will buy chicken, meat, tuna, rice, potatoes, canned stew, milk, juices, sodas, beer, and other products. Her dream is to expand her business and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Humberto Javier

texts.es:
El Sr. L. Zuñiga Humberto Javier de 40 años de edad vive en casa de su madre él es soltero no tiene hijos por eso apoya a su madre en los gastos de la casa viven en San Miguel – Cercado de Ica.
El Sr. Se dedica desde hace 8 años al transporte antes trabajaba alquilando mototaxi pero actualmente cuneta con su unidad de transorte propia lo que le permite un mejor ingreso trabaja de lunes a domingo de 6:30 am hasta las 3:00 y de 4.30 ha 10.0pm.
El sr es bien responsable con su madre quien confia mucho en él  por que poco a poco ha logrado obtener sus bienes.
El goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos solicita el financiamiento para poder mejorar su unidad de trabajo ya que esta fallando un poco el motor.
Su sueño es poder lograr comprarse otras unidades y darlas a trabajar y asi él poder  iniciar un negocio que es lo que tiene proyectado.
texts.en:
L. Zuñiga Humberto Javier is 40 years old and lives in his mother's house. He is single and has no children but supports his mother with household expenses; they live in San Miguel in the province of Ica. For the past 8 years he has worked in transportation as a taxi driver; he used to rent a motorcycle taxi but now he has his own vehicle which provides him with a better income. He works from Monday to Sunday from 6:30 am to 3:00 pm and from 4:30 pm to 10:00 pm. He is very responsible as he takes care of his mother who depends on him as he has helped to provide for her over the years. He has received many good referrals from his neighbors. He is seeking a loan in order to fix his vehicle which is having some problems. His dream is to eventually purchases other vehicles that he can put to work in order to start his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in vehicle

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza es una noble mujer de 31 años, comparte su vida con su esposo, quien se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su motocarro. Tienen tres hijos; Astrid de 14, Yesenia de 8 y Hattius de 2 añitos de edad, además espera con ansias a Yamilet que nacerá en este mes.

Esta pareja, gracias a su esfuerzo lograron adquirir su casa propia y ahora juntos trabajan por el bienestar de su familia. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la atención de su tienda y poco a poco espera prosperar para darles una buena educación a sus hijos. A Esperanza le gusta mucho su trabajo y en la actualidad le beneficia mucho, ya que en su estado le permite seguir trabajando.
Felizmente tiene buenas ventas, debido a su gran carisma y personalidad, pues es muy conocida en su vecindario por ser conversadora y alguien en quien confiar, es por ello que algunas vecinas mientras realizan sus compras siempre se detienen un momento para conversar con ella.

Este es el doceavo préstamo de Esperanza con MFP y su experiencia ha hecho que ahora no tenga problemas con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita comprará más productos para bastecer su tienda y hacerla más atractiva a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a noble woman of 31 years of age. She shares her life with her husband, who offers transportation services in his three-wheeled van. They have three children: Astrid, who is 14, Yesenia, who is 8, and 2 year-old Hattius. They are also looking forward to the birth of Yamilet later this month.

This pair, thanks to their efforts, have been able to purchase their own home and are working together for the well-being of their family. For 5 years, Esperanza has been running her store and little by little she hopes to prosper and be able to offer a good education to her children. Esperanza likes her work very much and it is currently serving her well as long as she is able to keep working.

Happily, she has good sales - thanks to her great charisma and personality. She is very well know in her neighborhood for being chatty and someone to trust, which is why some neighbors always stop a moment to chat with her while they are doing their shopping.

This is the twelfth loan that Esperanza has had from MFP and her experience means that she will not have problems making her repayments. With the money that she borrows this time, she will buy more products to stock her store and make it more attractive to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her stock

loans.name: Celia Guillermina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Barrio Sucre se encuentra en la parroquiaCumbe al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la elaboracion de artesanias que son principalmente tejidos, bordado e hilado de lana de oveja, se confeccionan vestimentas, tambien se dedican a la agricultura para sacar adelante no solo su familia sino su población y formar parte del crecimiento económico familiar.

Celia V. es socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, es una socia que cada día lucha para tener un mejor porvenir, se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y  a la cría de cuyes, gallinas  que los vende en su misma comunidad o sale hasta la ciudad de Cuenca para realizar su venta, esta actividad lo realiza hace varios años ya que sus padres le inculcaron esta labor.

Ahora se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo con su banco comunal y  fue gracias a una sobrina que la invito a formar parte de este hermoso grupo de mujeres y nos comenta que los prestamos le han beneficiado mucho en la construcción de su nueva casa.

Celia tiene 63 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja procreando tres hijos que ya son adultos y tiene su propia familia, su esposo es albañil de oficio y gracias a la cooperación marital ahora pueden gozar de su casa propia, por ahora estan contruyendo otra casa que es para sus hijos por lo que el credito solicitado a la Fundación va a invertir en la compra de bloques, arena, cemento, eternir,  para terminar la nueva casa y darles tranquilidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Barrio Sucre” communal bank is in Cumbe parish in the southeast part of the city of Cuenca. Its residents are craftspeople. They are mostly sheep wool clothing weavers and embroiderers. They are also farmers not only for the success of their families but also for their community’s and to be part of their family’s economic growth. Celia V. is a member of the Barrio Sucre communal bank. She is someone who struggles daily to have a better future. She is both a housewife and a small farm animal merchant. She raises guinea pigs and chickens that she sells in her own community or even as far as the city of Cuenca. She has done this for several years since it was her parents who initiated her in this kind of work. She is now in her 4th loan cycle with her communal bank. It was thanks to her niece’s invitation that she became a member of this beautiful group of women. She tells us that the loans have been of great use to her in the construction of her new house. Celia is 63 years old and lives in a common law union with her partner; they have three adult children who have their own families. Her husband is a bricklayer and, thanks to their marital cooperation, they can now enjoy their own home. They are now building another house that will be for their children. This is the purpose of the loan they are requesting from the Institution. She will invest in the purchase of: concrete blocks, sand, cement, Eternit (a brand of fiber/concrete roofing tiles and siding), to finish the new house and provide tranquility for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.en:
Hernando M. is from the village of M., Gingoog City. He is 38 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Hernando owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Hernando has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Hernando joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Hernando has decided to request a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 58 years old, married to Margaret Wambui, and they have seven children who are all adults and married.  He has been making and selling jiko stoves (metal or ceramic charcoal stoves) in Naivasha town for the last eighteen years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy more iron and metal to make more jiko stoves to sell.  

He plans to employ more people to increase production so as to cater for the ever-increasing demand for his products.

loans.use: To buy iron and metal for making more jiko stoves to sell

loans.name: Cruceñas Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Cruceñas" esta representado por la señora Daniela y conformado por 11 miembros todas mujeres trabajadoras, unidas y muy responsables como lo han demostrado en sus anteriores ciclos, todas residen en la misma zona de y se conocen muy bien. La señora Daniela se dedica a la venta de ropa en el M. ella es casada y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar su esposo es chofer y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, la destinara el crédito para la compra de mercadería la cual trae desde Chile para que sea abajo precio y de buena calidad, ella ya tiene sus clientas que  demandan sus productos por ser de muy buena calidad. El resto de las socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, comida en el barrio en pequeñas pensiones, otras venden ropa de forma ambulante y empanadas. La competencia es muy dura en estos días pero las socias saben como salir delante de cualquier adversidad gracias  a us experiencia y a sus ganas de salir adelante ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo, con la compra de mercadería, insumos y para el mejoramiento de ambientes de trabajo como las dedicadas a la venta en pensiones que requieren el crédito para la ampliación de sus pensiones.
texts.en:
The members of the Cruceñas Communal Bank are represented by Daniela. The group is comprised of 11 members. All of them are hard-working women who are united and very responsible, as they have demonstrated in their previous cycles. All of them live in the same area, and they know each other very well. Daniela sells clothes in the market. She is married and has two school age children. Her husband is a driver, and he helps her with the household expenses. The loan is to buy merchandise, which she brings from Chile in order to get a low price and good quality. She has her customers who demand that her products be of very good quality. The rest of the members sell cosmetics or food in the neighborhood in small boarding house. Others sell clothes as street vendors, and some sell empanadas. The competition is very hard these days. But, the members know how to get ahead in front of any adversity thanks to their experience and their desire to get ahead. The support of their families depends on their businesses. The loan is for working capital to buy merchandise and supplies to improve their work environments. For example, the members who sell food in boarding houses need the loan to expand their boarding houses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 45 years old, married with 6 children. Her husband also works to support their home. She sells for long hours to make her business sustainable. She sells cassava dough popularly known as fufu or akpu in Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona N. is from the village of Brgy.Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 33 years old. Alona is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alona owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Alona has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alona joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alona is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alona from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nissondiya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Nissondiya sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygames avec en moyenne 46 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans un  chef lieu de commune rurale, Konodimini dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage dans le village. 
Les membres du groupe vendent du riz, du haricot, des spaghettis, de la crème à peau,   des parfums etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire la clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elles collaborent avec  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 8ème cycle de prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Madame Mariam Traoré qui est un des membres du groupe compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 douzaines de parfums et 20 tubes de crèmes à peau. 
Elle est très sollicitée pour la qualité de ses parfums et crèmes vendus dans le village et ses environnants. 
Elle se ravitaille à Bamako en gros et revend en détail, à domicile, à la foire du village et dans les villages environnants, à une clientèle mixte, au comptant et parfois à crédit. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour l’épargne et faire l’élevage des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Nissondiya are married women mostly in polygamous households who average 46 years of age and three children each all living in the seat of the rural community of Konodimini in the Ségou region (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members know one another through ties of kinship and marriage in the village.  And they sell rice, beans, spaghetti, skin cream, perfumes, etc.  With the goal of increasing their working capital in order to satisfy their burgeoning customer base, the group members are collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their eighth solidarity loan cycle.  All the preceding loans have been repaid properly. Ms. Mariam Traoré, who is a member of the group, plans on using her loan to buy five dozen perfumes and twenty tubes of skin cream.  She is in high demand for the quality of her perfumes and creams sold in and around the village.  She gets her supplies in Bamako (capital of Mali) wholesale and sells them retail out of her home, at the village fair, and in surrounding villages.  Accepting cash and sometimes credit, she sells to a mixed customer base.  She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be put into savings and used to raise small ruminants.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying some cosmetics

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 46 years old and sells bales of used clothes to customers in Kumasi. Gladys has been operating her trade for eleven years and is eager to be taking out this loan. She plans to use this loan to purchase bales of assorted used clothes for adults and children to meet customers’ demand. Gladys believes in customer care and her broad smile almost always draws customers to her shop, making her one of the successful traders in used clothes. Used clothes are most patronized since brand-new ones are expensive for the ordinary person. This has created a market for women like Gladys.

Gladys is divorced and she is the mother of an 11-month-old baby. She hopes that her child will become a physician. She says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profit so that she will be able to have a container shop to sell her stock out of.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
The people shown in the photo are Mrs. Kem L. and her husband. They are villagers living with their children in a medium-sized home in Kompong Cham Province.

This couple owns 2 hectares (5 acres) of farmland that they inherited many years ago from their grandparents. On their land, they grow different kinds of crops and are able to plant twice a year.

The heavy rains are falling everywhere and this situation is good for planting. However, Kem L. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. Thus, she is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizer, insecticide, a water pump and seed to grow, and to pay for a laborer to plow their farmland.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, insecticide and a water pump and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Dionila

texts.es:
Dionila tiene 52 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola D. la provincia D. Piura, la población se dedica casi exclusivamente a sembrar arboles frutales, cuyos frutos son vendidos a plantas procesadoras que los manufacturan para exportarlos al extranjero, la zona pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir en un puesto D. venta del mercado D. su distrito, ella ya tiene mucho tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio por lo que ya tiene un grupo D. clientes conocidos que siempre recurren a su negocio para adquirir sus productos, ella siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante por lo que trata D. adquirir productos D. calidad y ofrecerlos a sus clientes con un trato amable. Su esposo es agricultor y juntos siempre trabajan arduamente para salir adelante.

Dionila desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas mercaderia para ampliar su negocio, aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia sus clientes y compañeros la consideran una mujer amable y respetuosa
texts.en:
Dionila, 52, is married and lives with her family in the TambogranD. district. This is an agricultural district in the Piura province, where the population is dedicated almost entirely to the cultivation of fruit trees whose fruits are sold to the processing plants that manufacture and export them abroad. This area is part of the Piura region, and is located more than 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Dionila sells clothing from a stall in the market in her district. She has already been in this business for quite some time, and so has a group of loyal customers who she knows and who always return to her business to acquire their products. She always tries her best to make progress with her business; she tries to buy the best quality products and offer them to her customers with friendly service. Her husband is a farmer and together they always work arduously to get ahead. Dionila wants to expand her business by acquiring more merchandise and increasing her sales, so that she can have greater earnings. To achieve this objective she has decided to apply, for the first time, for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles. Dionila is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family and her customers, and her colleagues consider her to be a friendly and respectful woman.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy garments to expand her business selling in the market

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda P. is from the village of Calamagui 1st, Ilagan. She is 51 years old. Yolanda is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Yolanda operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 7,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2005, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is an outgoing and hardworking man. He is 34 years old and married. He is blessed with one child who goes to school. He earns a living by distributing condoms, shoes, toothpaste, and sweets. He distributes his products to retail shops, wholesalers and chemists. He has done this business for three years.

At the moment, he wants to add stock of condoms, shoes, toothpaste and sweets. He is therefore requesting 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya. This will be his first loan from Faulu Kenya with the support of his group. Thanks to Imani group in Faulu Kenya. He dreams that someday, he will start up his own company with a capital of 10 Million shillings.

loans.use: To add stock of condoms, shoes, toothpaste and sweets.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
la sra. Consuelo C. E. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, cuenta con una pequeña pulperia en la cual vende varios productos, en estos momentos no tiene muy surtido su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtirlo para cubrir con las exigencias de sus clientes.
su negocio esta ubicado en la colonia Venecia, hace cuatro meses abrió una pequeña pulpería en la Calera ubicada a treinta minutos de Tegucigalpa y ha tenido que llevar mercadería de su pulperia, por eso su esta un poco vacía.
necesita surtir sus dos pulperias para tener mejores ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Consuelo C. E. works selling common products. She has a small store where she sells her items, but her store is not very well stocked right now.

She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise to stock her store and meet the demands of her customers.

Her store is located in the Venecia neighborhood. Four months ago, she opened another small store in Calera, located 30 minutes from Tegucigalpa and she has had to bring merchandise from her other store. This is why it is a bit empty.

She needs to stock her two stores to have better earnings, which she needs to cover the household and family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, coffee, crackers, milk, refreshments, juices, pastas, soups, soaps, spaghetti, eggs, pills, spices, butter, oil, margarine

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en: Generosa T. is a widow who lives in Sandoval St., Bgy. 2, Roxas, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. She has two children, who are 21 and 22 years old. Generosa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Generosa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 45,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 so that she can buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store in order to continue to save enough capital so that she can start a piggery business. Generosa T. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita T. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 51 years old, widowed and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Carmelita makes and sells food. Selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community is her main source of income. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2005, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services with the hope of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has taken out 11 loans from PMPC, and successfully her previous loan of 20,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory, and as working capital for a food business

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Aminata.  She is married and has two children aged 26 and 22 years. In 1985, Amie established her used clothing business. She began her business because she believed this can be a means for getting income to provide support to her children. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 430,000 SLL every month from this business.  She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL.   

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more bales of used clothing.   In the future, Amie plans to educate her children and to buy a plot of land.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing for her business

loans.name: Bertha Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. COYLLORITTI D. CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Corao, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco  y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Bertha Justina; ella tiene 59 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. comida y también se dedica a la agricultura, ella venD. comida en la feria del distrito D. Corao desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m y también tiene un pequeño terreno D. cultivo donD. siembra maíz, papa y habas, ella quiere tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Bertha Justina is a member of the community bank "Señor D. Coylloritti D. Corao".  The bank is located in the Corao district in the province and department of Cusco.

Bertha Justina is 59 years old, married, and has five children.  Her daily tasks are shared between her business that sells food and working in agriculture.  She sells food in the market in the district of Corao from 8:00am until 5:00pm and also has a small plot where she grows corn, potatoes, and beans.  She would like to own a restaurant.

She is asking for this loan to purchase food to cook, like meat, chicken, and vegetables.

She thanks everyone who is helping her achieve her dream and she promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase food products like meat, chicken, and vegetables

loans.name: Walid

texts.ar:
وليد  هو في عمر 45 سنة يعمل في مجال تجميع الخردة والماكنات القديمة المستعلمة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل بكد ونشاط يحب عائلتها ويريد ان يؤمن لها حياة
افضل اجتماعيا وماديا له في عمله اكثر من 9 سنوات ما يميز عمله ان عدد الاشخاص الذين يعملون في هذا المجال قلائل فهو يطمح الى شراء بيك اب وفتح محل لبيع الخردة به
كان للقرض القديم تأثير جيد جدا عليه وهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء عربة لبيع الخردة عليها لأنه يجد صعوبة في بيعها بأكياس على ظهره له زبائن
ينتظرونه لكي يبيعوا له أشياءهم القديمة يحب عمله ويريد تطويره
texts.en: Walid is a 45-year-old husband and father of two who loves his family very much and wants to secure for them a better life. Walid enjoys more than nine years of experience collecting scrap metal and used machinery. Given that his last loan from Al Majmoua had a very positive impact on his work, Walid is now seeking another loan to purchase a pick-up truck to retrieve the scrap from various sellers and then resell it from the truck to his customers (he currently has to schlep the metal around with a bag). Walid is very driven in his work and is keen to further develop his business, on top of which he has an advantage in that not very many people are occupied in this field.

loans.use: Purchase pick-up truck to procure and resell scrap metal.

loans.name: Daniel Katilit

texts.en:
Daniel Katilit R. is a man of thirty years, married to Everlyne and a father of seven children. They live in Ortum in Kitale where he does his transportation as a primary business and also sells timber. He has been in this business for thirteen years now and gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings. 

This will be Daniel's second loan through KADET and he plans to use the entire loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle and buy an electric blade for his timber business as well as buying cereals for resale. In future he wants to buy a plot of land and build a house for his family and ensure better education for his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his vehicle, an electrical blade for his timber business, and cereals for resale

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma C. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Gemma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma buys and resells green bananas in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
