Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa U. is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Siufaga1(A). She is married and has six grown-up children. To make a living, Lisa raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Lisa has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 380 tala (WST) a month.

In 2008, Lisa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2000 WST from SPBD which was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be her fourth loan from SPBD. Lisa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Flor De Tuna Ii Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal FLOR DE TUNA II está ingresando al ciclo Nro. 1 y formará parte del centro focal de Alto Lima, aún no tienen experiencia en el trabajo como banca comunal pero tiene la confianza que este ciclo les servirá para conocerse y afianzar los lazos de amistad.  Está integrado por 8 personas,  7 mujeres y 1  varón.
Cada uno de los integrantes ya tiene negocio propio, ente los cuales se tiene: artesanía en goma eva, venta de mariscos, venta de joyas de plata, venta de calzados por catálogo, bazar, tienda de repuestos.
La Banca Comunal de FLOR DE TUNA está dirigida por una mesa directiva compuesta por  una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas.
La  presidenta, la señora Narda ha participado  15 años y medio en la banca comunal "Flor de Tuna", este es su primer ciclo en la banca comunal  "Flor de Tuna II".  Con el tiempo ha desarrollado dos negocios, por un lado tiene un bazar que abrió por iniciativa propia y por otro lado elabora piñatas.  El crédito que está solicitando le servirá para la compra de material para elaborar las piñatas: esponja, plastoformo, pegamento.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano para ayudarle en ambos negocios.  Las piñatas son repartidas a las tiendas que hicieron el pedido.
Cuando se le consulta por que está en Pro Mujer ella responde”salud” refiriendose al servicio de salud.
texts.en: The Flor de Tuna II Communal Bank is entering its first cycle  and will be part of the Alto Lima center. Although they do not have any experience working as a communal bank, they are confident that this cycle will help them get to know each other and strengthen the bonds of friendship. The group consistes of 8 persons, 7 women and 1 man. Each of the members has their own business, among which are: crafts made from rubber, sale of seafood, sale of silver jewelry, sale of shoes by catalog, a bazaar, and a parts store. The Flor de Tuna Communal Bank is governed by a board composed of a president, a treasurer and a recording secretary. The president, Narda, has participated for 15 years in the Flor de Tuna Communal Bank, this is her first cycle with the Flor de Tuna II Communal Bank. Over time she has developed two businesses. First has a bazaar that she opened herself and on the other hand she makes piñatas. The loan she is requesting will help buy supplies for making piñatas: foam, plastoform, glue. She has the support of her brother to help in both businesses. The piñatas are distributed to stores that order them. When asked why she is in Pro Mujer she answers "health", referring to the health service.

loans.use: Buy supplies for making piñatas: sponge, plastoform, glue

loans.name: Loraleen

texts.en:
Loraleen D. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 33 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Loraleen owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Loraleen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Loraleen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loraleen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Loraleen is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. This loan will be Loraleen's 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business, to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny P. is from the village of Malaigang, Wao, Lanao del Sur. He is 38 years old. Danny is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Danny owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal taxi) services to local community members. Danny has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Danny joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danny is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Danny from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Kimanyisho Kikutumi

texts.en:
Kimanyisho Kitumi is 26 years old, married and a mother of four children. She has practised farming activity in the town of Narok for the last four years.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan with which she plans to buy wheat seed and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to large scale farming.

Her dream is to build a rental premises and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is a married woman who lives in Cebu. She earns her living by operating a business buying and selling pigs. Her husband Jesus, who is 48 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 20 and 25 years old. 

Melisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 to buy supplies for her pigs so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Melisa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (feed, medicine) for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa se dedica a la venta de artículos publicitarios. Tiene más de 31 años en este negocio. Su negocio consiste en coser bolsos, con lemas publicitarios, por lo que tiene una buena cantidad de pedidos, ella recibe ayuda de una muchacha que labora con ella en la fabricación de sus productos. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, pues a pesar de no tener mucho espacio confecciona los bolsos, mochilas, cartucheras entre otros productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de hilos, tijeras, telas, material especial para los bolsos, cajas, bolsas entre otras cosas. Pues aquí donde logra obtener los ingresos necesarios para su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa sells advertising materials.  She has been in this business for over 31 years.  Her business consists of making bags with publicity slogans, and she has a good number of orders. She has help from a girl who works with her making her products.  

Her business is located in her house.  In spite of not having much space; she makes bags, backpacks, pouches, and other products. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy thread, scissors, fabric, and special material for the bags, boxes, purses, and other things.  This is where she manages to get the income that her household needs.

loans.use: to buy thread, scissors, fabric, and special material for  bags, boxes, purses, and other things l

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 42 years old and is a married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 22 years old and the youngest is 14. Her husband works as a farmer and a school guard.

Diana is also a farmer, helping her husband maintain their rice farm. Diana and her husband have been growing rice for 20 years. She said that they usually earn about 8,500 PHP doing this farming.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. In the future, Diana hopes to put up a new business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tadius

texts.en: Tadius, 32, is a married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for eight years. Having started with 300,000 shillings of capital, he now has one million. He dreams of owning a wholesale shop despite the hardship of lack of capital. Tadius needs the loan facility to buy soap and sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio tiene de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus menores hijos. Ellos residen en la localidad Pan de azúcar del distrito de Oyotún, 2 horas delacuidad dechiclayo.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en la zona donde reside. Allí el suele sembrar arroz dos veces por año y con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a la economía de su familia. El cuenta con más de diez años dedicándose a esta actividad y debido a ello conoce mucho del manejo de estos cultivos.

Emilio desea adquirir fertilizantes para poder asegurarse de una buena producción de su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. 

Emilio es una persona bastante hogareña y estimada por las personas de su comunidad, pues bien conocida por ser una persona tranquila y trabajadora
texts.en:
Emilio is 46 years old.  He lives in his own home with his wife and their young children.  They live in the area Pan de Azúcar in the district of Oyotún, which is 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He has some agricultural land in the area he lives in.  There, he harvests rice two times a year, and with the income that he receives from this activity he manages to continue moving ahead the economic condition of his family.  He has spent more than 10 years doing this work, and thanks to this he knows a lot about the management of these cultivations.  

Emilio wants to acquire fertilizers in order to assure a good production from his crop, and for this he believes it is best to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that will help him achieve his objective.

Emilio is a fairly stay-at-home person, and he is respected by the people in his community as he is well known for being a tranquil and hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to assure a good production from his rice fields

loans.name: Sreytoch

texts.en:
Sreytoch is a vegetable seller. She buys vegetables from the farmers in her village and sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband, Dara, is a motor taxi driver. They have been married since 1989 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One is married and a garment factory worker, one assists her mother in the business and the third one attends school. The family lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sreytoch is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Нурали проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена, домохозяйка. Сам он имеет среднее образование. Он у себя дома занимается производством попкорна. Уже год как он занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для увеличения производства попкорна. То есть он хочет купить сахар, масло и несколько мешков кукурузы.
texts.en: Nurali lives in the Dangara region. He is 36 years old. He is married, with three children. His wife is a homemaker. Nurali has receveid secondary education. He makes popcorn for sale out of his home. He has been in this business for a year. He is taking out a loan to increase the popcorn production volume. This means he would like to buy four bags of corn and one bag of sugar.

loans.use: to increase his volume of popcorn production

loans.name: Guido Rovinson

texts.es:
Guido Rovinson tiene 26 años, es soltero vive con los padres, en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  SAGRADO CORAZON  se encuentra ubicada en el sector Cuatro Esquinas perteneciente al cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 12 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de los mismos y otras actividades que da utilidades.

Guido se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz, en terrenos de los padres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es terminar los estudios.

Le gusta hacer deporte y las fiestas de carnaval.
texts.en:
Guido Rovinson is 26 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the town of Guaranda in Bolívar province. He doesn't have any children.

The members of the village bank Sagrado Corazón are in the Cuatro Esquinas neighborhood in Guaranda, about 15 minutes from the lending cooperative's office. The group has 12 members who work in farming, raising and selling livestock, and other activities.

Guido is a farmer. He grows potatoes, wheat, and corn on his parents' land. He makes his purchases at the local Guaranda market and then sells them in the city's wholesale market.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for his crops. The loan will help him finance his needs. He faces many challenges, such as crop blights. His dream is to finish his studies.

He likes sports and the festivals at Carnaval.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en: Bernadeth is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Bernadeth has a shop that sells beverages, canned goods & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks. Bernadeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bernadeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Fall

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une mère de famille qui a deux enfants. Elle est commerçante et tient une boutique de produits cosmétiques au marché central de sa localité  située au bord de l'océan atlantique. Son  activité lui permet de s'occuper des frais de scolarité , de la santé et d'améliorer l'alimentation de sa famille d'autant plus que son mari travaille à plus de 700 km au nord du pays. L'activité génère des revenus substantiels avec surtout l'accompagnement de l'IMCEC  qui lui a octroyé trois prêts. Afin d'augmenter son stock pour satisfaire la forte demande de la période, elle sollicite un quatrième prêt de 500 000FCFA.Avec cet argent, elle compte acheter 30 rouleaux de tissus, 05 sachets de boutons, 05 rouleaux d'élastiques, des garnitures et des fils.Elle espère tirer des bénéfices consistants de la vente de ces produits et mieux prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et ceux de ses deux enfants.Son ambition est de se lancer dans l'importation de produits cosmétiques notamment en Chine et au Dubaï.
texts.en: This borrower is the mother of two children.  She is a merchant and has a cosmetics shop at the central market in her town, situated on the Atlantic coast.  Her business allows her to take care of school and healthcare expenses, and to improve the quality of food for her family, since her husband works more than 700 km away in the north of the country.  Her work generates substantial revenue, especially with the partnership of l’IMCEC, which has granted her three loans.   With the goal of increasing her stock to meet the high demand of the season, she is requesting a fourth loan of 500,000 FCFA. With this money, she plans to buy 30 bolts of fabric, 5 sacks of buttons, 5 rolls of elastic bands, decorations, and threads.  She hopes to make consistent profits from the sales of her products and to better meet her personal needs and those of her two children.  Her ambition is to break into importing cosmetic products, mainly from China and Dubai.

loans.use: to buy 30 bolts of fabric, 5 sacks of buttons, 5 rolls of elastic, decorations and thread.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng is 45 years old, married to Mr. Von and has four children. They make a living as farmers, using land which is located near their home. The couple has been doing this since 1980 and one of their children is now making a living as a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh while the other works as an electrician. The other two children are both still in school. The couple earns about $3 a day. They work very hard and are applying for a $400 loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer, which they plan to scatter on their field during the coming rainy season. They will also use a portion of the loan to hire several people to help them plow their land. In the future, the couple would like to open a new business which will help them secure their financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to hire some people to help them with plowing.

loans.name: Esmeralda Elizeth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, venD. lácteos, vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 8 y 7 años D. edad, el negocio D. los lácteos lo tiene ubicado en su casa, para realizar los productos compra la leche, y en esta ocasión quiere con un préstamo comprar suficiente leche por un periodo.
El préstamo le ayudara para tener los insumos necesarios en la casa y poder producir más quesos, cuajada, requesón, que todos son derivados D. la leche, con esto procura tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Esmeralda sells dairy products. She lives with her husband and two children, ages 8 and 7. Esmeralda operates her business out of her home. In order to make her products, she has to buy milk. On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy enough milk to last for an extended period.

This loan will help her to be stocked with the necessary supplies at home for making cheeses, curds, and cottage cheese, all of which are derived from milk. With this loan, Esmeralda hopes to generate better income.

loans.use: to buy milk for making cheeses, curds, and cottage cheese.

loans.name: Ervin Inocente

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, reside Ervin, el se dedica a la elaboración de calzado para varón ya que con lo que el cuenta es con un taller de zapatería. El trabaja arduamente de lunes a sábado, para así poder sustentar las necesidades de sus dos hijos y su esposa. 

Ervin se acerco a nuestras oficinas par solicitar un crédito ya que tiene la necesidad de comprar materia prima como por ejemplo cuero, pega blanca y amarilla, forros, suela etc. Para poder distribuir mas calzados en las tiendas del oriental. Y así poder tener más ingresos, y seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ervin lives in the city of Masaya. He makes shoes for men and runs a shoe repair shop. He works hard Monday to Saturday in order to support the needs of his two children and wife. 

Ervin came to the CEPRODEL office to request a loan because he needs to buy raw materials, like leather, white and yellow glue, lining, soles, etc. This way he can distribute more shoes to oriental stores, thereby increasing his income and improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like black leather, faux leather, fiber products, baking powder, white and yellow glue, shoe soles, high quality lining, thread, and packing bags.

loans.name: Mbugua

texts.en: Mbugua is a 53-year-old hardworking married businessman. For over three years, he has been growing flowers and selling seedling flowers to earn a living. He also does dairy farming for more income generation. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy seedlings.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Ami Mawulawoé

texts.fr:
Ami Mawulawoé est une femme  âgé(e) de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un enseignant. Elle a 02 enfants.
Ami Mawulawoé travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes teintes et d’appareils électroménagers depuis 2005. Elle vend à des clients dans un marché de la place  et achète à Lomé.
Ami Mawulawoé a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des appareils électroménagers et des pagnes teintés.
texts.en:
Ami Mawulawoé, age 37, is married to a teacher and has two children. Since 2005, she's been working as a reseller of dyed "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and home appliances.

She gets her supplies in Lomé, and sells to her customers at a local market.

Ami Mawulawoé is seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy home appliances and dyed pagnes.

loans.use: to buy electric irons, hand dryers, and water heaters

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр честный и трудолюбивый мужчина. У него замечательная жена и 3-е несовершеннолетних детей. Он занимается куплей и продажей скота более 20 лет, то есть имеет большой опыт в этом деле. Торгует скотом на рынках региона. Этот вид деятельности  приносит  хорошую прибыль и бизнесу и семейному бюджету. Бахтиёр хочет получить займ на сумму 3000$ США для покупки скота и расширения бизнеса. Он  надеется, что вы поддержите его и заранее благодарит вас за понимание.
texts.en: Bahtiyor is an honest and hard-working man.  He has a wonderful wife and three adolescent children.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over 20 years and has an extensive experience in this business.  He sells livestock at the district markets.  This business bring in a good profit both to the business and the family budget.  Bahtiyor wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock and expanding his business.  He hopes that you will support him and thanks you for the understanding.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Miriam Ines

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 38 años y vive con su familia en la maravillosa provincia de Limón la cual marca una gran diversidad cultural: con una población predominantemente negra y con importantes rasgos de la cultura indígena costarricense, la afro caribeña, blancos y chinos, cada grupo le aporta a la zona su estilo propio. Esta provincia tiene hermosas lugares con arenas blancas, playas y palmeras y exuberantes parques nacionales que protegen bosques húmedos tropicales y arrecifes de coral, así como centenares de especies de flora y de fauna en vías de extinción. El parque nacional Tortuguero, contiene la muestra más grande de bosque húmedo tropical protegido y aquí usted podrá recorrer sus canales y ríos, observar la flora y la fauna, apreciar el desove de las tortugas marinas y tener la oportunidad de observar a más de 300 especies de aves dentro de las que se encuentra la lapa verde, el pavón y los tucanes. En esta zona se llevan a cabo importantes investigaciones científicas y se ha convertido en un punto especial para el turismo científico y ecológico.

Desde hace unos meses atrás la Empresa pide que se les brinde algún tipo de ayuda con su equipo tecnológico, para asi hacer más eficiente el trabajo.

Es por esto que Miriam está solicitando un crédito por el monto de 400,000.00 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para obtener un equipo de computo completo para la Empresa y asi poder hacer los informes y llevar la contabilidad de dicha organización.

Miriam es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y están felices porque los resultados han sido muy buenos y la Empresa ha ayudado a muchas mujeres a trabajar en sus diferentes negocios.
texts.en:
Miriam is 38 years old and lives with her family in the beautiful province of Limon which has great cultural diversity: it has a predominantly black population and important features of the indigenous Costa Rican culture. The Afro-Caribbeans, Whites and Chinese - each group infuses the area with its own style. This province has beautiful white sandy places, beaches and palm trees as well as lush national parks to protect tropical rainforests and coral reefs and hundreds of species of fauna and flora in danger of extinction.

The national park Tortuguero contains the largest example of protected tropical rainforest and here you can tour its canals and rivers, observe the flora and fauna, see the nesting sea turtles and have the opportunity of observing more than 300 species of birds among which number the great green macaw, the pavon and the toucan. Important scientific investigations are carried out in this area and it has become a special place of interest for scientific and ecological tourism.

A few months ago the Empresa asked for some help with its technical equipment so as to work more efficiently.

This is why Miriam is asking for a loan for the amount of 400,000.00 (four hundred thousand colones) to purchase a complete computer system for the Empresa and thus be able to produce the reports and carry out the accounting needed for this organisation.

Miriam is a member of the communal bank la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, one of the 110  member organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. And they are very happy as the results have been very positive and the Empresa has helped many women to work in their various businesses.

loans.use: to install a computer system in the EMPRESA.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 21-year-old single man who lives with one parent and a sibling. In 2003, he began working as a home electrician and since then he has been striving to work really hard to cover his expenses regardless of his youth. 

Fadi is requesting a 1,200 USD loan from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to update his business equipment. Undoubtedly, his new tools will help improve his work. In the future, Fadi plans to join a locA. company to improve his financiA. situation.

loans.use: to purchase electrical equipment

loans.name: Heraclia

texts.es: Heraclia, de 53 años es una mujer soltera. Ella vive en compañía sus 5 hijos, de los cuales solo cuida y educa a 2 de ellos en una casa alquilada en la localidad de Ataura. Los 15 años de experiencia en la agricultura, hicieron que ella logre todos los objetivos que se propone. A pesar de haber terminado, solo primaria. Comenzó a trabajar en un centro experimental de una de las universidades más antiguas del País. Ahí realiza toda variedad de productos lácteos como: queso, yogurt, manjar blanco y sus variantes. También apoya en la crianza de ovejas de raza, pues es conocedora del clima  y los pastos que crece en esta zona. Por su trabajo recibe un sueldo considerable, pues ello le permite tener una vida cómoda. Además de dedicarse a la compra y venta de animales como gallinas, cuyes y ovejas; las cuales enseba y cuida con mucho esmero, “yo siembro el pasto que tienen que comer”, comenta Heraclia, “pues tienen que alimentar de buena manera”, culmina. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo amanecer” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Herclia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de alfalfa para sembrar en esta temporada.
texts.en: Heraclia, 53, is single and lives with her five children, two of which she cares for and educates in rental property in the town of Ataura.  She has 15 years' experience in agriculture which have enabled her to reach her goals, despite only having an elementary education.  She began working at an experimental center at the oldest university in the country.  There she made all kinds of dairy products such as cheese, yogurt, milk-based sweets and others.  She also raises sheep since she knows the climate well and the fodder that grows in this area.  For her work she receives a considerable salary that allows her to lead a comfortable lifestyle.  She also buys and sells hens, guinea pigs and sheep which she fattens and cares for, "I grow the fodder they eat", she says, "because they have to eat well.".  Heraclia belongs to the communal bank "Nuevo amanecer" and this is her first loan through MFP, where she is counting on support to carry out her plans.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She enjoys being a part of the association because all the members are responsible and very supportive.  Heraclia plans to use the loan to buy alfalfa seeds to plant this season.

loans.use: To buy alfalfa seeds.

loans.name: Yaeun

texts.en:
Yaeun (in the photo) and her husband, Hong, live in a village across Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children who are in school. 

Yaeun has full-time employment, while her husband is a horse cart driver, a fisherman and also a farmer. Yaeun is asking for another loan of 700 USD to assist in her husband’s farming business. He hopes to continue his farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto es un joven de 22 años de edad, al que le gusta mucho trabajar y esforzarse para poder salir siempre adelante. Él se dedica a realizar el servicio de transporte público en los mercados  del distrito de Parcona, lugar que se encuentra aproximadamente a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Ica, zona donde tiene muchos clientes.

Por ahora Luis Alberto alquila a una amiga suya la moto taxi en la que trabaja, lleva dedicándose a esta actividad cerca de 2 años, eligió este trabajo porque sabía que este negocio le podría permitir tener buenos ingresos, actualmente el gana un promedio de S/.44 diarios, lo que le ayuda a pagar el combustible y el alquiler de la moto taxi a su amiga y por supuesto también los gastos básicos que el necesita.

Luis Alberto quiere comprarse una moto taxi y el préstamo lo ayudará muchísimo en el pago de su cuota inicial y adelantar algunas otras para que por fin tenga su moto taxi propia, esto le permitirá tener un mayor cantidad de ingresos y podrá cumplir su sueño de tener un negocio propio en un mercado de la ciudad y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a 22 year-old young man who really likes to work hard so he can get ahead. He provides public transport in the markets of the district of Parcona, approximately 15 minutes from the city of Ica, an area where he has many clients.

For the time being, Luis Alberto is renting the motorcycle taxi he uses for work from a friend. He has been involved in this business for nearly two years. He chose this line of work because he knew it would provide him with a good income. He currently earns an average S/. 44 daily, which goes towards paying for fuel and the rent of the vehicle from his friend, as well as for his basic expenditures, of course.

Luis Alberto wants to buy his own motorcycle taxi and the loan will go a long way towards paying the first installment and a few others in advance, so that he can have his own vehicle. This will allow him to have a higher income and fulfill his dream of having his own business in one of the city's markets and in this way improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Wiliam

texts.en: Wiliam is 48 years old. He lives in the village of Del Pilar. Wiliam has been engaged in his hog-raising business for four years. He usually buys pigs and sells them after they have fattened up, earning P7,000 per head. Wiliam wants to give his children a good quality of life. He also wants to provide the necessities for his pigs; therefore, he has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for his pigs. He hopes this will make them fit and nourished, and provide higher prices when it is time for them to be sold. He also hopes to grow his business to secure a good living for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Inés

texts.es: La señora Inés vive en un sector de Costa Rica llamado Coronado, el clima ahí es muy frío , ventoso y muchas veces nublado. Doña Inés trabajo mucho tiempo como servidora doméstica, con lo que contribuyo en la crianza y educación de sus hijos. Hace tres años se retiro de esa labor, y con el dinero de prestaciones decidio cumplir su sueño de poner un negocio en su propia casa:un bazar, donde ofrecer a sus vecinos algunos productos , pero sobre todo seguir obteniendo ingresos por la labor que desarrolla , pues a pesar que doña Inés es una mujer de más de 60 años , es una persona muy activa , organizada y esforzada. En este momento sus ingresos han disminuido pues ella tiene que cuidar a su mamá que tiene más de 90 años , y le ayuda supliendo algunas de sus necesidades, por lo que necesita el préstamo para poder comprar nueva mercadería para el proximo año escolar , y hacer algunos arreglos en su local.
texts.en:
Inés lives in the Coronado area of Costa Rica where the climate is very cold, windy and often overcast. She spent a long time working as a housekeeper so she could contribute to her children's education; she's been retired for three years now. She decided to use her loan money to realize her dream of having a business of her own in her house, a store where she offers a variety of products to her neighbors. Above all, though, she continues to earn income in her business because even though she's a sixty-year-old woman, she's very active, organized, and hard-working. 

Inés's income has decreased lately because she has to take care of her mother, who is in her nineties. She helps out with some of her mother's necessities, so she needs the loan to be able to buy new merchandise for the next school year and to make some repairs to her locale.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products, school supplies, and to replace ceiling panels in her shop.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and owns a second hand clothes business, which she has been running for six years. Dorcas learned of Milango from an employee. She used to move around with the products looking for clients prior to setting up a stall. This made her quite exhausted by the end of each day.

Dorcas is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase second hand clothes. She looks forward to owning a ‘free market’ in the future. The setbacks the business faces are price fluctuations, some customers not paying on time and the seasonality of the business. During low seasons, there are few sales.

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothes.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is a 41-year-old married woman. She has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Linh has been working as a tailor for four years. 

Linh would like to take a loan to buy material to make clothes for her customers. She hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials to make clothes for her customers

loans.name: Vitché's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de six personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Vitché est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Vitché est âgée de 54 ans et est mariée à un certain Zossou. Vitché n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a six enfants, dont trois à leur charge. Vitché vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Vitché vend depuis une vingtaine d'année, de la nourriture (sauce de mouton) et des poissons frais dans un marché du Bénin. Vitché s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Vitché sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.

loans.use: Acheter des poissons et deux moutons.

loans.name: Omarkayam

texts.en:
Omarkayam is 27 years old. He graduated from the National School of Plastic Arts. Four years ago he started an advertising agency that focuses on audiovisual production. This is the direct result of his passion for special effects, animation, cinema, music, comics, technology and science fiction.

Omarkayma, says that he is credit-worthy because he operates within a personal budget and doesn't have economic dependents. He is asking for a loan to do some urgent plumbing repairs in his apartment. His biggest accomplishment is maintaining and growing his business.

loans.use: to do urgent plumbing repairs in his apartment.

loans.name: Marie Madeleine

texts.fr:
Marie est membre depuis la création du groupement en Mai 2011 et elle habite dans la localité depuis plusieurs années.

Marie Madeleine, mariée et mére de cinq enfants dont trois garçons et deux filles,est notre vedette.Elle est âgée de 38 ans et elle effectue le commerce comme activité principale.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter 10 sacs de poissons fumés à 15000f le sac,02 sacs de carottes à 25000f, 50kg de poissons secs dont 1500f le kg,achat de fruits de mer ("yet") d'une valeur de 25000f et 25000f pour le transport.Le reste de son financement,elle le donne a son mari pour qu'il l'investi dans la menuiserie.

Pour son bénéfice,elle compte épargne,assurer la scolarité de ces enfants et la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Marie has been a member since the creation of the group in May 2011 and she lives in the locality of Dinguessou at the age of 11 years. She has been advancing in the field of business for a long time. 

Marie Madeleine, married and the mother of five children of which three are boys and two are girls, is our star. She is 38 years old and she trades as her principal activity. 

With her loan, she intends to buy 10 bags of smoked fish at 15,000f per bag, 2 bags of carrots at 25,000f, 50kg of dried fish at 1,500f per kg, purchase seafood ('yet') of a value of 25,000f, and 25,000f for the transportation. She is giving the rest of her financing to her husband for him to invest it in carpentry. 

For her profit, she has a savings account, to guarantee the schooling of these children and the management of the family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee aged 29 years. She is married with 2 children aged between 2 and 4 years.Not yet go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare and to pay school fees of her children to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr:
Marthe a 47 ans, elle est mariée, son mari a aussi une activité de petit commerce. Le  nombre d’enfants est  de huit dont cinq déjà mariés, deux enfants (5-17 ans) suivent encore leurs études (classe primaire et classe de première).  
Elle a 29 années d’expérience dans l’activité de vente de légumes et fruits. En effet, depuis  qu’elle a arrêté ses études, elle  cultivait des légumes en milieu rural. Quand, elle s’est mariée, elle est venue en ville et, a décidé de vendre des légumes pour compléter les revenus familiaux.  Elle a toujours cherché les moyens pour développer l’activité : recours à 4 prêts pour augmenter le stock et diversifier les produits vendus, recherche d’un autre  point de vente qui sera géré par son fils.
Le ménage est propriétaire du local où il habite. L’objectif est la réussite des enfants dans leurs études.

loans.use: acheter des légumes et fruits: tomates, oignons, ails, gingembre, piments, choux, choux fleurs, haricots, poivron, letchi, fraise

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
L. S. Ros, a traditional medicine manufacturer and seller, is applying for his first loan from CREDIT MFI in the amount of $400.   L. S. Ros received training on making traditional medicine five years ago, and he has been making and selling medicine ever since. Currently, he is selling the medicines from his home, and he is periodically making home visits when someone calls on him. His medicines are traditional herbal medicines that he makes from a variety of plants to treat multiple illnesses. L. S. Ros’s wife assists in the production of the medicine in their home.

 

With this loan L. S. Ros plans on purchasing a motorcycle ($300) so that he may drive around with his medicines, thus expanding his business. He will spend the other $100 to purchase raw materials for the medicine production.  Currently, L. S. Ros is making about $2 a day from his traditional medicine business. L. S. Ros is hoping to improve his family’s standard of living through the growth of the business. L. S. Ros and his wife have three children who live with them in their home. Two of their children currently attend school, and L. S. Ros desires to increase their income enough to be able to send their third child to school as well.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike and raw materials

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi runs his agricultural business for 10 years. He is  one of the most popular butchers in his region and has lots of customers because his meat is always fresh and delicious. Soon he starts to make delieveries to the most clients.
Having borrowed a loan  of $400 he bought  small cattles. 
The second loan of $800 he spent to buy small cattles in order to chop off and to sell.
Now he requests a loan of $1200 to open a shop for selling meat and meat products. 
He was born in 1958 in Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village, married, has 2 children.

loans.use: To open a shop for selling meat and meat  products

loans.name: Ana María

texts.en:
Mrs. J. sells "basket tacos" (tacos de canasta) and her daughter keeps her company after school. Her clients are people who work close to where she sells her food (i.e. gas station, school, factory, bank, etc.). Mrs. Suárez says "I believe that with a $1,200 loan, I will be able to build a taco stand right here, so I can provide better service."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. J. vende taquitos de canasta, su hija le acompaña después de acudir a clases, sus principales clientes son las personas que trabajan en los negocios (gasolinera, escuela, maquila, banco y otros), ubicados alrededor de su punto de venta. "Imagino que con un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls podré construir un puesto de tacos en esta ubicación, para brindar una mejor atención".

loans.use: Construir un puesto de tacos

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto has a grocery store where he sells food, candy and school supplies and is located at his home since last year. His business hours are from. 6am to 10pm. Without experience and with small savings from his previous job he decided to begin his own source of income. His business has succeeded thanks to the constant dedication and hard work he and his wife have given to it.

Roberto needs a loan in order to buy more inventory, a hanger to improve presentation and products conservancy. Because he is in a very good location and has few competitors, his clients have requested him to provide them a larger variety of products.

Roberto is 55 years old and his wife helps him with customer service and buying products for the business. They have 3 children who are grown and independent. His house is located near the ocean stream. The house is made out of wood and the floor is in the soil. With the credit he would like to improve his business and his life turning into an example for the community.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy more inventory and a hanger for his products

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria was born in the Dominican Republic to Haitian parents and so is fluent in Spanish and Creole. Being bilingual, she often helps translate for members of the Haitian community who do not yet speak Spanish well. She has been living in Hato Mayor for 11 years with her family and hopes to eventually build a house of her own. When she´s not working selling clothing, Gloria likes to stay active in her community and chat with neighbors.

Note: Gloria is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his or her respective business and will be accountable to each other for repaying his or her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To buy a better variety of shirts and pants

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is an active member of Life in Africa Foundation. She is a widow who is raising six children on her own. Originally she lived in the north but she was forced to flee her home because of the war in 1998. She settled in Kampala in the IDP camp known as the Acholi Quarters and she is still there after all this time.

Juliana works very hard to provide for her children She labors in the rock quarry and she also participates in the Life in Africa Foundation bead-making program. Becoming a member of LiA has made life much easier for her and her orphan children. Three are in school and their school fees are always a big challenge to meet. Her income is just never enough to provide all that they need.

Juliana has a lot of experience in the rock quarry and if she starts her own small business instead of working for someone else, her income will increase. She could easily show a profit each month of 150,000 Uganda Shillings (symbol: /=) or about US$ 87 which would allow her children to continue in school.

To accomplish this Juliana is seeking a loan in the amount of 250,000/= (US$ 150) to cover the expenses and labor involved in starting up this business. Juliana feels sure she will be able to repay this loan in 6 months.

Below is her budget:

Extraction..3 trips.................90,000/=

Breaking............................20, 000/=

Carrying out from the pit...........30,000/=

Cracking into smaller pieces........96, 000/=

Emergency ..........................14,000/=

Total..................................250,000/= (US$ 150)

loans.use: paying labour

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a small entrepreneur who owns a shop selling different items. She is a widow and has five children. Mariam is a very hard worker and she really struggles to support her family. This is her second loan request. She is asking for a loan to buy a new refrigerator after the collapse of the old one. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: BUYING REFRIGERATOR

loans.name: Uchumi A Group

texts.en:
Bibiana, age 45, is married with 4 children (ages 17, 21, 28, and 31). She also takes care of her parents. In 2005, Bibiana opened two businesses- a cafe and clothing store. She works at these businesses from 8am to 6pm daily earning a profit of about $53 a month.

In the past, Bibiana took a loan of about $88 from BRAC Tanzania to buy stock for her businesses. Having paid it back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will be sharing this loan with her subgroup member Yusta H., who is a vegetable seller. They belong to the loan group Uchumi (Swahili for "economy"), which totals 25 members.

loans.use: To purchase more food and clothing stock for her businesses

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosalina is 39 years old, married, and has 3 sons that are 15, 17 and 19 years old. They are all studying in high school. This humble family lives in the neighborhood of Carlos Fonseca. Mrs. Rosalina's husband was the sole provider of the household; he worked at the National Police and due to his age could not continue working. He now receives a monthly pension. When they found themselves in this situation, Mrs. Rosalina decided to set up a general food store at her house. Here, she sells dairy products, basic grains like rice, sugar, oil and some perishable items such as vegetables and fruits. This is how this entrepenourial woman supports her family. Due to her good administration, her business is growing little by little. Currently, Rosalina would like to stock new products in her store. She would like to buy chicken, cheese, candy and cleaning products so that all homemakers in the area find necessary items at her store

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

. Doña Rosalina tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos varones de 15, 17 y 19 años, todos se encuentran estudiando en Secundaria, esta humilde familia habitan en el barrio Carlos Fonseca. El esposo de la señora era el único proveedor de la casa, trabajó en la Policía Nacional y debido a su edad no pudo seguir trabajando por lo que ahora recibe una pensión mensual. Al verse en esta situación Doña Rosalina decidió montar una Pulpería en su vivienda, en donde vende productos lácteos, granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, también vende perecederos, verduras y frutas. Es así como esta mujer emprendedora mantiene a su familia, debido a su buena administración el negocio va creciendo poco a poco. Actualmente, Rosalina desea surtir con nuevos productos su Pulpería, desea comprar pollo, queso, golosinas y también desea comprar productos de limpieza, con el fin que todas las amas de casa de la zona encuentren lo necesario en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, dairy products and chicken

loans.name: Neema Kimara A Group

texts.en:
Juma M., age 40, is married and has a child who is 14 years old. He owns a shop, which he began 6 months ago. He works from 6:30 AM to 10:00 PM and is able to make a monthly profit of around US$17.

Juma has taken out 1 previous loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase the stock for his shop. Juma hopes to receive a new loan to increase the same business. Juma will share this loan with his subgroup members, who have businesses in the sale of food and charcoal.

In the picture Juma is the man who is standing in the middle.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his shop

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam H. has been teaching physics in high school for many years. He is 52 and plans to retire and continue his small business. He has many university friends in Russia who are in the electrical spare parts business. They sell him cheap spare parts for lifts that were made in the 80’s in Russia. Those lifts are still being used in Baku but it’s hard to find spare parts for them.

Islam buys used spare parts from Russia and brings them to Baku, repairs them, and sells them at a profit. Most lift mechanics know Islam and they know that he is the one that can find any spare part that they would need.

Islam needs this loan to bring in more products that are needed in the spare parts market nowadays.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for refurbishing and re-sale

loans.name: Divinas Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto, you will find the main group Villa Tejada, to which the "Divinas" (Divine Women) association belongs. It is comprised of 18 women who are willing to work with much persistence. The majority of them are married, and with an average of 5 children, they say that the wages of their husbands aren't enough, which is what obliges them to search for other means of income.

The main activity of this group is sewing or making clothes (leather and cloth jackets, pants, and dresses), sheathes, curtains, and sweaters woven by machine. They need better capital to buy raw materials, and in this way to obtain a larger stock of products and more income for their own benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal de Villa Tejada al cual pertenece la asociación “Divinas” compuesta por dieciocho mujeres dispuestas a trabajar con mucho empeño. La mayoría de ellas casadas y con un promedio de 5 hijos, afirman que el salario de sus esposos no les es suficiente, lo que les obliga a buscar otros ingresos. La actividad principal de este grupo es la costura; confección de ropa (chamarras en cuero y tela, pantalones, vestidos), confección de fundas, cortinas y la confección de chompas tejidas a maquina. Necesitan mayor capital para la compra de materia prima, de esta manera conseguir un mayor stok de productos y por consiguiente mayores ingresos para su propio beneficio.

loans.use: Capital for the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Milian

texts.fr:
Mrs. Milian T. was born in 1977 in Gapé (Zio County). Presently living with her husband in Lonvo, she is a dynamic woman who is engaged in farming, particularly growing corn. The mother of 4 children, she is competent at her business which brings in the minimum income necessary to support her family. Wishing to increase her sales figures, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to extend her corn field and purchase fertilizer. This will help her to contribute more to the improvement of living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame T. Milian est née en 1977 à Gapé (P/Zio) Installée à Lonvo à côté de son mari, elle est une femme dynamique qui pratique l’agriculture et en particulier la culture de maïs. Mère de quatre (4) enfants, elle maîtrise bien son activité qui lui procure de revenu minimum pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Voulant accroître son chiffre d’affaires, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’étendre son champ de maïs et d’acheter des engrais. Ceci pourra l’aider à contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and expansion of her farmed land

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Mrs. Yean V., 28, is a weaver, earning $10 per day. Mr. Kheng Veasna helps his wife with her weaving. They have two children and live in Chaktubat Village, Kampong Thom Province. 

V. requests a loan of $500 to purchase a loom for her weaving business. The loom will allow her to increase her production and thereby expand her business. (The picture is V.'s husband.)

loans.use: To purchase a loom for a weaving business

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha M. is 28 and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending school while the others are too young to work or study. She is a farmer in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Since the price of land is going up, Mrs. Sokha M. has decided to buy a piece of land to re-sell later at a better price.

Unfortunately, Mrs. Sokha M. does not have enough money to buy it, therefore, she is requesting a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Tong Tim, is a motorbike-taxi driver. Previously, Mrs. Sokha M. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a motorbike for her husband’s business, a loan which she has paid back.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to re-sell later at a better price.

loans.name: Mafouss

texts.fr: M. S. est un exploitant de cyber cafe et il vente aussi des CD et cassettes. Son Cyber fonctionne a temps plein ; Pour faire a la demande, qui est de plus en plus croissante a l'ere des NTIC, il demande un pret. Il pense ainsi augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et par ricochet son benefice.
texts.en:
Mr. S. is an Internet café manager and he also sells CDs and tapes. His café operates full time. He seeks a loan to meet demand, which is ever increasing in the era of NICT (New Information and Communication Technologies). In doing so, he thinks he will improve his revenues, and therefore his profits.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his Internet café

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr: Dame G. Aline est née vers 1980 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral. Elle est mère de 02 enfants. Elle a épousé le sieur AHO Bertrand qui est un entrepreneur. Elle vend du charbon depuis 6 ans et réside à Djidjè un quartier de Cotonou depuis sa naissance. Elle vient solliciter ce prêt pour faire face à la demande de ses clients qui sont pour leur grande majorité consommateurs de charbon de bois parce que ne disposant pas de gaz domestique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aline G. was born around 1980 in Cotonou in the Littoral Department. She is the mother of two children. She married Mr. Bertrand Aho, who is a businessman. She has been selling charcoal for 6 years and she has lived in Djidjè, a neighborhood of Cotonou, since her birth. She is requesting this loan so that she can keep up with the demand of her customers who use charcoal for the most part because they do not have gas for cooking.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 10 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy Y. is a farmer who lives with one of her three children. Living in the Kampong Cham province, she typically makes $1.00 per day and is aided by one of her children who works growing crops. Her husband owns a big grinding mill and provides service to the people in the area to earn about $3.30 per day. The Kampong Cham area has not seen favorable weather conditions for farming this past year. Along with increased inflation, it has been a difficult year economically in much of Cambodia. As a farmer, Tuy Y. is taking a lot of the brunt of the economic downturn. That is why she has approached CREDIT with a request for a loan. Tuy Y. is asking for a loan of $400.00 to purchase a cow to pull the grinding mill, a purchase that she sees as a good opportunity to increase her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Saturnina Rita

texts.es:
Saturnina es comerciante ambulante de mazamorra (api, arroz don leche), trabaja en las calles empujando su pequeño carrito de dos llantas con su mercadería, el esposo es ayudante de panadería. Esta ocupación le permite a Saturnina cubrir la manutención de sus cinco hijos que dependen de ella, Saturnina vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Brasil de la Ciudad de El Alto. 


El crédito será invertido en la compra de un nuevo carrito porque el actual esta en mal estado.


Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por  Saturnina.
texts.en:
Saturina walks around selling her wares (selling rice and milk). She works in the streets, pushing her small, two-wheeled cart with her merchandise. Her husband is a worker at a bread store. This work allows Saturnina to pay for the upkeep of her five children, who depend on her. Saturnina lives in the home of her parents, located in the zone Brazil in the city of El Alto. This loan would be invested in the purchase of a new cart, because the one she has now is in very bad shape. This is her first loan with IMPRO. The results of her evaluation allow her to apply for this loan which is requested for Saturnina.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Estela C. originaria de la bella ciudad de Chinandega labora atendiendo su propia tienda general el cual ofrece diferentes tipos de artículos tales como personales,  del hogar y también comestibles.

Ella es el único sustento de su hogar y es por esto que  se preocupa por mejorar las condiciones de su casa de habitación es por esta sencilla razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito ya que sus estantes se han vuelto vacíos y ella requiere volverlos a llenar y para ello espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs Rosa Estela C. is from the beautiful town of Chinandega where she owns a general store offering different articles for personal use, household goods as well as food.

She is the only support of her home and therefore she worries about improving conditions of her house and for that reason she has approached Ceprodel for a loan as her shelves are empty and she needs to fill them and she hopes her loan will be approved so she can continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for general store.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 41 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos. Se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años, tiempo en que esta actividad le ayudó no solo a crecer en su negocio, sino también que ahora ella misma  confecciona diversos modelos de prendas, las cuales tiene como pedidos, estas confecciones las realiza en el pequeño taller que tiene en su hogar, donde le resulta  más fácil trabajar y no descuidar a sus menores hijos. Gracias a que su esposo  coopera en las confecciones, ambos tratan de atender todos los pedidos,  encargándose él de la distribución, pero cuando resultan escasos los pedidos, salen a las ferias a vender algunas prendas confeccionadas que tienen de reserva en casa, para no tener que pasar necesidad y apaciguar el mal momento que hay en algunos meses. Olga  esta en su segundo crédito con MFP, y siempre  mostró puntualidad en sus pagos y en todas las actividades que realiza su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado será invertido en la compra de las telas que requiere para confeccionar unos chalecos que tiene como pedido.
texts.en:
Olga is 41 years old and married with five chidren. She has been selling clothing for the past three years. In this time, not only has her business grown, she has also started sewing a variety of items herself according to orders placed by her customers. She sews the clothing in a small workshop in her home, which allows her to work with ease while still caring for her young children. Her husband helps her with the sewing, so the couple tries to fill all of the orders together. He is in charge of distribution. When there are few orders, they both go to local markets to sell their stock of already made clothing, which they keep in their home, so that they can overcome the difficult moments that arise during some months. This is Olga's second loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she has always been very punctual with all of her payments as well as with activities within her village bank. She plans to use this loan to buy fabric to use for an order of sweaters she is working on.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric to sew clothing

loans.name: Mavriya

texts.ru: Рахмонова Маврия проживает в районе Гиссар. Студентка Таджикского Национального Университета пятого курса. Кроме того обеспечивает семью  занимаясь бизнесом. Имеет магазин рядом с домом. Торгует продуктами питания и парфюмерией. Хочет увеличить ассортимент , путем получения кредита и ввоза нового товара. Планирует закупить одежду к весне. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mavriya R. lives in Gissar region. She is a senior-year student at Tadzhik National University. In addition, to provide for her family, Mavriya R. runs a grocery store near her home. She wants to use this loan to increase the assortment of goods sold. The money will be spent to purchase spring clothing. Mavriya R. plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Floriberta

texts.es:
Floriberta  inició el negocio ya que ella  tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos y cubrir las necesidades que tenían. Comenzó el negocio en Junio de 2004 como ella trabajo mucho tiempo en una pollería pero ganaba poco y no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos de la casa, fue entonces que el que era su jefe le propuso que ella pusiera mi propio local y con su ayuda pudo instalar su negocio. 


Poco a poco ha ido haciendo  mas clientes, ya compre un refrigerador grande para los pollos, sillas y mesas para que la gente pueda comer en el establecimiento y ademas pinto y rotulo el local con algo de publicidad.

El necesita un prestamo por MXN $3300 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para  comprar pollos al mayoreo, verduras y chile, platos y vasos desechables, bolsas de polietileno, y algunas sillas y mesas de plástico.
texts.en:
Floriberta started the business because she had to support her children and provide for their everyday needs. She started it in June 2004 when she was working for a poultry processor and needed to earn more money in order to cover family expenses. Her boss suggested that she set up her own shop and, with his (or her) help, she was able to start the business.

She's been slowly picking up customers ever since. She recently bought a large refrigerator for the poultry, chairs and tables so that people could eat in the shop and paint and signs for advertising.

She needs a MXN$3,300 loan, to be repaid in 8 14-day installments, to buy wholesale supplies of chickens, vegetables and chiles, along with plates, glasses, disposable tableware, plastic bags and more chairs and tables.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for catering business.

loans.name: Lin

texts.en: Mrs. Lin C. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. She owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Mrs. Lin C. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is 42 years old and the mother of four children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Chuon Chanthy, is a palm juice collector. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Monsieur D. Kodjo est un informaticien de formation, n’ayant pas trouvé à faire jusqu’à l’an dernier, il a lancé alors ses propres affaires qui sont la restauration et la vente de boissons. Actuellement son stock de marchandises est épuisé il sollicite de WAGES un autre crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 10 casiers de boissons, et divers produits nécessaires à son activité de restauration.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo D. is a computer specialist by trade, but until last year, he had not been able to find work. He then started his own business which is catering and the sale of beverages. Currently, he is out of stock and he is requesting another loan from WAGES to re-supply with 10 beverage racks and various goods essential for his catering activity.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverage racks and goods essential to catering activity

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh P. is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Nam Định. She is widowed and has one adult child. To make a living, Oanh owns and operates a business venture operating a retail store which specializes in making and selling baskets and brooms. So her main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling bamboo products in the local community. Oanh has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 4200000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, Oanh joined TYM Fund, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Oanh is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Oanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About TYM Fund:

The mission of TYM Fund is to improve the quality of life of poor Vietnamese women in rural areas by providing credit and savings to groups of fund members to enhance their participation and role in society.

loans.use: Expanding the business

loans.name: Holida

texts.ru: Холида кредитор в Микроинвест с 2007 года.Она имеет свой маленький бизнес продажи кухонных принадлежностей( вилок, ножей, ложек).Товар привозит из города Истаравшана, из знаменитого оптового базара.Её оборотный капитал потихоньку увеличивается, благодаря кредитам она продолжает свою деятельность, а также и улучшает уровень жизни семьи.Торгует она на рынке Худжанда, каждый день.Из-за большого стажа торговли у Холиды много своих постоянных клиентов, которые покупают у неё товар.На фото Холида в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Holida is a client of MicroInvest since 2007. She has her own small business selling cutlery such as forks, knives, spoons. She brings the goods from Istaravshan from the known wholesale market. Her working capital increases little by little and thanks to the loans she is continuing her business and also improves her living conditions. She sells on the market of Khujand every day. Holida has an extensive experience in sales and has many regular customers who buy the goods from her. On the photo Holida is on her day of getting the loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy forks, knives and spoons

loans.name: Mechille

texts.en:
Mechille has been engaged in the retail business for a very long time. Lack of working capital and a desire to develop growth in her business triggered her to request a loan of PHP12,000. Mechille dreams to give her children a good future by sending them to school and having them somehow finish a college course. She is thankful that her children are studying well at present and she hopes they will not change their ways of studying in the coming days.

Mechille is 30 years old and married to Fedy D. C.. They live in the village of San Lorenzo Ilagan Isabela, a rural place where agriculture is the major source of livelihood. They were blessed with three children, namely Christian Diether, Ivan and Femiley. Christian is 12, Ivan is 6 and Femily is merely 3.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos C. tiene ya mas de dos años dedicándose a la venta de ropa y artículos nuevos y usados en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, esté es el ingreso que genera para darle lo mejor a su hijo ya que es madre soltera.
   Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para ser esa inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. Por tal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para realizar la compra de la mercancía y así su negocio tendrá mas ingreso.
texts.en:
For over two years Santos C. has been selling clothes and new and used articles in the city of Nuevo Laredo. She is a single mother, and this is the income she generates to give her son the best. The business is lacking more variety of merchandise. At this time, she lacks the funds necessary to make this investment, and she doesn't want to leave the business under-capitalized. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise. This way her business will have more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana V. is a pig grower. She is 47 years old and has four children. She started raising pigs in 1994 and used her own savings to be able to get started with her business. As a mother, she dreamed of having a sustainable livelihood for her family. She also plans to buy a hectare (2.5 acres) of farm someday. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase feed for her pigs. She thinks that by making this move, she will be able to grow her piggery business even more. CEVI helps small businesses to grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ceraturo Irquis (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Ceraturo es un grupo nuevo de 17 socias y socios que son residentes del barrio Ceraturo Irquis en Victoria del Portete ubicado al sur de la  ciudad de Cuenca, este sector es de un clima demasiado frío y que por la tarde baja la neblina  lo que hace que la gente no transite por las calles ni salgan de sus casas.

La socia María Tránsito P. vive ya unos tres meses en casa de su cuñada que reside en el extranjero. María tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos de 9, 7, 5, 3 años y la última de un mes de edad, los tres primeros hijos los cuales son varones están estudiando en la escuela de Ceraturo. Antes de ser socia de la Fundación trabajaba conjuntamente con su esposo en una hacienda la  Victoria del Portete  como peones, sacando leche de las vacas, en labores del campo, su horario era de 6 AM. A 6 PM. En esta hacienda los jefes eran algunos buenos y otros malos, pero lo que no le gustaba a María era que no los consideraban ya que debían ser cumplidos con su trabajo que no había ningún justificativo para faltar, no les importaba hijos ni enfermedades. Es socia más o menos desde el 16 de Junio de este año, un vecino del barrio les hizo conocer de la fundación y les invitó a que ingresen, pidió $110 de préstamo para comprar cuyes y hierba, para de esta manera salir de la hacienda en donde ella trabaja porque el tiempo no le alcanza para cuidar a sus hijos. Su meta es poder trabajar en la crianza de animales no solo de cuyes sino también de vacas, puercos y pollos para así progresar y poderles dar lo que ellos necesiten.

La socia Rosalía C. tiene 36 años, es casada, y tiene una hija de 16 años. Su esposo trabaja en latonería, reparando y pintando los carros, mientras ella trabaja como empleada doméstica y además vende productos cosméticas de Avon y de otras marcas también. Sus clientes son principalmente sus vecinas, amigas y conocidas. Hace 8 años que vende cosméticos, y desde niña está trabajando en los trabajos que le surgen, como empleada o en restaurantes. Ella también se encarga de los quehaceres domésticos de su propia casa. Suele trabajar desde las 7:30am hasta las 5pm. Está pidiendo este crédito de $220 para comprar productos de Avon, porque vende a crédito. Aveces la empresa hace promociones, entonces para ella le conviene cubrir los costos en estos momentos y recuperarlos después. Ella toma pedidos de sus clientes para cada quincena, y suele recibir $100-$120 en pedidos cada quincena, de los cuales un 25% es ganancia para ella (la ganancia se desminuye entre 5% y 10% después de tomar en cuenta sus costos). Este es la primera vez que ella ha sacado un préstamo. Para el futuro, le gustaría poner un negocio propio, por ejemplo un restaurante, porque le gusta mucho cocinar. 

Todos los socios y las socias están comprometidos a pagar el crédito puntualmente y de una manera responsable.
texts.en:
The Ceraturo Communal Bank is a group of 17 women and men who are residents of the Ceraturo Irquis neighborhood of Victoria del Portete, located to the south of the city of Cuenca.
