This region experiences extreme cold while fog develops in the afternoons, making it difficult for people to travel through the streets and preventing them from leaving their homes.

Member María Tránsito P., for the past 3 months, has been living in the house of her sister-in-law who currently resides abroad. María is 23 years old, married, and has 5 children (ages 9, 7, 5, 3 and 1 month). Three of the children attend school in Ceraturo. Before joining Fundación ESPOIR, she and her husband worked on the Victoria del Portete Estate as farm laborers. They milked the cows and worked in the fields. Their work schedule was from 6am to 6pm. At the estate, some of the supervisors were good and while others were bad. However, none of them liked it whenever María had to miss work or leave early to take care of her children whenever they became sick. She became a member around June 16th of this year when a neighbor told her about the Foundation and invited her to join. She is requesting a loan of $110 so that she can buy guinea pigs and grass, enabling her to quit her farm job so that she can spend more time caring for her children. Her goal is to start breeding more animals, not just guinea pigs, but also cows, pigs and chickens so that her family can get ahead and become self-sufficient.

Member Rosalía C. is 36 years old, married and has a 16 year old daughter. Her husband works in an auto body shop, repairing and painting cars. Meanwhile, she works as a domestic helper and also sells Avon cosmetic products and other brands as well. Her clients are primarily neighbors, friends and acquaintances. She has been selling cosmetics for 8 years. When she was younger she previously worked as a temporary employee, a salaried employee, and also in restaurants. She also takes charge of the domestic duties for her own home. Rosalía works from 7:30am to 5pm. She is requesting a loan of $220 to buy Avon products because she sells on credit. Sometimes the company has promotions, so she can pay for the products now and recoup the costs afterwards when customers make their payments. She takes orders from her customers every two weeks, which totals between $100-$120, of which 25% is profit. (That figure is reduced between 5-10% after taking into account the costs of the products.) This is the first time she has taken out a loan. In the future she would like to open her own business, such as restaurant, because she enjoys cooking.

All members have promised to pay their loans on time and in a responsible manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Josabeth

texts.en:
Señora Josabeth, pictured here showing some of the merchandise that she sells, is 53 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  She has one 18-year-old daughter whom she loves very much.  

Josabeth has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about seven years and is a member of the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends).  She used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in the sale of beauty products.  With this loan of 1500 soles, Josabeth plans to buy merchandise such as shoes and clothing to sell.  She will also invest in a printing machine.

Josabeth's goal is to construct a locale in front of her home where she can set up a printing shop.  She is grateful for the financial assistance she has received from Manuela Ramos, assistance that has enabled her to invest in her very own business.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and clothing for sale, as well as a printing machine.

loans.name: Nelvie

texts.en:
Nelvie B. is from the Philippine village of Gata Diot, Clarin, in the province of Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Nelvie is married and has three school-aged children. For over two years Nelvie has owned and run a sari-sari (a general store) in her local community. It is stocked with food and other necessities of daily life. She earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from this venture.

In 2009, Nelvie joined GDMPC to take advantage of its financial services. Nelvie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to expand her business and increase profits. Her goal is to improve her family’s living conditions. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nelvie from GDMPC.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her general store

loans.name: Jokudu

texts.en:
Jokudu S. is 32 years old and married to a peasant. She has five children who all go to school. Jokudu is currently in the business of selling beans and tomatoes, and is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a butchery.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de poussins

loans.name: Sadat

texts.en: Sadat I. repairs electrical appliances sells electrical parts such as multi-socket, witch boards, bulbs and so on at castle near yamoransah.  Sadat has been to tertiary.  He is married and has two children His wife is a hair dresser. Sadat has been selling electrical parts since 1998. He is responsible for of school fees and settlement of utility bills. His loan will be used to purchase more electrical parts for sale and also use for repair works. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save to invest.

loans.use: His loan will be used to purchase more electrical parts for sale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with four children, aged between 16 and 24 years. Rehema owns a two-roomed house where she is staying with five people. The family has access to electricity and piped water at home. Rehema takes care of additional family members.

Rehema pays for transport costs to and from shopping. She works six days a week. On average she receives at least 30 customers a day .She works on the outskirts of Kampala.

Rehema has been in hr business for ten years and with MCDT for eight years also, and she is servicing her sixteenth loan, working with the same group-mates. Her challenges include defaulters and the increasing price of second-hand clothes. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting selling wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Raquel Ederita

texts.es:
La señora Raquel Ederita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 23 años y 02 hijos,  que estudian y aun depende de ella. 

Lleva 03 años dedicándose a la venta de Chupetes,  motivada por ella misma y   buscando alternativas para generar fuentes de ingresos, aportar al ingreso económico en su hogar y gracias a su cualidad de ser una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, le ayudaron a iniciarse en su negocio. Nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien y poco a poco ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo por que ven que el producto que ella ofrece tiene muy buena acogida y sobretodo son atendidos con amabilidad que es lo que a ella le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de su producto como azúcar en kilos,  cajas de leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación de los chupetes, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela y dejarlos satisfechos, con la calidad y sabor delicioso que le pone a sus chupetes.

Raquel Ederita, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Raquel Ederita is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda” located in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 dependent school-aged children.

Raquel has been selling lollipops for three years. Out of her own motivation, she looked for alternative sources of revenue. Thanks to her hard work and enterprising spirit, she was able to start her business and begin generating income from home. She says she is doing very well and steadily gaining more customers. Raquel continues to manage her business to this day. Her products are well received and she treats all of her customers with kindness.

With this loan of 800 soles, Raquel will buy ingredients used in making her product such as sugar by the kilo, cartons of milk, and fruit. She prepares a wide assortment of lollipops each day so that she can attract a larger clientele and keep them satisfied. Raquel Ederita feels strong enough to continue working and persevering day after day. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping women like her and providing them with opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making lollipops

loans.name: 02.03.1.5 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en: Hoa P. Thị (24) is a 31 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Hoa is the group leader of a 4 member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 03.1.5 Nam Ngạn (02.03.1.5). Hoa is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Hoa owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. Hoa has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2007, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hoa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,442,600 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. Thị Đỡ (23) is a 59 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her livestock raising business. 2. N. Thị Tố Hảo (25) is a 59 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her general store. 3. Lê Thị Chuật (26) is a 42 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Hoa P. Thị (24) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03.1.5 (02.03.1.5). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm nung trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 9 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 3000000 VND. Vào 2007, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.442.600 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị Đỡ (23) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. Thị Tố Hảo (25) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 3. Lê Thị Chuật (26) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy T.i đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất T.n kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en:
Fuatino is 40 and married with 2 children.  She owns & operates a business venture, selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    Fuatino needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Fuatino joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fuatino's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

SPBD Social Metrics for this Borrower:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
La Señora Rene L. está sumamente agradecida por su cooperación en el crédito anterior con el cual su negocio a tenido más ingresos.
Está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertir en el negocio ya que le está haciendo falta mercancía y equipo nuevo de cocina, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá.
texts.en:
Ms. Rene L. is grateful to everybody who cooperated with her last loan thanks to which her business has increased its revenue. She asks for a new loan to invest in her business because she needs more merchandise and new cooking equipment, but at this moment she does not have the money needed for the investment an she does not want to decapitalise the business. She plans to pay back the loan with the money she will earn thanks to the investment she will make.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and new cooking equipment

loans.name: Inaya

texts.en: Inaya owns an electric motor that provides electricity for her town and its surroundings. A mother of one child, she decided to open this business because her husband is an electrician. Inaya is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase diesel fuel for the motor. She appreciates your help.

loans.use: purchase diesel fuel

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma K. is a married small-business woman. She runs a business selling fried and fresh fish at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the fish direct from the fishermen at Kigamboni Ferry fish market center. She has been in the business for three years. She needs a loan of Tshs 500,000 to buy more fish to meet her customer's demands.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Luis Eusebio

texts.es: Don Luis tiene la edad de 44 años, es un hombre trabajador, esforzado, casado, con cuatro hijos, su esposa trabaja en un banco desempeñándose como gerente lo cual se han esforzado por hacer las mejoras a su casa, como apoyar a sus hijos. El negocio del señor Luis es servicio de taxi desde hace varios años, en donde día a día recorre la capital de Managua para vender el servicio a sus clientes. En ocasiones esta malo el trabajo debido a que la gasolina esta cara y los usuarios no quieren pagar lo que se le pide,  pero hay día buenos aunque cansado pero le queda ganancias lo que le es una sastifaccion. Sus planes es poder  hacer mejora a su vivienda como repellar las paredes, pintar y hacer el baño de concreto ya que lo tiene forrado de platico y le es un poco incomodo y de poca privacidad e higiénico lo cual es una necesidad hacer esta mejora para su familia. Ya que gracias a estos préstamos ha podido salir adelante con las necesidades del taxi como ahora en la construcción del baño el cual comprara materiales de construcción para comenzar hacer la obra compra de piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, piso entre otros que se necesite para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Luis is 44 years old and is a hard-working man who is married with four children. His wife is a manager at a bank, and they both have worked hard to improve their home. Luis has had a taxi business for a number of years where from day to day he travels throughout the capital city of Managua offering his service to customers. On occasion the work is tough, when gasoline is expensive and customers don't want to pay that prices he quotes them, but there are good days when although he is tired he is very satisfied with his profits. His goal is to be able to make improvements to his home, such as replace the walls, paint and add a concrete bathroom since the one they currently have is lined with plastic and is a little uncomfortable while lacking privacy and hygiene, so he sees the improvements as a necessity for his family. Thanks to these loans Luis has been able to make headway as a taxi driver as well as make home improvements, like building the bathroom, for which he'll purchase the construction materials to start the work, including stones, sand, cement, iron, flooring, among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stones, sand, cement, iron and flooring to make a bathroom that will give his family more privacy and hygiene.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan A. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 52 years-old and married with eight adult children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She also sells soft drinks and dairy products. Susan has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Susan joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Susan is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is 46 years old and married with four children. His children are excelling in school and this makes him happy. He sells clothes at retail prices to his customers in the market. He hopes to own a classic boutique in the future. He loves this business because his customers pay cash when they come to purchase clothes. He does not want to incur debt in his business. He is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. He duly says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: James Wanyoike

texts.en:
James is 40 years old and he is in the business of transporting people and goods from one place to another using his motorcycle. He is married to Charity who is a businesswoman and they have one son and two daughters. 

James was introduced to Kadet by another client. He plans to purchase another motorcycle with the loan. With the extra profits expected from the business, he intends to buy a Three Wheeler Taxi (Tuk Tuk) for his transport business. 

In the near future he hopes to buy a Nissan Matatu for his transport business. James describes himself as a person who loves people and is very jovial.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Las Sauceñitas Group

texts.es: El banco “Las Sauceñitas” esta representada por la señora Verónica Victoria y conformado por 15 miembros donD. 8 son mujeres y 7 son varones, este banco esta caracterizado principalmente por la confianza entre los socios y su dinamismo. La señora Verónica Victoria quien es la actual presidenta es casada, el nombre D. su esposo es Hugo con el que comparte 2 bellos niños, verónica a demás D. ser una madre dedicada trabaja en un pequeño negocio D. distribución D. productos D. estética y arreglo personal del cual también es propietaria, con muchos esfuerzos Verónica Victoria y su esposo lograron construir su casa propia y ambos trabajan día a día a fin D. mantener a sus niños. El resto del grupo principalmente las mujeres se dedican a la elaboración y venta D. pan y masitas, asimismo los varones en su mayoría se dedican al área D. la construcción y transporte urbanos con sus taxis propios, otras actividades a las cuales se dedican otros socios es la venta D. comida, venta por cartilla, venta D. cds, es importante mencionar que gran parte D. las socias que integran el grupo venden hace bastantes años en el mismo lugar y son vecinas. El grupo en si tiene bastante experiencia en las actividades que realizan. El crédito será utilizado como capital D. trabajo, compra D. materias primas y enseres para el negocio y solucionar  algunos problemas que les impiden desempeñarse plenamente en sus negocios (compra D. llantas para vehículos, y algunas refacciones en estos). Si bien el banco es nuevo y esta en su primer ciclo, muchos D. los socios tienen experiencia en créditos comunales y se los pueD. calificar como personas confiables gracias a las reuniones previas en las cuales se efectúa la evaluación D. los socios.
texts.en:
Verónica Victoria represents the Las Azucenitas Communal Bank. The bank is comprised of 15 members. There are eight women and seven men. This bank is characterized primarily by the trust among the members and their dynamism. Verónica Victoria, the current president, is married. Her husband’s name is Hugo, and they have two beautiful children. Besides being a devoted mother, Verónica works in a small business that distributes aesthetical and personal grooming products. She is the owner of the business. With much effort Verónica Victoria and her husband built their own house. They both work day to day in order to support their children. The rest of the group, especially the women, make and sell bread and pastries. Most of the men work in the area of construction or urban transportation with their own taxis. Other activities the members do are selling food, catalog sales, or selling CDs. It is important to mention that a large part of the members of the group have been selling in the same place for years, and they are neighbors. The group has plenty of experience in the activities they do. The loan is to be used as working capital to buy raw materials and utensils for their businesses. It will also be used to solve some problems that keep them from fully doing their jobs in their businesses (buy tires for vehicles, and some vehicle repairs). The bank is new and in its first cycle, but many of the members have experience with communal loan. They are able to qualify as trustworthy people thanks to the member evaluation that was completed at the previous meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a mother of 5 and she is a widow. She is 39 years of age and she lives in Lagos. She operates a beauty salon and also sells hair extension, cosmetics and clothes in her shop for more income. She has been in the business for the past 9 years and she has more customers that patronize her due to relationship with them. With the profit from this business could provide for her fatherless children's education and well being.

Ruth would like her business to grow in future by buying more hair extension directly from the manufacturers at a more reduce price, this she said will increase her productivity and profitability. She hopes for the loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more hair extension and cosmetics to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for this privilege.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extension and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en: Baktygul O. is the leader of this group. She is 52 and married and her husband works as an electrical repairman. She has raised three sons and two daughters. The older son lives with his grandparents and helps them with their housework. The second son works in Karakol at a heat-electro power station. The older daughter is married and lives in Bishkek with her family. Seventeen years ago, with an initial investment of 1,000 soms, Baktygul began to sell convenience goods at the market. Her younger daughter and son help her with this activity. This business made it possible for her to pay for her children's education and she also bought a truck. Now she wants to get a loan to purchase hosiery (socks, stockings, tights) to sell. In the autumn, Baktygul plans to get another loan, a larger one, to buy apples in order to sell them in the winter and make good money. Zhanylkan A. is 52 and is a widow. She has raised six sons and a daughter. Three sons are married and live separately in Bishkek with their families. The younger daughter is a student, and Zhanylkan’s three other sons help Zhanylkan with housework. In 1994 Zhanylkan sold potato dumplings. Then she saved some money and began to sell foodstuffs that were more profitable. Now she makes 5,000 soms a month. With the money received from this loan, Zhanylkan will purchase 100 kg of sugar and several kinds of macaroni. Sabira K. is 55 and is a widow. She raised eight children: two daughters are married and live separately with their families; the other children help Sabira with housework. In 1998 Sabira's husband died and, to make money, she started to sell foodstuffs at the market. Then her friends advised her to sell meat in order to make more money. Now she sells meat in her own pavilion and, in this way, she makes 4,000 soms a month. Sabira wants to get a loan to purchase sheep to sell. Suyumkan A. is 54 and is a widow. She raised two daughters and a son. Her son works in Kemin and he lives there with his family. The daughters are students; when they are free, they help their mom to sell meat. With money received from the loan, Suyumkan will purchase five sheep to sell. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase hosiery to sell

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is married with a teenage son, Nikita. She runs a public cafeteria in her home town of Mukachevo, Western Ukraine. Raisa’s pricing policy is reasonable and meals are always fresh and nutritious. She launched this enterprise only a year ago and has already invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in the business. 

Raisa is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to design and build a small children’s playground next to her cafeteria. This feature will be an additional attraction for her business, bringing in families by offering a well-equipped play area for kids. Raisa understands the responsibility and wants to make sure the playground conforms to all the required safety standards. We believe the loan will be an reasonable investment in the further development of this enterprise.

loans.use: to build children's playground next to her cafeteria

loans.name: Reyna Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Reyna es madre de tres hijos, de edad de 33 años, es una mujer dedicada al negocio en la venta de  carne de res,  desde hace varios años, con ayuda de su esposo comenzó a comprar carne en el carnit que esta a pocos kilómetros de su casa
Su esposo es mecánico y trabaja en un taller. Son de pocos recursos económicos, es por eso que para ella es importante su negocio ya que así ayuda  a sus hijos, su casa aun de zinc viejo, de tierra, las condiciones no han sido las mejores, siendo su objetivo hacer su casa de concreto es por eso con este préstamo lograra comprar piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar hacer el arranque para poder tener un techo mejor. 
Para ella no es fácil ya que tiene que tratar que los alimentos ajusten, las medicina cuando se enferman, los niños,  es  por eso se la había hecho difícil la mejora a su casa. lo que lograra con este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna is a mother to three children; she is 33 years old and a dedicated woman to her business where she sells meat and for some years with the help of her husband she began to buy meat in a beef market that is a few kilometers from her home.

Her husband is a mechanic and works in a repair shop. They have limited income and it is important for her to keep her business since she gets to help her children. Reyna’s home is still made of old zinc, and dirt, living conditions are not the best and her objective is to make her house out of concrete and with this loan she will buy stones, sand, cement, and steel to start building and to have a better roof.

For her it is not easy since she has to prepare the food and medicine when the children get sick and because of that she has had trouble improving her home and she will be able to do this now thanks to the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to start building a better roof.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda H. is from the village of Upper Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing and shoe products in the local community. Chanda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Chanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Isabel Johana

texts.es:
La Señora. Isabel Johana V. es socia del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por el centro histórico de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, fue nombrada como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad el 1 de diciembre de 1999, su gastronomía, su gente y su cultura hacen de esta una ciudad hermosa y calida.

La Señora. Isabel Johana tiene 25 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad,  y va a ingresar este año al jardín de infantes, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en un taller de ropa deportiva, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia es comerciante de frutas, vende en un puesto que tiene en un mercado de la ciudad de Cuenca, trabaja todos los días desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m., realiza esta actividad hace 3 años.

Se encuentra en su quinto ciclo en  la fundación y los créditos le han servido para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar más frutas para su negocio.

Su sueño es  que su esposo tenga un negocio propio de confección de ropa deportiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel Johana V. is a member of the Communal Bank “Sociedad 12 de Abril” (April 12th Society). She lives in the historical center of the city of Cuenca, which is known for having beautiful architecture and being named a World Heritage Site on December 1, 1999. The food, people, and culture make this city an inviting and friendly place.

Sra. Isabel Johana is 25 years old, married, and has a five year old son who attends kindergarten. Her husband works at a sportswear shop. Since they do not own a home, they currently live in a rental property.

Isabel is a fruit merchant. She sells from a stand at a market in the city of Cuenca every day from 7am to 3pm. Isabel has been in this business for three years. She is in her fifth loan cycle with Fundación ESPOIR and used her previous loans to invest in her business. This new loan will be used to buy more fruits.

Her dream is for her husband to have his own business manufacturing sportswear.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bananas, papayas, melons, mangoes, coconuts, and other fruits

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with two children, a boy and a girl who both attend school. Her husband works in the hotel industry and he contributes to his family's needs. Eunice rents a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Eunice has been operating an open food market business for the last five years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. With this KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase a bundle of cooking flour, 50 kg of cooking oil and a sack of beans. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a restaurant in the future. Eunice decided to work with Yehu so as to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase cooking flour, cooking oil and beans

loans.name: Bolortsetseg

texts.en: Bolortsetseg T. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Darhan-Uul province of central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest son and daughter currently attend a local secondary school and her youngest will soon start kindergarten. Her husband, Darkhanchu, operates a taxi service in the local area, using the family car as a taxi. Bolortsetseg operates a small cafe in her town. She serves a variety of traditional Mongolia dishes to her many customers. She opened for business in 2008 and has built a stable customer base, growing her operation in a short time. She has developed her skills as a cook and used her income to improve her customer seating area and to purchase new equipment. She hopes to soon hire more workers and increase her food variety to attract new customers.  Bolortsetseg is a gentle and honest person. She and her husband have used their business success to improve the quality of life of their family. She says "I try very hard to raise my children to be well educated, honest people". Bolortsetseg is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more food for her cafe and begin producing new types of meals.

loans.use: To purchase more food.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula  G. T.   es una señora de 41 años que  vive con su esposo y 5  Hijos  en una comunidad llamada Coquital, es destacada por ser una zona montañosa y por su cercanía con la frontera Norte de Costa Rica.

Dona Paula se dedica a la venta de leche agraria y de quesos. En su corral tiene ya varias vaquitas pero asegura que ya no son suficientes para abastecer la demanda de su comunidad. Por eso ella necesita un préstamo de ¢609.000 (seiscientos  nueve mil colones) para la comprar de más vaquitas y así aumentar su producción 


Ella  forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  crédito  y asegura que será un gran impulso para su negocio.
texts.en:
Paula G. T. is a 41 year old woman who lives with her husband and 5 children in a community called Coquital. Coquital stands out as a mountainous zone that is located near to the Northern border of Costa Rica. Paula sells cow's milk and cheeses. In her farmyard, she has several cows, but she says that she does not have enough to fill the demand in her community. For this reason, she needs a loan of ¢609.000 (six hundred nine thousand colones) to purchase more cows and thus increase her production. She is part of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she knows that it will provide a great boost for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing fattened cows

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 26 years old and is married with four children. She is well-known in the business of selling shoes and this is her second year in this business. Her shop is open from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

Louise needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business through adding women’s shoes as well as children’s. With this business expansion, she will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and enable her to continue providing the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding women’s shoes as well as children’s

loans.name: Luzviminda's Group

texts.en: Luzviminda P. is from the village of D. V., Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Luzviminda is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Luzviminda is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruits and vegetables in the community. Luzviminda is just starting this business. In 2010, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Luzviminda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Nueva Esperanza  esta compuesta por tres integrantes  2 mujeres  y un varón,  La representante del grupo es la Sra. Celia es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora se dedica a la venta D. verduras el dinero del credito sera para la compra D. mercaderia como ser tomate por cajas, zanahoria una carga, etc y asi D. esta manera incrementar su capital D. trabajo, viven  en la zona D. Villa Obrajes, es un grupo D. amigos  D.  hace muchos años, son muy conocidos  por ser personas muy responsables y trabajadoras,  trabajan todos los días, el préstamo lo destinaran para su mercadería , compra D. una garrafa y azúcar , herramientas D. trabajo, están muy agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The Nueva Esperanza support group is maD. up of three members, 2 women and one man. The group representative is Celia. She is a very responsible and hard working woman who sells vegetables. The money from the loan will be used to buy merchandise such as crates of tomatoes, a load of carrots, etc. In this way she will increase her working capital. They live in the Villa Obrajes area. This is a group of long time friends who are well known for being responsible and hardworking people. They work everyday. The loan will be used for merchandise such as a barrel of sugar, and work tools. They are very grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Marisa Leticia

texts.es: Doña Marisa Leticia, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, es estudiante y maestra a la vez, ya que imparte clases en una escuela de la cual proviene su fuente de ingreso, actualmente estudia para tener un mejor futuro, y por necesidades estudiantiles se acercó a las oficinas de ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo, que le servira para gastos eventuales de estudio y compra de material didactico, es una persona trabajadora y responsable, por los que tiene grandes espectativas de superación para darle de esta forma un mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Marisa Leticia, 38, has three children.  She’s both a student and a teacher because she teaches in a local school, which is her main source of income, and she is also studying in order to have a better future.

She approached ASDIR’s offices to request a loan that will serve to pay educational fees and to buy teaching supplies.

She is a hard working, responsible person with great expectations for personal growth in order to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: For educational expenses.

loans.name: Shukur

texts.en: Shukur B. is 45 years old man who sells meat in his own butcher shop for the last four years. He is married and has four children.  He is working as teacher in the local school but his main income is generated from selling meat.  He dreams to open one more butcher shop.  He thinks he can afford it as his older son is also helping him a lot.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for sale in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Nancy Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy Guadalupe; ella tiene 46 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. hospedaje, la socia trabaja como administradora, ella trabaja desD. las 6:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m  y también se dedica a la venta D. uso D. cremas son productos cosméticos y también productos naturales, la socia quiere mejorar su hospedaje. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el hospedaje.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nancy Guadalupe is a member of the “Liderando Las Palmeras” Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province, Cusco department.

Nancy Guadalupe is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of providing lodging.  She works as the manager from 6:00 a.m. until 11:00 p.m.  She also sells creams, which are cosmetic products, and natural products.  

She wants to improve her boarding-house, and she is requesting the loan to help her boarding-house.

She is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: To improve her boarding-house

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Socorro

texts.es:
Jacqueline es madre de tres hijos, casada con oficio de costura por más de catorce años apoyando a su familia, su esposo labora como mecánico y soldador siendo muy responsable.
También los fines de semana hacen sopa y nacatamales para ayudarse con más entradas de ingreso, logrando cumplir con sus compromisos de pago.  Contenta en donde Afodenic ha sido una puerta al cambio de mejora en su inversión de venta de ropa. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara tela, bordados, hilos, para su costura a si como materia prima para elaborar mas comida los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Jacqueline has three children.  She is married and works as a dressmaker.  She has been in this business for more than fourteen years, supporting her family.  Her husband works as a mechanic and a welder.  He is very responsible

On weekends, Jacqueline also makes soup and 'nactamales' (Nicaraguan tamales - steamed corn dumplings with a savory filling, wrapped in a plantain leaf) to help make more income.  This way she manages to fulfil her payment commitments.  Jacqueline is happy as Afodenic has been a door to change and improvement, allowing her to invest in her clothes sales business.  She will use this new loan to buy fabric, embroideries and threads for her sewing as well as supplies so that she can make more food to sell  at weekends.

loans.use: To buy fabric, embroidered items and threads.  To buy supplies for making food to sell at weekends

loans.name: Sop Seydina Mahamed Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité SOP SEYDINA MAHAMED a été crée le 14 mai 2010. Il est composé de 07 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de GABAR

FATOUMATA B. est une femme de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 06 enfants. Elle est debout à l'estrême droite de la photo et est responsable du groupe. 

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et du maraîchage. Elle cultive des oignons , des carottes, et des choux)

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux faire activité d'embouche et de maraîchage

Elle soutien son mari dans le prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The Sop Seydina Mahamed solidarity group has been created on May 14, 2010. It is composed of 7 women, all from the same village. They are neighbors and friends who decided to form a group together. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Gabar. 

Fatoumata B. is a 37-year old woman. She is married and the mother of six. She is standing on the far right in the photo and is the group leader. She raises sheep and grows produce, such as onions, carrots, and cabbage. Her new loan will allow her to improve her animal selling and gardening business. She  helps her husband provide for their family.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Pourn

texts.en: Pourn S., 50, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia – an area known for Angkorean temples. S. sells groceries and snacks, earning $5 US per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning $3 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $30 US on food and $45 US on other expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $400 US to hire people to help harvest her rice. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To hire people to help harvest her rice

loans.name: Pang

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of Mr. Pang R.'s daily activites in the garment industry. He s 26 years old and has been working at his job for over a year. Pang R. lives with his aging mother who stays home and manages the household. 

Pang R. is concerned about his difficulties traveling to his workplace. He does not own his own vehicle and therefore either walks to work or hires a taxi. To solve this problem, Pang R. has requested a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a motorcycle so that he may get to work without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 61 years old. Fe is widowed and has seven adult children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling dried fish like "bolinao" & "sap-sap" in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Fe is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of dried fish. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish

loans.name: Lekoko

texts.en:
Lekoko O. M., 37, is married to his wife, Leah.  He is the father of six children, who currently attend school.  He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.
  
He has been a farmer in the town of Narok for the last ten years.  He learned about KADET from their credit officers. This will be M.'s second loan, which will be used to purchase items for his farm. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to expand his farming activity and better provide for his family.  M.’s dream is engage in large scale farming and attain financial independence.

loans.use: to purchase items for this farm

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe T. is from the village of Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 56 years old. Cleofe is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Cleofe owns & operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Cleofe has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Cleofe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cleofe is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Cleofe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Digna, ella tiene 79 años y hace varios años quedo viuda pero de esa relación tuvo 11 hijos, en la actualidad ya todos son mayores de edad, una de sus hijas vive en su casa. Está en el Banco comunal hace 21 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que ha recibido en todos estos años que ha estado en el.

Tiene un kiosco donde vende ceviches y encebollados, platos muy apetecidos por los habitantes de la ciudad y del país en sí. Trabaja con la ayuda de su hija todos los días  desde  las 6h00 hasta las 15h00 o hasta que se termine lo que preparo, nos cuenta que tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos.  También vende gaseosas, aguas, jugos y cervezas. En la actualidad está por poner en su negocio la venta de sanduches y batidos de fruta para tener más variedad.
 
Este crédito es para comprar dos licuadoras para este nuevo negocio, pescado, yuca, colas, aguas, cervezas, etc.

Sus sueños son tener un gran negocio y seguir creciendo más con el pasar de los días.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the 'Esperanza y Progreso' (Hope and Progress) community bank meets in Montecristi canton.  This area is well known both nationally and internationally for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Here we meet 79 year-old Digna.  Several years ago, Digna became a widow but she has 11 children from her relationship.  All of her children are now grown up and one of her daughters lives with her.  Digna has been a member of her community bank for 21 loan cycles and she likes it because of the help that she has received over the years that she has been a member.

Digna has a stall where she sells 'ceviche' (a seafood dish) and 'encebollados' (a traditional dish made from tuna, cassava, tomatoes and onion).  These meals are very popular with the inhabitants of this city and also with people elsewhere in the country.  Digna works every day with her daughter's help, from 6.00am to 3.00pm or until she has sold all of the food she has prepared.  She tells us that she has a lot of customers who are loyal to her business because of the flavor that she gives to her dishes.  Digna also sells soda, water, juices and beer.  She is currently about to start selling sandwiches and smoothies in order to offer her customers more variety.

Digna will use this loan to buy two blenders for this new business and also fish, cassava, coca cola, water, beer, etc.  Her dreams are to have an important business and to continue growing over time.

loans.use: to buy two blenders, fish, cassava, coca cola, water, beer, etc.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana N. is 35 years old and currently in a business selling alcohol. Married to a soldier, they have three children unfortunately none of them in school. Her future goal is to build a house.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol.

loans.name: Simon Kabere

texts.en:
Simon Kabere M. is 29 years old and married to Mary Muthoni, who contributes to the family income. He has two children aged one and three years old. He has been running his motorcycle transport business for a period of about two years with an income of 6,000 KES a month.

This is Simon’s first loan cycle with KADET after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. He wants to use his loan to buy a piece of land with his group members. He hopes to give his children a quality education and build rental houses.

loans.use: to use it to buy a piece of land with his group.

loans.name: Sugey Maria

texts.es:
Sugey, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada, es madre de dos hijos de 13 y 6 años de edad respectivamente, ella es originaria de León, de oficio comerciante ella es dueña de una pulpería y tiene una  mini tienda de ropa y zapatos. Ella inicio este negocio cuando tenia 30 años de edad ella vende pantalones, sandalias, camisas, ropa, interior, productos Avon así como también vende arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche en su pulpería. Con los ingresos de su pulpería mantiene su hogar  y paga la educación de sus hijos, antes ella se dedicaba  a la venta de cosa de horno(Pan de maíz),ropa para  niños , vendía en las calles, además otro medio de subsistencia que tenia era que daba clases privadas de para niños de primaria. Hoy en día vive de los ingresos de su venta y del aporte de su esposo que trabajo como conductor de taxi.
Solicito el préstamo para comprar mercadería tales como ropa, zapatos, cosméticos para la temporada del día de las madres, ya que en esta época es buena para las ventas. Esta inversión le ayudara a   poder ofrecer mas productos nuevos, disponibilidad de inventario para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, atraer más compradores, incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sugey is 36 years old, married and is a mother to two children of 13 and 6 years of age. She is originally from León and is a saleswoman and owns a general store and has a mini clothing and shoe store. She began her work when she was 30; Sugey sells pants, sandals, shirts, underwear, Avon products as well as rice, oil, sugar, and milk in her grocery store. With the earnings from her grocery store she is able to support her home and pays for her children’s education. Before she sold baked goods (cornbread) and children’s clothing in the street, another way to make money was giving private classes for primary school children. At present, she lives from her sales and her husband’s income as a taxi driver.

Sugey needs the loan to buy merchandize like clothing, shoes, makeup for the mothers’ day season since it is a good time for sales. This loan will help her offer new products, have the available inventory needed by her customers demands, have more buyers and to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: buy merchandize like clothing, shoes, makeup for the mothers’ day season.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Chek, age 32, is a farmer. When he can spare the time from his farming efforts, he also engages in construction work. He is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to and from his workplace.
 
Chek is unmarried and lives with his parents, brothers, and sisters in a village along National Road Number Six, about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to and from his workplace

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced farming in the town of Olkalou for the last 21 years. He is 51 years old, married to Rachael, and they have five school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He plans to plant potatoes in his farm. He will use the loan  to buy the seeds and fertilizer and also to pay for labor during planting. 

In the future, Samuel hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds, fertilizer, and pay for labour

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es:
Maria Manuela tiene 24 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos que son solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  BELLAVISTA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 11 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y otras actividades.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz, además tiene 5 cabezas de ganado. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta pasear y festejar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Maria Manuela is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has two children.

The members of the Bellavista Community Bank live in Papauco Pucara community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton, 15 minutes from our offices.  This bank has 11 members who farm, raise animals and carry out other business activities.

María is a farmer who grows potatoes, wheat and corn.  She also owns 5 head of livestock.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda market and makes her sales in the wholesale market in the same town.

María is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own home.

María enjoys going for walks and celebrating Carnival.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for her animals

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana is 42 years old and lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of four school-age children. Rosana has a food business to make a living. She sells expensive fish in the local market everyday. She sells fish like blue marlin and tuna. She has been engaged in this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 from this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase expensive fish to sell. Rosana has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Rosana hopes to gain more income from her business and purchase a motorcycle to be used for her business.

loans.use: To purchase expensive fish to sell.

loans.name: Zuberi

texts.en:
Zuberi is married with three children aged 3 to 8 years old. Zuberi has been selling firewood in a residential area since 2009. In order to meet the needs of his customers, Zuberi intends to use his loan to buy more firewood for his business. In addition to selling firewood, Zuberi also sells chickens.

Zuberi hopes to become a large supplier of firewood in the area. He also hopes to raise enough chickens for meat and eggs so that he can sustain his family. Zuberi describes himself as an honest individual.

loans.use: to buy more firewood

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is married and her husband is involved in a livestock business. He gets milk from his cattle and sells it to the milk shops and community people. He also sells animals such as buffaloes and goats to customers who require them and earns a good profit.  

Sakina is very skillful. On a part-time basis, she sews clothes for her neighborhood clients.  She is the mother of five children. Two of them study while the others stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her husband wants to buy some more animals to sell after raising them. He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and Sakina hopes that an investment will be a productive one for him and it will improve the living standard of her family as a result.

loans.use: To buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Marcos German

texts.es: El sr. Marcos casado tiene dos hijos ya jóvenes uno de 15 y una de 20  que se encuentran estudiando,  el es taxista trabaja de lunes a sábado de 6:00 a 23:00, su esposa se dedica a la venta de zapatos es vendedora ambulante de esta manera aporta con los gastos del hogar,  Viven en anticrético ya hace bastante tiempo en la zona de Sarco, el préstamo lo destinaran para la refacción y mantenimiento de su movilidad. El sr. Trabaja con su vehículo el cual presta servicio de taxi libre, también tiene contratos para llevar a niños a la escuela,  realiza el transporte en la zona central de Cochabamba como también en las zonas peri urbanas, es una persona muy trabajadora su deseo es tener su propia casa y el de ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en: Sr. Marcos is married and has two children who are already youths, a son who is 15 and a daughter who is 20. They are both in school. He is a taxi driver. He works Monday through Saturday from 6 am to 11 pm. His wife sells shoes. She is a roving vendor and in this way contributes to the household expenses. They have lived in an anticretico (a Bolivian housing system in which the renter makes a loan to the landlord at the beginning of the rental period) in the Sarco zone for some time. The loan will be used for the repair and maintenance of his vehicle. He uses his vehicle for work, offering service as an independent taxi, and he also has contracts to take children to school. He works in the central zone of Cochabamba as well as in the peri-urban zones. He is a hard-working person. His dream is to have his own house and to see his children have careers.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Jacinta De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jacinta De Los Ángeles tiene 34 años y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. La señora tiene en su casa un negocio de pulpería, ella vende granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes, fósforos, cigarrillo, pan, y leche. Ella ya tiene 7 años de tener este negocio, el cual empezó debido al no tener ingreso para mantener su hogar, esto con el objetivo de brindar manutención a sus hijos. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras variadas de sus productos, ya que quiere empezar a vender más. Además, aduce la señora, cada día los precios de los productos están cada día más caros. Este se ha convertido en un desafió para ella, debido a que la situación económica del país cada día está más difícil.
texts.en: Jacinta de los Ángeles is 34 and has two small children. She runs a small store from her home, selling staples, candy, detergent, matches, cigarettes, bread and milk.  She has managed her business for the past 7 years, and started it to generate household income to better care for her children.  She seeks this credit to buy varied merchandise to stock and to increase sales.  She notes that every day prices seem to increase, and this is challenge for her business amidst the current difficult economic situation of her country.

loans.use: to buy staples, candy, detergent, matches, cigarettes, bread and milk

loans.name: Faty

texts.fr: Madame Faty  vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée  et  âgée de 56 ans. Elle évolue dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans et vends des tissus et autres articles divers. C’est depuis le bas âge  qu’elle a commencé a exercer le petit commerce. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2000. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et autres articles divers en vue d’élargir son activité de commerce. Ce financement lui permettra de diversifier son offre de marchandises  et répondre à la demande croissante de la clientèle de veille de fête  de Tabaski.  L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux subvenir à ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en:
Faty is 56 years old, married and lives in Senegal. She has been developing a retail business for the past 10 years and sells fabric and other miscellaneous products. She was quite young when she started out. 

A member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since 2000, Faty is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy fabric and other products so that she can expand her business. This loan will allow her to offer a diverse range of items and to meet her customers' demands as the Tabaski festival approaches.  Increased profit will allow her to better meet her social expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other merchandise for re-sale.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg is 33 years old and lives with her child and husband in a ger or Mongolian yurt in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her son is a high school student and her husband works as a driver. Last year, she began renting space at a local store and started selling shoes and clothes. Before that, she earned a living as a hairdresser, but her new business is more profitable. In the future, she plans to buy and move into her own commercial space. She believes that she can do this because she is hardworking and diligent. Uranchimeg is applying for a loan for 1,500,000 MNT to buy more items from China, including shoes, to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more items from China to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chimusana Group

texts.en: Nelson is 37 years old and lives in Masvingo with his wife and 4 children, 3 of whom are still in school. Nelson earns a living by selling clothes and shoes in the local market. He is also a mechanic and does part-time jobs to supplement his income. The main problem he faces is insufficient capital. He will use the money he borrows to increase his stock and hopes that the profits will enable him to provide a better future for his children. In time he wants to operate from his own shop in the town.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa D. 38 años D. edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos,  cuenta con servicios sólo D. luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Rosa se dedica a la venta D. cerveza y elaboración, venta D. chicha D. jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base D. maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú), esta actividad los realiza desD. hace un año, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado D. generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas D. la chicha D. jora y cerveza en la zona donD. vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y solventar sus gastos personales.  También críay comercializa aves D. corral y así pueD. contar con otro ingreso para su hogar.

Teniendo la oportunidad D. crecer Rosa a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 800 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad D. cerveza, harina D. maíz para la elaboración D. chicha D. jora y alimento balanceado para sus aves D. corral, con la finalidad D. obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y para que pueda seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 38, lives in her own house wtih her husband and children.  The only utility the house has is electricity and it is located in a rural area of the TambogranD. district which belongs to the department of Piura.  The local people are involved in agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.

Rosa sells beer and makes and sells "chicha D. jora" (a local drink maD. from corn which is consumed widely in northern Peru).  She has been in business for a year.  The tradition for making the drink is passed from generation to generation.  Lately sales of chicha D. jora and beer have increased where she lives, which has increased her income and allowed her to cover her personal expenses.  She also raises chickens for an additional income.


Since there is an opportunity to grow, Rosa has requested a loan in the amount of 800 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa so she can buy larger quantities of beer, corn flour for the chicha D. jora and balanced feed for the chickens.  Her goal is to earn a larger profit and increase her customer base, allowing her to pay back the loan and continue giving her family economic support.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of beer, corn flour to make "chicha de jora" (local beverage) and balanced feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Sab Favian Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama san Fabián  y se integra de tres personas quienes cada una se dedica a su actividad  quien se le tomo la entrevista es la señora Miguelina quien es casada con  el señor  Alberto y con quien procreo  cinco hijos quienes ya todos están casados.

   Ella solito el préstamo para invertirlo en  la compra de  mercancía como son: frijol, aceite, harina, galletas, jabón, entre otros, ya que le hacen falta algunas cosas que sus clientes  requieren comprar y no tiene, para eso necesita el préstamo y surtirse con esos productos.

   Para iniciar con este negocio lo animo una de sus hijas quien le dio unos centavitos para comenzar y así tener sus propios ingresos para su hogar y es como inicio y ve que le está dando resultados, ya que ha mejorado  un poco mas sus ganancias.

    Lo que ella desea   es que con esta actividad y el préstamo es  seguir trabajando  y que  los prestamistas la sigan apoyando   hasta que dios le preste vida.
 
   Quienes integran en el grupo son las señoras: Rosa Nelly quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de zapatos por catalogo, así también se integra   Nelly Denisse quien también invertirá en la compra de zapatos por catalogo.
texts.en:
The group is called “Fabián” and it’s made up of three people who have their own activities.  The interview was of Miguelina who is married to Alberto with whom she had five children who are all now married.

She asked for the loan to buy merchandise like beans, oil, flour, cookies and soap, among others because she needs a few things that her customers need to buy and she is out of and that’s what she needs the loan for to stock up on those products.

To launch this business she was encouraged by one of her daughters who gave her a little money to start out and have her own source of income and that’s how she got started and she sees that it’s producing results and her profits have improved somewhat.   What she wants is that with this activity and with the loans to continue working and that lenders will continue supporting her as long as God keeps her alive.

The group members are: Rosa Nelly who will use the loan to buy shoes via catalogue and Nelly Denisse who will also buy shoes via catalogue.

loans.use: to pay for stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia es una mujer de 44 años y convive con Carlos, su pareja. Ambos tienen 2 hijos de 15 y 11 años; y habitan una casa propia en el Distrito de La Unión. Silvia y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura.
