En terrenos agrícolas de su propiedad siembra arvejas, habas, espinacas, zanahorias, etc. Productos cuya cosecha es muy rentable en temporadas, por ejemplo, estos meses la arveja tiene buena demanda, subiendo su precio. Así también se encarga de la crianza y venta de animales menores, como son los cuyes. “Mis clientes ya me conocen, vienen a mi casa cada cierto tiempo para comprar cuyes”, comenta Silvia, además cuenta que cada cuy lo vede a 15 soles ganado un promedio de 5 soles por animal. “Ambos negocios tienen sus ventajas, en la chacra tengo que esperar mínimo 4 meses para obtener ganancias, mientras que con los animales los ingresos son semanales, hasta diarios”, explica. Con el pasar del tiempo, Silvia espera ver a sus hijos cursar estudios superiores y desarrollándose en buenos trabajos, por tal motivo, ella y su esposo seguirán laborando para realizar sus metas. Éste sería el segundo préstamo que Silvia recibiría gracias a su ayuda, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Ángeles de la Unión 2”, se siente a gusto en su grupo comunal. Silvia con el crédito podrá comprar 2 sacos de abonos con 300 soles aproximadamente y con lo restante comprará cuyes para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 44-year-old woman who lives with Carlos, her partner.  The couple have two children, aged 15 and 11, and they live in their own home in La Unión district.  Silvia and her husband are farmers.  On farmland which they own, they grow peas, beans, spinach, carrots, etc.  These are products whose harvest is very profitable according to the season.  For example, right now peas are in good demand and so their price rises.  Silvia also raises and sells animals such as guinea pigs.  "My customers know me.  They come to my house every so often to buy guinea pigs" comments Silvia.  In addition, she tells us that she sells each guinea pig for 15 soles and earns on average 5 soles per animal.  "Both businesses have their advantages.  On the farm, I have to wait a minimum of 4 months to make profits whilst, with my animals, the income is weekly or even daily", she explains.  Over time, Silvia hopes to see her children pursue their higher education and make progress in good jobs.  For this reason, she and her husband will continue to work to achieve their goals.

This will be the second loan that Silvia has received with your help.  For this reason, she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  She belongs to the "Los Ángeles de la Unión 2" community bank and feels happy with her community bank.  With her loan, Silvia will be able to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer for approximately 300 soles and use the rest to buy guinea pigs to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer, and guinea pigs

loans.name: Cristelyn

texts.en:
Cristelyn is 19 years old and single. She has helped her parents in managing their corn farming business for three years. Cristelyn plants corn crops on their five hectares farm land.

Cristelyn would like to borrow additional capital from lenders because her profits are not large enough to improve her five hectares of farm land. To this purpose, she is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000. This amount will be used to buy certified seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides and to pay for the labor cost of plowing the farm land. She is hoping for continued financial support to further maintain her corn production. She also prays that her crops will not be damaged by calamities so that she can obtain a higher income to pay off her loans and to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for the labor cost of plowing the farm land

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past fifteen years, Hasifa has been working hard to manage her stone quarry, which mines stones and crushes them for gravel and other products. 

To help expand her business, Hasifa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hammers and other equipment for stone extraction and crushing, and will help Hasifa to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Hasifa hopes that in the future she will be able to open a retail shop. 

Hasifa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hasifa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase hammers and other equipment for stone extraction and crushing.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 19 years old and has a 6-month-old child. She has been in the business of raising pigs for 3 years. Fatima does her best to earn a living. She had to stop going to school because she had a baby.

Fatima has requested this loan to purchase piglets and feeds. She hopes to have a stable income that would help her sustain her baby and allow her to go back to school.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feeds.

loans.name: José Augusto

texts.es:
José es un padre soltero de 49 años que vive en Latacunga que es la capital de la Provincia de Cotopaxi. Es un importante centro comercial y turístico de la región centro-norte del Ecuador.  El paisaje urbano de la ciudad cautiva con sus calles estrechas, casas bajas, muchas de ellas con patios interiores que le confieren un sabor en que se une lo español con lo aborigen, lo antiguo con lo moderno. 

José vende legumbres y hortalizas en los mercados de Latacunga. Aprendió este oficio hace muchos años por un amigo. Su jornada diaria es dura ya que sale a vender su mercancía desde las 4 de la madrugada hasta las 4 de la tarde. La separación de su esposa ha sido muy difícil de superar ya que José debe mantener a sus hijos; ha pensado en invertir en la compra de un lote de legumbres y hortalizas, de esta manera su proveedor podrá darle un mejor precio y así el podrá tener mayores ingresos.

El ha tenido varios obstáculos; ha sufrido varios asaltos y en una ocasión le robaron toda su mercancía pero este tipo de cosas no desaniman a José y como todo buen padre, trabaja muy duro para ver a sus hijos tener una buena educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, 49, is a single father living in Latacunga which is the capital of Cotopaxi Province.  It is an important commercial and tourism center in Ecuador’s north-central region.  The city’s urban scape charms with its narrow streets and low houses many of which have interior patios that combine the Spanish with the Native, the ancient with the modern.

José sells vegetables and legumes in Latacunga’s markets.  He learned this occupation many years ago from a friend.  His work day is very demanding because he goes out to sell his merchandise from 4am until 4pm.  The separation from his wife has been very hard to overcome because José must support his children.  He’s thought of purchasing an entire lot of vegetables and legumes because that way his supplier can give him a better price and he’ll earn better income.

He has faced several obstacles. He’s been assaulted several times and on one occasion all of his merchandise was stolen.  But these types of things don’t discourage José and like all good fathers he works hard to see his children have a good education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an entire lot of fruit and vegetables to take advantage of the price.

loans.name: Lorena Isabel

texts.es:
Lorena, necesita invertir en su tienda de productos de primera necesidad y materia prima para pupusas, por el cual nuevamente se ha decidido a obtener otro préstamo el cual le ayudara a comprar más mercadería como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, chicharon, quesillo, harina; teniendo lo que necesita podrá mejorar la atencion a sus clientes. 
Ella con los financiamientos anteriores mejoro económicamente y toda su familia vive en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Lorena needs to invest money in her basic goods store and buy ingredients to make pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas). This made her decide to request another loan with which to buy rice, beans, oil, cracklings, soft cheese and flour. With all this, she will be able to provide a better service for her customers. 
Her financial situation and her family’s living standards improved thanks to previous loans.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, cracklings, soft cheese, flour.

loans.name: Hop

texts.en: Ms Hop is 48 years old and has two adult children. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises chickens for meat. Her business started many years ago. Joining the credit program of Kiva partner SEDA in 2004, she invested in her farming activities. For this new loan, she has requested 9,810,000 Vietnam Dong (VND) to buy chicken feed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zoir

texts.ru: Зоир всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее. Ему 53 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Так как он живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Он более 25 лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Он хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. С полученного дохода он планирует улучшить условию проживания. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zoir is always trying to improve his standard of living, and has hope for a brighter future.  He is 53 years old, married, and is raising 5 children.  Because he lives in a rural area, he has a great opportunity to expand his cattle business.  He has worked for more than 25 years raising cattle and has a lot of experience in this field.  Because of the good condition of his cattle, he has his own loyal clients.  He hopes to expand his business and increase his income.  He is asking for a loan of 7500 TJS to purchase cattle in order to increase his working capital.  WIth the income her receives, he plans to improve his standard of living.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to increase his working capital

loans.name: Arame Bakar

texts.fr:
Arame est une femme sénégalaise âgée de 50 ans établie dans le village de Ronkh, elle exerce cette activité de culture de riz de la variété sahel 108 depuis qu'elle est toute petite avec ses parents, ce prêt lui permettra d'acheter du semence de riz, de l'engrais, de l'herbicide et du gas-oil.

Elle a comme projet d'avenir: d'augmenter la surface de terre cultivable ce qui va lui permettre d'avoir une production abondante et de qualité afin de toucher d'autres marchés locaux pour la commercialisation.

loans.use: Achat de semence de riz (variété sahel 108), d'engrais, d'herbicide et de gas-oil

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Eugenie is a group leader; aged 38 years.She is married with 2 children aged 18 and 20 years. The group is called TUZAMURANE means “SUPPORT EACH OTHER” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She has a shop and has been running in a business for 6 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to pay school of children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to be a large scale distributor of clothes within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with 3 children and is 43 years. Her husband is employed and is currently educating 2 children in University. Due to her strong community mobilization and leadership skills, she holds many leadership positions in church and in the community. She is currently the area zonal chair lady responsible for supervising 8 groups. She has been in her group for 6 years.

Grace has one dairy cow, 600 chicken (layers) and a quarter acre of land under horticulture and 2 acres under tea. She gets USD 120 from milk, USD 1000 from sale of eggs, USD 150 from tea and USD 120 from horticulture sales .She started chicken farming early last year from a loan of USD 750 she got from her group has been able to meet her client’s orders. With the loan applied for she intends to improve on the housing of the chicken to ensure that they are sheltered from bad weather conditions and also that there is more space for additional chicken in future. Part of the loan will also be used to buy chicken feed in bulk.

loans.use: Grace wants to improve her poultry farming that is Buying feeds and expanding the shed to get more space.

loans.name: Awetu

texts.en:
Awetu is married with five children. She lives in an area called Mbagala in Dar es Salaam. Awetu sells 'khanga', a type of cloth worn by women, which is fitted around the waist. The cloth is very famous to the Indigenous residents of Dar es Salaam, the Wazaramo.

This type of cloth is mainly used during the traditional festivals of the Wazaramo people, but it is also used as a casual wear by most women in Tanzania. Awetu is wearing a khanga in her photograph.

Awetu sells these khanga to her customers on credit. Then she collects the debt on a monthly basis. This situation means she needs enough working capital to keep her business going.  She hopes to be able to add to her stock on time, without waiting for the debtors to pay their debts. Awetu is in need of $400 to help her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
W. is a married woman with one kid. She joined Life in Africa on the 4th of April, 2006 and joined the bracelet-making team. Before she joined Life in Africa, she was unemployed and her source of income was only through her husband.

In order to create other source of income besides the money she gets from making bracelets, she is asking for the loan to start up the business of charcoal selling that will be managed by her younger sister, who is currently unemployed.

Jesca's plan is to run this charcoal business continuously, taking on a new stock of charcoal weekly or after two weeks.

She plans to inject all the profits from the first sale to the business. She believes this will help to expand the business and also sustain it continuously.

Note: She plans to sell each sack @ 20.000/= getting a profit of 6000/= from one sack.

She is expecting a profit of 60.000/= out of the 10 sacks she is starting with.

Below is the detailed budget for her plan:

Renting a stall for three months (start): 60.000/=

Buying 10 sacks of charcoal each @ 14.000/= (start): 140.000/=

Transporting: 20.000/=

License: 20.000/=

Off-loading Charcoal: 10.000/=

Total: 250.000/=

loans.use: Purchasing Charcoal

loans.name: Khadidja

texts.en:
Khadidja was born in 1965. She is married, has 2 children and lives in Salyan region, Khaladj village. She started her business 6 years ago.
First she bought a pregnant cow and she increased the number of her cows.
Now she requests a loan of $475 to buy 2 calves for improving her business and to get a better income.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunita S., 30 years old, lives in Baghdol, Lalitpur.  Baghdol is a developing city of Nepal and the life style in this region is not so good.  Mrs. S. lives with her husband, brother-in-law and a daughter.  Her husband, brother-in-law and Mrs. S. all work together in their own grocery shop and her daughter is in primary school.

They opened the grocery shop 5 years ago.  Now they seek $150 to invest in their grocery shop to better their income.  They need the loan to purchase groceries such as rice, biscuits, chocolates, and other items to meet the demands of their customers.

Lastly, they want to save money, provide quality education for their daughter and fulfil their basic needs with their income.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Yuliati

texts.id:
Ms. Yuliati is a persistent housewife. Newcomer from Java island, she lives in a rented home for Rp125,000 (about US$13.75)/month with husband and three children. She is selling vegetables around the neighborhood on a modified motorcycle. Every day she needs Rp500,000.00-Rp750,000.00 (around $55-$83) for a nett profit of Rp50,000.00 (about $5.50). She is doing this work to add family income. Ms. Yuliati's husband is in the buying & selling motor, and a workshop business with a profit of Rp1,000,000.00 (about $110)/month. Monthly expenses a month of Rp750,000.00 (about $82.50), and children's education expenses of Rp120,000.00 (about $13.20) are her reasons. The loan will be used in her vegetable sales business; also to finance the motor buying & selling and the workshop. Ms. Yuliati hopes the loan could increase the sales volume, so that her profit could increase to Rp75,000.00 (about $8.25)/day, and her husband's business to Rp1,500.000.00 (about $165)/month.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ibu Yuliati adalah seorang ibu rumah tangga yang ulet. Pendatang dari pulau jawa ini tinggal di sebuah rumah kontrakan Rp 125.000,00/bulan bersama suami dan tiga orang anaknya. Dia berjualan sayur keliling dengan sepeda motor yang sedikit dimodifikasi. Setiap harinya dia membutuhkan modal Rp 500.000,00 – Rp 750.000,00 dan mendapatkan untung bersih Rp 50.000,00. Usaha ini dia tekuni untuk membantu menambah penghasilan keluarga. Suami Bu Yuliati memiliki usaha jual beli motor dan bengkel dengan keuntungan Rp 1.000.000,00/bulan. Biaya hidup per bulan Rp 750.000,00 dan biaya pendidikan anak per bulan Rp 120.000,00 menjadi salah satu alasannya. Pinjaman yang diperoleh akan digunakan untuk usaha jual sayur ; juga usaha jual beli motor dan bengkel. Ibu Yuliati berharap pinjaman yang diperoleh mampu menambah omzet penjualannya, sehingga keuntungannya menjadi Rp 75.000,00/hari dan keuntungan usaha suaminya menjadi Rp 1.500.000,00/bulan.

loans.use:
To buy vegetables and capital increase for buy and sell of motor and workshop (husband's)

Membeli sayuran dan tambahan modal usaha jual beli motor dan bengkel (Suami)

loans.name: Relinda

texts.es:
Reliada is a woman who on a daily basis seeks for the bettering of her children. She works with great effort for them and wants to continue to do so to build a prominent and promising future. Ever since she was a little girl, she has been dedicated to farming activities. She was raised this way and has been a stable source of income until this day. She must start very early in the day with the chores that this activity demands as well as tend her small children. Her youngest is only nine months old and must take him with her in all the chores. Now that it is sowing season she works hardly to sow and tend the fields. She and her husband will continue to work in spite of the fact that they did not obtain substantial profits last season. Luckily for them, the frost did not damage a great portion of their harvest. They hope that this time the gathering of their products will be fructuous. To continue to work and to obtain a very good quantity and quality of potatoes, wheat, corn, and peas, Relinda asks for this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Let’s show solidarity to this self-less mother that looks for what is best for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva volunteer.

Reliada, es una mujer que día a día busca la superación de sus hijos, trabaja denodadamente por ellos y quiere seguir trabajando para forjarles un futuro prominente y prometedor.Desde que era muy niña se ha dedicado a las actividades del campo, así creció y es para ella una fuente de ingresos económicos muy estable hasta el día de hoy.Desde muy temprano tiene que dedicarse a las labores que le demanda esta actividad y a la vez atender las solicitudes de sus pequeños ya que el menor de sus hijos tiene apenas nueve meses y en compañía de él tiene que realizar cada una de sus actividades; ahora que están en época de siembra trabaja con mayor esfuerzo para sembrar y posteriormente cuidar esos campos. Ella y su esposo seguirán trabajando a pesar de no haber tenido ganancias substanciales la temporada pasada y para suerte de ellos la implacable fuerza del frío no perjudicó en gran proporción sus cosechas y esperan que para esta ocasión el acopio de sus productos sea fructífero. Para seguir trabajando y para obtener una muy buena cantidad y calidad de papa, trigo, maíz y arvejas; Relinda solicita un préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos.Solidaricémonos con una madre abnegada que busca lo mejor para sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers to better the quantity and quality of her products.

loans.name: Kartini

texts.en: Kartini is a 41-year-old woman who has a small shop where she sells snacks, food and drinks, and also household products. She can earn about US$ 7 per day with a small profit. Her husband, A., has no fixed income so they work together. She's requesting a loan to expand her and her husband's business. Kartini hopes that she can increase her income to provide tuition for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her little "corner grocery store"

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma  pertenece al Banco Comunal Solidaridad, vive en Jr. Maya de Britto 651, del Distrito de Calleria  del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre de cuatro hijos  menores de edad, su esposo es chofer (transportista). Gracias al primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, Beatriz decide invertir en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su propia casa, la misma que atiende con el apoyo de sus hijos, se levanta a las 6 a.m. para abrir su negocio y atender a sus clientes hasta las 10 pm. Simultáneamente atiende los quehaceres del hogar.

Con éste préstamo de S/. 2,000 soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 3 cajas de aceite, 2 cajas de leche, 3 paquetes de fideos, 5 cajas de gaseosas, 2 bolsas de detergentes, 1 caja de jabón, 2 cientos de lejía, golosinas y 2 cajas de huevo.

Irma se siente muy tranquila y feliz porque sus sueños se están haciendo realidad puede manejar su negocio de manera independiente y al mismo tiempo ayudar a su familia en los gastos, gracias al apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Compra de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost her business.

loans.name: Nakhida

texts.en: Nakhida Q. is a 30-year-old woman who runs her small farm in the small village of Imishli. She is married and has five children. Because she and her husband are unemployed, it is very hard to cover basic family needs. Poultry and one cow are the only financial source in their family. As a solution, Nakhida has applied for $1100 USD to purchase 3 calves for $300 USD each, and with the remaining $200 USD, she is going to buy fodder.

loans.use: To purchase 3 calves and fodder

loans.name: Madzuu Mwenyelizi Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Jescar is a middle-aged, single mother with 6 children of her own and 3 orphans from her sister who died 4 years ago. As a single mother, Jescar has to struggle hard to ensure that she puts food on the table. She started her second-hand clothes business 5 years ago after working for a hospital in Nairobi as a cleaner. With the accumulated savings that she got from her earnings, Jescar was able to start her business with two bails of clothes. She now purchases 6 bails of second-hand clothes every week to sell to her regular customers, who are mostly women.

With the little profits that she earns, Jescar is still able to feed, clothe, and educate her children who are still quite young. With the help of the loan, Jescar will be able to purchase more bails of second-hand clothes to enable her to increase her business sales. Her long-term business vision is to diversify her business to a wholesale unit.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bails of clothes

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.en:
“Virgen del Rosario” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and, as a very mountainous area ranging 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level, has many limitations such as the cold, the difficulty to grow crops, and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Virgen del Rosario” is located at approximately 2,500 meters above sea level in the community of Huanchuy, in the district of Chincho, province of Angaraes. The small town of Huanchuy is located at the border of the Cachi River and used to be an old colonial hacienda. Although the village politically belongs to the region of Huancavelica, all business is done with Ayacucho, the biggest city nearby. Most members of the group have never even been to the capital of their region!

The main activities of the population are related to agriculture. The valley of Huanchuy has an excellent climate because of the relatively low altituD. and the availability of water throughout the year. The climate makes it possible to grow a great variety of products like tara and black corn and many fruits and vegetables like avocado, pacay, tuna (prickly pear cactus fruit), sugarcane, carrots, and lettuce. In higher altitudes, the population also grows potatoes. From the tuna cactus comes another product: cochinilla, a small parasite (insect) that is used for its powerful coloring for cosmetics (locals used it to paint their faces or lips in traditional festivals). Besides cultivating all of the mentioned products, most people dedicate their time to raising small animals like guinea pigs, chicken, ducks and rabbits; and bigger animals as cows and bulls.

Currently the bank is starting its first loan cycle with 12 female borrowers and a total loan of 3,400 soles (about 1,225 US$). The loans range from 200 up to 600 soles. As the group is just starting its first cycle, the group was not able to save. But all agree to save in the future for reinvestment in their businesses or maybe to buy a community sewing machine. The expectations of the members of the new village bank incluD. receiving trainings on “marketing” (how to improve their business) and learning how to weave and stitch cloths. Besides that, they think the village bank will be an excellent way to share ideas and experiences.

One of the members of the community bank is Nancy. Nancy will receive a loan of 600 soles and runs a small grocery store in the community. With her loan, she will increase her merchandise, buying more soft drinks, beers, sweets, fruits and other groceries. Nancy´s dream for the future is to have her own sewing business. With FINCA Peru, she wants to learn to save so that she can improve her business and help her father.

Maura tells another story. She sells vegetables at local weekly markets, going from one to the other. But her main market is the one in Secclla. With her 600 soles loan, she will buy more vegetables like carrots, black potato, celery and onions. Part of what she sells comes from her own small terrain, but she also buys vegetables from other members of the community. Now that she will be working with FINCA Peru, she hopes to save more and to work more responsibly to be able to pay for her loan. She will use her savings to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Buy new supplies

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en: Mrs. Samnang S. lives in Kngoak Pong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. At 27 years old, she is a mother of four: two attend a local school, while the younger two stay at home. Mrs. Samnang S. works as both a subsistence farmer and a firewood seller.  She works together with her husband, Mr. Thoeurn Than, who collects firewood which she then sells. Mrs. Samnang S. plans to build a new house, however she does not have enough money to buy timber. She would like to ask for a loan to purchase timber in order to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy timbers in order to build a new house.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi M., age 28, is married with a son aged three. She has a men's salon business which she started 2 years ago. She also owns a shop which she started one year ago. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$ 2147.

She has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand both businesses. Zawadi hopes for a new loan to expand her shop. She belongs to Tiger group.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the shop

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.en:
Ines Calcaño is determined to make a better a world for herself and her family. She lives in a town in Samaná where she can see the beautiful beaches, and she sees as many tourists as she pleases in the Dominican Republic.

Like any Dominican, her favorite foods are rice, chicken, and beans. She has three young adult children aged 20, 25, and 33. When they were little, she worked hard to bring up those future fighters of life. Now is time to fight for her own financial ease.

With the help of her small business, she is able to accomplish those desires. She sells hair products to small beauty salons near by: shampoo, conditioner, hair color, and others. Tourists love getting traditional hair styles, and there are also other women living in the same town who come to those beauty salons. Products that are put on their hair are the very products that Ines sells with such love and joy. Today the business has been growing; with the help of her group "Trabajando para el futuro," in time it could be fulfilling. Stories like hers are an example of what is done thanks to you lenders. Ines and her story are typical of the "Trabajando Para el Futuro" Bank of Hope; she belongs to a group of 20 men and women who work hard to improve their lives with the help of their small loans. Each of these men and women has taken out a similar loan to that of Ines's, and on behalf of all of them, and our team here at Esperanza, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of more beauty supplies

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny C., 45, is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Bouy Morn, is a construction worker. They live in Snam Preah Commune in the Pursat Province. Ny has five children: Three work as construction workers and two are studying. Ny grows rice in the rainy season every year and that crop is the main income in her family. To increase her rice yield, Ny would like to request a loan of US $400 to purchase fertilizer, pay for plowing her farmland, and to hire people to transplant rice seedlings.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use for her rice crop

loans.name: Thlang

texts.en:
Mrs. Thlang C. is married with five children and works as a housewife. Her husband, Uy So C., is the head of the family and works as a construction foremen, making about $3.00 each day for his household. One of her children works at a factory and can earn around $1.50 per day for his household. 

Given the amount of money her child makes at work and the money he spends on a motor taxi commuting to work, it is not profitable for him to work. Thus Mrs Thlang C. would like to request a loan from KIVA to purchase a motor-bike for him to reduce his expenses. She believes this will increase her family’s savings.

loans.use: To buy a motor bike to reduce the family's transportation expenses

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. Martha habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama 380, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera con un hija de 18 años de edad, que ingreso  ala universidad su mama se la cuida ya que devido a su trabajo no le permite, doña Martha se desempeña como cajera desde hace tres años en una empresa privada, también alquila un cuarto para tener otros ingresos,  pues su deseo es obtener otro cargo que genere mejores ingresos para poder seguir ayudando a sus hija con los estudios ya que desea que su hija tenga un mejor nivel de vida. Con la solicitud de prestemos va a construir un porche en su casa para tener mas comodidad con su familia. Alargo  plazo es hacer mejoras a los cuarto que alquila para dar brindar mejor servicio a sus cliente.
texts.en:
Martha lives in a neighborhood in the capital that is called 380. She is 36 years old, and is a single mother with one 18-year-old daughter who has entered university. Her mother cares for her as per work permits. Martha has worked as a cashier for the past three years with a private business. She also rents a room in order to have another income. Her current desire is to obtain another activity that makes a better income in order to be able to continue helping her daughter with her studies, as she wants her daughter to have a better level of life. With this loan that she is asking for she would build a porch on her home in order to have better comfort for her family. In the long term, her plan is to improve the room that she rents in order to give better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
Maria Juana G. hace tiempo había tenido su tienda de abarrotes pero comenta que se le fue abajo por dar muchos créditos a clientes y fue notando que su mercancía fuera agotándose y sin darse cuenta ya no tenia bien surtido. Por el momento ella esta vendiendo chicharrones y refrescos lo cual le esta favoreciendo y vendiendo muy bien por lo que quiere volver a surtirse de todo.
La cantidad que ella nos solicita es la cantidad  de $10,000 pesos.
texts.en:
Maria Juana G. used to own a grocery store, but it failed due to the excessive amount of credit given to customers, and the fact that she didn't replenish her diminishing inventory. Currently she is selling pork rinds and soft drinks very successfully; this has given her the encouragement to buy merchandise and restock her store once again. She is requesting $800.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda Amasifuen Huaraqui is a thirty-nine year old mother of four. She lives in Pucallpa, a major city in the eastern jungle region of Peru. Belinda is a member of the "Damas del Oriente" or "Ladies of the Orient" communal bank, which was named for the Villa Oriente neighborhood where the bank members congregate monthly.

Belinda is requesting a loan of 1,700 Nuevo Soles to support her broomstick sales business. She will use the loan to purchase her wares in bulk. She buys packages of 100 broomsticks at a time. 

She is pictured above with the materials she works with and her finished product. Belinda thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena S. manages a dry goods (clothing) business.  Her clothing business is located in the public market of Baligatan Ilagan, Isabela.  She is  44 years old and married to Gerardo who works in a financing corporation. They are blessed with two children Germalyn – 13 years old and in second year high school and Angelo - 7 years old who is now in the elementary grades.  According to Elena, their living conditions are quite good and happy.  

Business expansion is her reason for asking a loan of $300. Her hardships and sacrifices are for the future education of her children.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Delia María

texts.es:
Con dos hijos en edad escolar que mantener y con la obligación de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación la señora Dalia P. se dedica a laborar arduamente para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus pequeños y lo hace por medio de la mejora de su vivienda ya que esta lo requiere por ser una vivienda maltratada por los fenómenos naturales y corre el riesgo de dañarse mas aún.

Es por este motive que ha decidido mejorar su vivienda y para ello ha buscado el crédito en Ceprodel para obtener el dinero para la compra de materiales de construcción. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto ella como sus hijos por lo que requiere obtenerlo de inmediato y así llevar a cabo su mejora en la ciudad de Masaya.
texts.en:
With two school-aged children to support and the obligation to provide for her home, Mrs. Dalia P. works hard to improve the living conditions of her children and she does this through improving her home. Her home is suffering from weather damage and is in danger of being further damaged. Therefore she has decided to make home repairs and she is seeking a loan from Ceprodel for the money to buy construction materials. With this loan she and her children will benefit, and she needs it immediately so she can make her improvements to her home in Masaya city.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy constructional materials

loans.name: Ni Wayan Wiarni

texts.id: Walaupun diusia senja,namun Ibu Wayan Wiarni harus terus berusaha karena suaminya Bapak Ketut Luwer, mengalami struk sejak satu tahun yang lalu. Wiarni memelihara banyak babi dibelakang rumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp.2.000.000 Wiarni membeli 2 ekor induk babi ,setelah dipelihara selama 6 bulan,induk babi mempunyai anak sebanyak 6 ekor,karena tidak laku dijual akhirnya Wiarni memelihara anak babinya untuk penggemukan. Wiarni memberi makan babinya dua kali sehari pada pagi dan sore hari,selain dedak dan poral Wiarni juga memberikan daun-daunan seperti daun pisang,daun talas,batang pisang dan juga ampas tahu. Harapannya pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Wiarni akan menambah 1 induk babi lagi dan juga bibit untuk penggemukan dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup permanen dan anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal bersama suaminya.
texts.en:
Even though in her twilight years, nevertheless madam Wayan Wiarni must carry on a business as her husband, mister Ketut Luwer, had a stroke just a year ago. Wiarni rear many pigs behind her home. With earlier funding of Rp.2.000.000 Wiarni purchased 2 breeder pigs, and after rearing as long as 6 months, the breeder bore 6 piglets, as there was low demand, instead of selling them, eventually Wiarni raise the piglets to be fully grown pigs. Wiarni gives feeds to the pigs twice a day in the morning and evening, besides a mixture of rice and bran, she also gives leaves like banana leaves, taro leaves, banana stems, and also soybean pulp. Hopefully, with this loan from Dinari, Wiarni can add another breeder pig and also piglets for rearing and the balance to pay for supplies. Her home is built on owned land with materials that are sufficiently permanent and her daughter is married and living with her husband.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a saw and piglets

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana trabaja en el área rural D. La Paz es pequeña agricultora y productora D. leche D. vaca y comercializa queso D. vaca el esposo trabaja D. albañil, es su principal fuente D. ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención D. sus tres pequeños hijos.

Viven en la comunidad Caluyo - Batallas D. la provincia los Andes a dos horas y media D. la ciudad D. El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinara para la compra D. una vaca lechera D. mediana calidad y mejorar su producción D. leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento D. pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Emiliana works in the rural area of La Paz as a small farmer and producer of cow's milk and sells cheese. Her husband works as a bricklayer and is the main source of income which covers the maintenance of their three small children. They live in the community of Caluyo - Batallas in the province of Los Andes, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. The loan is intended for the purchase of a dairy cow of medium quality to increase milk production and improve her income. This is her third loan with Impro. The good payment performance demonstrated with Impro permits her to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment Capital

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy V. is a resident of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Mindanao, Philippines. He runs a grocery store where he sells canned goods, dairy products, soft drinks, bottled water and a variety of candies and biscuits (cookies).

Sammy is planning to increase his income to support the educational and other needs of his children. He needs additional capital of PHP 11,000 to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Sammy thanks everyone for bringing him an opportunity to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana Maria es pequeña agricultora y productora de leche de vaca con la que elabora quesos por cantidad para la comercialización en las ferias populares de la ciudad de La Paz, el esposo trabaja de obrero en la empresa de Ladrillos en Viachas; estas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con lo que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos de 1, 3 y 6 años de edad; viven en la casa alquilada ubicado en la Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja (a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto). 

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad que  ayudará para el incremento de la producción de los quesos.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarlo otro préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is a small farmer and producer of cows' milk from which she makes cheese in quantity for the commerce of the popular fairs of the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a laborer in the brick business in Viachas. These activities are their main sources of income with which they cover the maintenance of their three children, one, three, and six years old. They live in a rented house in the province of Ingavi - Achica Baja, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. The loan is intended to buy a milk cow of medium quality that will help them increase the production of cheeses. This is the fourth loan with Impro. Their good repayment performance permits the approval of this other requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow to increase the production of cheese.

loans.name: Franie

texts.en:
Franie is 25 years old, married and employed at JL Marketing as a repair man. He is also in the hog raising business to generate additional income. Since, he was 18 years old, Franie has worked to help his family until he married Danica (21). They have two children Ashnor Dan and Aziekeil who are his inspiration to work hard for their future. His family resides in Bintacan, Ilagan, Isabela.

Franie is planning to purchase piglets to raise to develop his business. He knows that it could help his family with their daily financial needs. He hopes that he could avail a loan of PHP4,000 to purchase at least two piglets. Franie is a very responsible man. According to him, he can manage his piggery business before and after his other work.

loans.use: Purchase two piglets.

loans.name: Nilda Flor

texts.es:
NILDA FLOR Z. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS” en el distrito de Callería, tiene 31 años, 1 hijo, y su esposo trabaja en una constructora.

Tenía un negocio de venta de ropa y la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 3 años, con él, compró algunas prendas de vestir. Ahora ella continua trabajando pero en el rubro de ventas de productos de belleza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1700.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza y también en ropa para damas y caballeros que luego los mostrara en el pequeño local que tiene en su casa.

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante,  gracias a ello puede ayudar a su esposo e hijo y en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Nilda Flor Z. G. belongs to the "Mujeres Solidarias" communal bank and lives in the district of Callería. She is 31 years old and has one son. Her husband works for a construction company. She had a business selling clothing and the first time that she obtained a loan of 300 Nuevos Soles, 3 years ago, she used it to purchase clothing garments. She continues to work but now sells beauty products. With this loan of 1,700 Nuevos Soles she will invest in the purchase of beauty products, as well as men and women's clothing to display in the small store she has in her house. For the short time that she has been with the Manuela Ramos organization she feels happy with the help that it gives to women to help them get ahead; thanks to it she can help support her husband and son with the household necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products (cosmetics) as well as men and women's clothing

loans.name: Hameed

texts.en:
Hameed is 41 years old and married with four children. He lives in Nablus city, Palestine.

Hameed sells building materials. He will use his loan to buy additional building supplies and other items necessary for the building process, which he will then resell. Hameed is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 50 años, es una madre muy alegre y cariñosa, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su hija Jennifer de 8 años, a quien desea dar una mejor vida y unos buenos estudios. Para Gloria la odontología es una vocación que le viene de familia, puesto que su padre también lo fue y ella decidió seguir sus pasos. Su consultorio está ubicado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Juliaca, motivo por el cual es muy concurrido y conocido, además sus clientes la prefieren a ella, por la paciencia que tiene para atenderlos. Gloria disfruta mucho de ayudar a la gente, ya que siente que gracias a ella sus clientes tienen una mejor salud dental. Lleva 10 años en este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tratar a los niños que acuden a su consultorio, puesto que son muy nerviosos y a veces se ponen muy tensos, lo que impide que realice una buena curación. Para el futuro espera que su consultorio crezca y se convierta en el más conocido de la ciudad, sabe que para eso tiene que trabajar mucho y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Este es el tercer préstamo de Gloria con MFP, se siente muy feliz de la oportunidad brindada, ya que así podrá mejorar su consultorio. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, ya que siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los mil seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más materiales odontológicos para atender mejor a sus pacientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old, and is a very happy and loving mother. She lives in a rented room together with her daughter Jennifer, who is 8 years old. She wants to give her daughter a better life and a good education. Dentistry is a calling for Gloria that comes from her family. Since her father also was a dentist, she decided to follow his path. Her office is located in a central zone of the city of Juliaca, and for this reason it is very busy and well known. Also, her customers prefer her for the patience with which she serves them. Gloria really enjoys helping people, since thanks to her, her customers have better dental health.

She has been in this work for 10 years, and she considers the most difficult part treating the children who come to her office, since they are very nervous, and sometimes very tense, which can stop her from doing a good treatment. For the future, she hopes that her office grows, and turns into the most well known in the city. She knows that for this she has to work a lot and is ready to do it. This is Gloria´s third loan with MFP, she is very happy for the opportunity offered, since she can improve her office. In her community bank, she is a very respected member, since she always brings order to the meetings. With the 1600 new soles requested, she will buy more dental materials to better serve her patients.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dental materials

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 20 años, vive con sus padres en la casa de un familiar. Desde hace un año tiene un locutorio (centro de llamadas telefónicas), el cual instaló en su misma casa, invirtiendo de los ahorros que había reunido con mucho esfuerzo.  De esta manera, inició su propio negocio, el cual administra y atiende todos los días. En este tiempo ha visto resultados positivos en la preferencia de los clientes por su establecimiento, debido a que está ubicado en una de las calles principales de su ciudad, esta significativa ventaja es la que la anima a aspirar mejoras para su negocio en el futuro; siendo una de ellas, la modernización de sus equipos telefónicos y la venta de repuestos y accesorios para celulares. Esta es la segunda vez que Pilar tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy satisfecha de formar parte de un banco comunal que ha superado muchas dificultades, por lo que renueva su compromiso de seguir participando activamente. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas prepago y la reparación de alguno de sus equipos.
texts.en:
Pilar is 20 years old and lives with her parents in the family home. One year ago, she used her hard-earned savings to start a locutorio (call center) out of her house. She manages and attends to her business every day. Pilar is seeing positive results at the moment because her customers prefer her business because of its location on one of the main streets of the city. She hopes to capitalize on this advantage so that she can make improvements to her business. Some of the things that she wants to accomplish in the future are to modernize her phone equipment and begin selling mobile phone parts and accessories.

This is the second time Pilar has taken a loan from MFP. She is very pleased to be part of a communal bank that has overcome many difficulties. This has renewed her commitment to stay actively involved. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase prepaid phone cards and repair her existing equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase prepaid phone cards & make equipment repairs

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en:
Dorjsuren U. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Two of his children are university students in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and the youngest daughter is 8 years old and goes to a local secondary school. Dorjsuren has an old Russian truck called a ZIL-130. He uses his truck for carrying freight in between different cities. He usually carries firewood and coal between his city and Ulaanbaatar. His wife is a big supporter of his business and helps in his business when she has time. Dorjsuren says that the main source of family income is the trucking business. He pays school tuitions for his two children with the business profits. He works hard to make sure that his children receive higher education without any financial strains. 

He requests a loan to repair his old truck and purchase necessary accessories for his truck.

loans.use: To repair his truck and purchase necessary accessories for his truck

loans.name: Mwandeti Group

texts.en:
Nanyori is a member of the Mwandeti borrower group in Ngaramtoni, Arusha. She is 35 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 22,18,15,10 years  old.She also cares for  other 4 dependents.

Nanyori has owned a maize business  for 15 years. She works 16 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Nanyori first`s loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Nanyori hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Ngoonamelo is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the loan amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to expand  her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for sale

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en: Adriana B. sells smoked fish at Elmina Kumasi.  Adriana has received senior high school education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Adriana has been selling smoked fish since 1999. She helps husband in the paying of utility bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke by way of processing and sold at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her children to further their education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke by way of processing and sold at the market.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 63 años y es madre D. cuatro hijos, todos mayores D. edad, se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa D. segunda mano, ella venD. esta mercadería en diferentes caceríos  D. alejados D. la ciudad, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, quien es albañil. Es socia del Banco Comunal  “Mujeres Solidarias” desD. hace ocho años, donD. se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad y forma D. ser. El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles lo cual compro ropa D. segunda para vender, ahora ella necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles, el cual será utilizado una parte para comprar ropa D. segunda mano y otra parte comprará pescado seco para vender en los distintos mercados. La meta D. Rosita es seguir trabajando y apoyar a su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a fighter and a hard-working woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 63, and she has four grown children. She sells second hand clothing in different villages faraway from the city. She counts on help from her husband, a bricklayer. She has been a member of the Mujeres Solidarias Communal Bank for eight years. In the bank she is characterized by her punctuality and her personality. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy second hand clothes to sell. She now needs a loan for 1,500 PEN. She will use part of it to buy second hand clothes, and she will use the other part to buy dried fish to sell in different markets. Rosita’s goal is to keep working and supporting her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy second hand clothing and dried fish to sell in different markets

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en: M. Fotima’s passion lies in her children. A married mother of three, Fotima started her business selling the national Tajik footwear called “galosh” with the goal of providing a better standard of living for her family. For the past seven years, Fotima has successfully operated her business at the market. With her profits, she not only has improved the living standards for her children but she has been able to support her elderly parents as well. Fotima has requested a loan of $1,000 to restock her inventory. An optimistic businesswoman, Fotima plans to use the loan to continue developing her business and supporting her family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: Nancy Madelaine

texts.es:
Nancy es una madre soltera que tiene 43 años de edad y que vive junto a sus padres y su hijo de 23 años de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace mas de 23 años tiene una bodega que funciona en casa de sus padres. Ella nos cuenta que empezó su negocio vendiendo bebidas gaseosas y que poco a poco lo fue ampliando. Actualmente vende abarrotes, articulos de oficina y artículos de regalo los que ofrece a los vecinos de la zona en donde vive.

Eventualmente es contratada como digitalizadora de documentos en algunas instituciones de la zona que necesitan personal de apoyo. En la fotografía ella aparece en la Comisaría de Protección de Carreteras de la zona donde en ocasiones brinda sus servicios.

Sus padres son de edad avanzada, por lo que ella da todo de si para sustentarlos, su negocio es la unica fuente estable de ingreso con la que cuentan. Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la venta de panetones por lo que está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Nancy ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio para brindarle estudios superiores a su hijo y seguir brindándole a sus padres la calidad de vida que ellos se merecen.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 43 year old single mother. She lives with her parents and her 23 year old son in the District of Paiján, Ascope Province, La Libertad region, which is 3 hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 23 years, Nancy has operated a grocery store out of her parents’ home. She tells us that she started selling soft drinks, but she expanded gradually over time. Now she sell groceries, office supplies, and gift items to her neighbors in the area where she lives.

Eventually she secured contract work as a document digitizer for various institutions in the area that need support staff. In the photograph, Nancy is standing in front of the local office of the Highway Safety Commission where she occasionally provides her services.

Her parents are advanced in age, so she does everything she can to support them. Her business is the only source of stable income on which they can rely. Nancy hopes to increase her business by selling panettones. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Nancy has worked with us previously. She has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments. Nancy dreams of expanding her business so that she can pay for her son’s college studies and continue providing her parents with the quality of life they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase "panettones" for the Christmas season

loans.name: Lcy

texts.en:
Lcy is very hardworking and she makes sure she has food on the table everyday through her hard work. She is 48 years old and is married with eight children. She lives in Warri, Delta State.

Lcy sells household items in front of her house and has been in this business for years. She has the mind to expand her business and business capital but the challenge she is facing is funding. She is requesting the loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more household items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more household items to sell

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem S., 40, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in selling fish at a local market in the town, earning an income of US $7 per day. Her husband helps his wife in the business, and he is also employed as a construction builder, earning an income of US $4 per day. These sources of income help S. and her husband cover the family's expenses. S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase rice from the local farmers in her province for resale.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia D. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Delia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling ice candy (popsicles) in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Delia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials for making ice candy. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Delia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials for making ice candy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es: Napoleón tiene 44 años de edad, por lo que él se dedica a ofrecer sus servicios musicales. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio, el un hombre muy trabajador. Con los ingresos que obtiene los utiliza para sus 2 hijos que son lo más importantes para él, por lo que él está muy interesado en proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y en la manutención de su hogar, el disfruta de su trabajo pues desde muy niño le gusto tocar piano, y fue más tarde que decide ofrecer sus servicios en diferentes lugares. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para realizar la compra de accesorios musicales. Su deseo es lograr que su grupo toque a nivel internacional y sean muy reconocidos.
texts.en:
Napoleón is 44 years old and offers musical services. For 10 years he has been dedicated to this humbling business and is a hard working man. He uses the income he earns for his 2 children who are most important to him. For this he is very interested in giving them an education and maintaining his house. He enjoys his job. Since he was a young child he liked playing the piano and it was later that he decided to offer his services in different places. It is for this that he is soliciting a loan to buy music accesories. His wish is that his group with play at an international level and be well recognized.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Kenia

texts.es: La Sra.  Kenia R. C. es comerciante tiene venta de ropa nueva y cosméticos ambulante vende en una comarca  se llama San Cristóbal y San José de la Montaña, el crédito lo solicita para capital de trabajo compra de ropa nueva y cosméticos, ya es el decimo crédito con nosotros  excelente cliente. Y si le han ayudado mucho los crédito que ha tenido ya que ha incrementado su clientela y a podido construir su casa, es casada tiene 2 hijos todos en edad escolar
texts.en:
Sra. Kenia R. C. is a traveling merchant who sells new clothing and cosmetics in the regions of San Cristóbal and San José de la Montaña. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy new clothing and cosmetics. This will be her tenth loan and she has demonstrated that she is an excellent client. Her loans have helped her greatly with increasing her customer base and building her house. Kenia is married and has two children who are in school.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita M. is from the village of  Manolo Fortich , Bukidnon. She is 67 years old. Enriquita is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Enriquita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Enriquita has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Enriquita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enriquita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Enriquita is requesting a new loan of 26,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Enriquita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Safarboy

texts.en:
Safarboy is an entrepreneurial man who lives with his wife and three children who all help him in the business of the production and sale of traditional bread, called “lepeshka”. He began his business in order to help with the household expenses, while also covering the costs of education for his children and their basic upkeep.

Safarboy began his business 4 years ago by selling from both his house and the market, and he already has an almost fixed clientele. At the same time, he provides taxi services during his free time. Safarboy is asking for a loan of $1500 to buy flour, coal for baking lepeshka, and spare parts to repair his car. Safarboy and his family thank you very much for the help which you give him in being able to follow through in creating his business and being able to continue with it in the future.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasing flour to bake the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Elizabeth P. K. from Mbarali. She is married with six children between the ages of 12 and 20 years. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Elizabeth has been running a cloth selling business since 2009. Her business is purchasing clothes wholesale and selling them retail. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by her husband. 
Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 600,000 Tsh in order to purchase more clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity of her clothes. Elizabeth thanks you for your support!


About SELFINA: 
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Esperanza Nueva 1,3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group L. Nueva Esperanza 1,3(The New Hope). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seibo, an area where agriculture dominates the economy and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and and their three children.

Maria is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan, which helped to expand her business. She plans to use this new loan to invest in her business running a fruit stand. She will use the funds to purchase apples, lemons, melons, mandarins, grapefruits and mangoes. She will use the profits to invest in constructing her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase apples, lemons, melons, mandarins, grapefruits and mangoes.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 25 years old, married with two children, the first-born is 5 years old and the younger is 3 years old. Judith owns a small shop selling clothing. Judith’s business is well-known in her region. This is her 7th year of successful operation in her business. The hours of her shop are from 8 AM to 4 PM every day except Saturday. 

Judith is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase bales of clothing which will allow her to satisfy more customers. Judith needs this loan because her monthly profit was too low to sort out her business problems. With this loan Judith hopes to increase her profits and save money for the future.

loans.use: Different styles of clothing for sale

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh V. P. was born in 1981 and lives in Dong Anh town with his wife and their two children who are still young. He is a bricklayer and his wife earns an income as a worker in a factory. His family has a monthly income of about 4,500,000 Vietnamese dongs (VND).

Minh V. P. has a participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. Now, he wants to have more tools for his business. So, for this loan, he needs 8,066,000 VND to buy the tools.

loans.use: To buy tools for his business

loans.name: Bouya

texts.fr: Bouya S. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis 2008 et a 05 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est transformatrice et vendeuse de pate d’arachide. Après avoir produit la marchandise elle va dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité pour la commercialiser. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va augmenter sa production et se procurer plus de bénéfices qui lui permettront de contribuer à la prise en charge de la famille, la nourriture et la santé par exemple.
texts.en:
Bouya S. is a 40-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SINTHIANG COUNDARA since 2008 and has benefited from five consecutive loans without ever a problem repaying. Bouya is a maker and seller of peanut butter. After making this product, she goes to the weekly markets in her town to market it. With her new loan, she is going to increase her production and acquire more profit. This will enable her to help support the family in terms of food and health care, as examples.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her investment capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline J. is from the village of Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Caroline owns and operates a business providing multicab (small passenger van) services to local community members with her husband as the driver. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Caroline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

location.town: Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis O

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is from the village of Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 57 years old. Anita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly f farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Dembagnouma  Iii Group

texts.fr:
