Les dix membres du groupe Dembagnouma III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et  en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Wobougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées par le groupe sont le riz, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SATA F., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environ 1,9 hectare d’arachide.
La production  est vendue au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 80.000FCFA  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The Dembagnouma III group is composed of 10 married women with an average age of 33, an average of 2 children, and they live in polygamous families in Wobougou, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their rainy season activities. They grow rice, pearl millet, peanuts, and beans. They are on their second seasonal loan and their previous loan was repaid in full. With this new loan, Sata F., the president of the group, plans on buying fertilizer and small farming equipment, and paying the labor costs involved in maintaining approximately 1.9 hectares of peanuts. The harvested crops are sold in Dioïla to a client base made up of merchants. She hopes to make a profit of 80,000 francs CFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon Y. is a rattan cupboard maker. She is 47 and a married mother blessed with three children. One of them is single and the other two are already married. She has another financial earner in her husband, who fishes in and around the river. 

In addition to their current jobs, the couple has grown a rice crop to get extra income. Chhuon Y. will put this  loan towards planting a rice crop during the approaching farming season.

loans.use: To use towards planting a rice crop

loans.name: Kenanga Indah Group

texts.en: Ni Komang A. S. is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of this sixteen-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Kenanga Indah (PK-10302). Ni Komang is married and has one school-aged child. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month. In 2010, Ni Komang joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her first from MUK. Ni Komang plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** Ni Komang A. S. (0) merupakan 35 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Komang adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 16 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Kenanga Indah (PK-10302). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dA. beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Komang sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dA. 5 tahun. DA. kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Komang menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Ni Komang bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Komang meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dA. MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dA. MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehA.-hA..

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is 35 years old. She has three children, ages 2, 4 and 6. Her husband has a shop in which he sells different items such as sugar, beans, etc.
 
Marie Grace has a hair salon and she is requesting a loan to buy more hair products that are used in a salon. She also plans to buy more products from the profit she hopes to make and her dream is to have a very big salon in order to make more profits.

loans.use: Buying salon products

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She married when she was an adolescent and is now the mother of three children. In 2008, she started running her own business as a hairdresser, receiving clients in her home. She has worked in this type of business from the past seven years. Her income is important in helping with her household expenses and paying her children’s school fees. Her story exemplifies the day-to-day challenges Lebanese women face in running a business and, at the same time, raising children and taking care of their homes.
Today, this borrower is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new hairdressing tools and to prepare a corner in which to present perfumes to her clients. In the future, she hopes to open a formal beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase new hairdressing tools and prepare a corner to present perfumes to her clients

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar R. G. está casado hace mas de 10 años y tiene 3 hijos. El cliente nació en Argentina pero hace ya muchos años saco su nacionalidad Boliviana y vive actualmente en la ciudad de Cochabamba.
  
Julio Cesar se dedica a la distribución de botellones de agua hace más de 3 años. Trabaja para la empresa Agua y Sol ubicada en la zona sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba a solo unas cuadras de su casa en la zona conocida como Coña Coña - km 6 a la Av. Blanco Galindo. Julio desea poder comenzar un negocio pequeño vendiendo botellones de agua tal como lo hace en su trabajo de esta manera poder incrementar sus ingresos y poder darle a su familia un mejor futuro.

Julio nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder ver a sus hijos crecer en un ambiente bueno y que logren terminar sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar R. G. has been married for over ten years and has three children. He was born in Argentina but many years ago, he obtained Bolivian citizenship and he now lives in the city of Cochabamba.

Julio Cesar has worked distributing jugs of water for more than three years. He works for the company Agua y Sol, located in the southern area of the city of Cochabamba a few blocks from his house in the area known as Coña Coña – kilometer 6 of the Av. Blanco Galindo. Julio wants to be able to begin a small business selling jugs of water, just as he does at his job, so that he can increase his income and be able to provide his family with a better future.

Julio tells us that his biggest dream is to be able to see his children grow up in a good environment and for them to finish school and be good professionals.

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: German Diego

texts.es: El Señor German vive en casa en alquiler con su esposa y sus hijitos, el es transportista pero también ayuda en la actividad de la esposa que es la elaboración de empanadas, terminando de preparar las empanadas el se va y trabaja en el transporte ya que no les alcanza con la elaboración de las empanadas y su esposa va a vender las empanadas por el mercado de la zona. El señor saco el crédito para la compra de harina y otros por mayor ya que en las fechas de todos santos venden mucho, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Señor German lives in rented accommodation with his wife and children. He is a driver for a haulage contractor, but he also helps his wife make empanadas (stuffed pastries). Once he’s finished helping her, he leaves for his other work as making pastries alone doesn’t provide them with enough income. His wife sells them in a nearby market.

German is seeking a loan to buy flour and other ingredients at wholesale prices since at holiday times they sell a lot of empanadas. He is very grateful to the institution for the help they offer him in obtaining a loan.

loans.use: to buy flour and other ingredients at wholesale prives

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 47 years old and is married with two children who are 13 and 21 years old. Her husband is a teacher. Christine sells bread and tea in the Kabuga district of Rwanda. Christine has been running her restaurant for one year and she employs two people. Christine's restaurant is known in the area and well-organized.

Christine has requested this loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business and purchase more bread and tea. With her increased stock she will be able to attract more customers and earn more profit. She hopes she will be able to build her own house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more bread and tea for sale in shop

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.  Catherine has a business selling green bananas.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. 

Catherine sells her products at the market by means of retail. Catherine has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of green bananas. 

The main business challenges for Catherine include transportation, thieves, and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and to own a delivery van.  

Catherine lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but no access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy green bananas to sell

loans.name: Carmen Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Carmen, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 9 y 3 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
El crédito lo realiza para el negocio del esposo el cual es un vendedor ambulante, vende artículos para el hogar (planchas, ventiladores, licuadoras, tostadoras, ollas, platos, entre otros artículos). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 8pm. Dice que es cansado pero que tiene que hacerlo para ganarse el sustento diario. La mercadería la compra en Portoviejo donde le dan precio para comerciante.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para que su esposo compre planchas, ollas, licuadoras, entre otros artículos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace seis ciclos y está muy agradecida ya que así ella puede ayudar a su esposo a través de los créditos otorgados por la institución. Su sueño es tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
The 22 De Julio communal bank meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for being a highly commercial zone, for its traditional celebrations of Saint Pedro and Saint Pablo, and for the joyfulness of its people.

This is where we find Ms. Carmen, who is 33 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage, through which she has had three children, ages 11, 9, and 3 years old, all of whom are in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is taking out this loan to support her husband's business.  He is an itinerant vendor who sells home products (irons, fans, blenders, toasters, pans, plates, and other items).  He works every day from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m.  She says that he is very tired but has to do this in order to meet their daily needs.  He buys the merchandise in Portoviejo, where he is offered the price for merchants.

Carmen will use this loan so that her husband can buy irons, pans, blenders, and other items.  She has been in the communal bank for six cycles and is very grateful for the opportunity because she is able to help her husband through the loans offered by the institution.  Her dream is to have a commercial storefront.

loans.use: to buy irons, pans, blenders, toasters, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Amarilis

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora rosa. Tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 8 y 20 días de nacido, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en la Fabril en Manta. Ella tiene un titulo de profesora y esta por obtener el título de Licda. En Ciencias De La Educación.

Trabaja de maestra en una escuela por contrato, pero además se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta,  también vende en su lugar de trabajo a sus compañeras de la escuela, nos cuenta que  le realizan muchos pedidos sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes y los fines de semana todo el día, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la compra en  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite, lo que mas vende es blusas, y pantalones de damas.

Este crédito es para comprar la  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 4 años y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su trabajo y su vida personal.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Por Un Nuevo Amanecer ( For a New Dawn), meets every 15 days at el Canton Montecristi, known for its rich culture and craftsmanship which is recognized at a national and international level;  birthplace of the famous straw hats.

This is where we find Rosa she is 30 years old, married, and has two children from the marriage who are 8 and 20 years old; her oldest is in school.  Her husband works at La Fabril in Manta and she is a professor about to obtain a license in Science Education.

She is teaching at a school working on contract but she also sells all kinds of clothing.  She primarily sells door-to-door but also sells to her colleagues at work and she tells us that she gets a lot of orders from her clients.  She works everyday in the evenings and all day on the weekends.  She sells on credit to her clients and collects every 15 days.  Rosa purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil every 15 days or monthly depending on the need; she sells blouses the most along with pants for women.

This loan is to purchase the clothing but primarily women's clothing.  She has been a member of the communal bank 4 years and likes it because of the low interest rates.  Her dreams are to get ahead in her work and personal life.

loans.use: Buy women's clothing

loans.name: Odbaatar

texts.en:
Odbaatar is 40 years old and lives with his wife, daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a small house in the outer ger districts of the city. Both his children attend secondary school. Odbaatar supports his family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, with regular help from his wife. 

In 1995, when he first began his business, his working capital was 500,000 MNT and now his stall has 3 million MNT in working capital. In 2003, his family bought a small house and in 2009, he bought a used car with his business earnings. 

He wants to expand his business by buying his own clothing shop. With this loan, Odbaatar will purchase clothes for spring from Ereen City, China. He wants to use this loan to help support him in this very busy shopping season of the year.

Odbaatar also said, "It's my personal goal to support my children's education and to let them have a safe life in the future, so they can live happily."

loans.use: To purchase clothes for spring

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San S. was born in 1966 and she is a villager who lives in K'am Samnar Leu village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Khorn Ngit, are farmers who own a 2-hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice to sell. This income supports the family's living expenses. In order to support this farming, Mrs. San S. would like to ask for a loan to pay for hired laborers to plow her farm and to buy rice seeds for growing rice. Aside from being farmers, they are also farming laborers who are able to earn a little salary to support their family. 

This couple has two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To pay for hired laborers to plow her farm and to buy rice seeds for growing rice.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn L. is from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old. Lovelyn is single. To make a living, Lovelyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling rice per kilogram and corn & rice hay in the local community. Lovelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2010 PHP a month for these activities.

Lovelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lovelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like rice and corn hay. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lovelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like rice and corn hay

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday, who is currently in the business of selling sugar and onions, is 22 years old, married, and has one child who does not yet go to school. Sunday's  loan will be used to stock more sugar and onions to sell. She hopes to change her business system with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more sugar and  onions to  sell.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando D. P. runs a bakeshop. He bakes and sells a variety of goods like cinnamon bread, otap [puff pastry] and patatas [fried potatos] in his community. He is 30 years old, married and has two small children. They are from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. Armando has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Armando joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. Armando is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients like flour and eggs. This will be his second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients like flour and eggs.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es: Ida tiene 51 años, vive con uno de sus hijos en una casa que les pertenece a unos familiares lejanos y por el cual ella es la encargada de cuidar dicha casa. Tiene 20 años de experiencia en la agricultura y en todo este tiempo se ha dedicado a la siembra, asimismo recibe la ayuda de su hijo, quien la ayuda en la organización y en el contrato con los jornaleros que se encargaran en la siembra y cosecha, así como la compra o alquiler de  yunta y/o tractor, dependiendo  de las condiciones de su terreno. Una vez cosechada sus plantaciones los vende al por mayor en el mercado de su localidad y de esa manera obtiene bueno ingresos. Por otro lado, toma tiempo para cosechar así que se dedica a vender yogurt, que es comprado al por mayor en una fábrica de productos lácteos.  Actualmente esta concentrada en planificar su próxima cosecha. Es su crédito número 10 que tiene con MFP, se siente muy contenta de tener un espacio de amistad en su banco comunal además de ser personas responsables que  trabajan de manera armoniosa y en equipo de la cual se siente muy agradecida. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono, fertilizantes, asimismo desea comprar algunas ovejas.
texts.en:
Ida is 51 years old and lives with her children in a house that belongs to distant relatives but is under her care.  She has been in farming for 20 years and has always grown crops.  She also receives assistance from her son who helps organize and contract workers for the planting and harvest seasons, and arrange purchase or rental of a plough or tractor, depending on the land's condition.  After harvest she sells her produce wholesale at the local market and obtains a good income.

She also sells yoghourt that she buys wholesale at a dairy products factory.  She is currently focused on planning for the upcoming harvest.  This is her 10th loan through MFP and she is very happy to have a circle of friends at the communal bank where people are not only responsible individuals but also work well as a team, for which she is grateful.

She plans to use the loan to buy sacks of fertilizer and some sheep.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and sheep

loans.name: Genewyn

texts.en:
Genewyn C. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 28 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Genewyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, beverages, biscuits, shampoo, soap & detergent in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Genewyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk food & instant noodles. This will be Genewyn’s 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk food & instant noodles

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO D. YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Graciela; ella tiene 23 años D. edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. compra y venta D. chicha (bebida a base D. maíz), ella prepara y venD. en forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desD. las 10:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y jora para preparar la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela belongs to the Communal Bank “San Isidro D. Yanahura – 5to Paradero” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Graciela divides her time between her daily activities and her business of buying and selling “chicha” (a beverage maD. of corn). She prepares her product and sells it as a street vendor. Graciela works from 10am to 10pm. Through this business, she has been able to move her children forward. Graciela wants to expand and improve her business of selling “chicha”. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy corn for producing her product.

Graciela is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase corn for producing "chicha".

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo vía a la ciudad de  Manta encontramos la ciudadela  Metropolitana, lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Metropolitana.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Narcisa, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen diez hijos, nueve de ellos ya son mayores de edad y una chica de 17 años que estudia en colegio y es la  que es la que  aun vive con ella. Su esposo no trabaja por enfermedad.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo de tipo y de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa va a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita mercadería. Nos cuenta que tiene un hijo que vende CD en el centro de la ciudad y este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar una máquina para quemar Cd y así poder tener un ingreso extra con esta máquina. También va comprar ropa y productos Avon para su negocio, nos cuenta que lleva tres años dedicada al comercio y le va muy bien.

Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo, on the way to the city of Manta, is located the Metropolitana citadel, and this is where the members of the Banco Comunal Metropolitana meet every two weeks. 
Here we met Narcisa, who is 53 years old, married, and has 10 children from this marriage, 9 of whom are grown-up, and one girl of 17 who is at high school and is the only one who still lives at home. Her husband doesn't work due to an illness.
She is a house wife who, in order to earn her own living, sells clothes of all types and goods from Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works three days a week and she sells her goods door to door, giving her customers credit and collecting from them every week. Some of her goods are delivered to her home, but she goes to Guayaquil every time she needs to buy clothes to sell. She tells us that one of her sons sells CDs in the city center and she will use this loan to buy a machine for burning CDs so that he can make more profit. She will also buy clothes and Avon products. She tells us that she has been a merchant for 3 years and it suits her well.
This is the her third loan cycle with the community bank, and she likes it because the repayments are easy for her to make. 
Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy clothes, Avon products, and a machine for burning CDs.

loans.name: Seitkul's Group

texts.en:
Seitkul, the leader of this group, is 58 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised two daughters and two sons, all of whom are married, employed, and living separately with their families.

In order to earn money to meet their needs, the family breeds livestock. Seitkul sells milk and her husband takes care of the livestock, eventually reselling them at a higher price. In this way they earn 9300 soms per month. Seitkul has applied for the loan to increase their number of livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Feature Progress Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Feature Progress” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Yatta. Yatta is age 39. She was born in Pujehun town but she is currently residing in Kenama city, together with her husband and 4 children. Her husband is a trader and 2 of her children are attending primary school and 2 in secondary school. For 6 years now, Yatta has been selling sugar, beans, onions, biscuits, etc. With this loan, Yatta will buy sugar, beans, onions, biscuits, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of Aminata, a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, onions, biscuits, etc. at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: David Javier

texts.en: David lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras, where he operates a small food business. He prepares fresh food from 7 in the morning until 10 at night, and has run the business for several years. David is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 with which to buy ingredients for cooking. He is very grateful for the support he has received from Prisma and hopes to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sausages, chicken, corn meal, corn, tomatoes, lettuce, beans, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 53 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and the mother of three adult-aged dependents.

Juana has a food business. She sells banana fruits to the local community to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for ten years. Each month, she earns approximately 15,000 PHP (~$350) from this activity. 

She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase a volume of banana fruit to sell. Juana has been member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her fruit business and build her own fruit stand in the city.

loans.use: To purchase a volume of banana fruit to sell.

loans.name: Jeanine

texts.en:
Jeanine, a 32-year-old married mother of a 3-year-old, sells eggs, cassava flour, and bananas in her boutique. She has operated her well-organized business for two years, and works from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m. everyday.

Jeanine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more eggs, bananas, and Irish potatoes to sell. She will reinvest the additional profits in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs, cassava flour, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Marjelyn

texts.en:
Marjelyn is a 38-year-old married woman. She is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is taking good care of her five school-aged dependents. 

Her source of income comes from gardening. She started planting crops one year ago. In her first year of production, Marjelyn has made an approximate PHP 1,500 a month.

Earlier this year, she joined GDMPC. She has applied a loan of PHP 10,000 from the cooperative to pay for land preparation costs. The area should be free from weeds before planting so the plants can absorb enough nutrients from the soil. Marjelyn hopes to grow more crops such as string beans, squash, tomatoes, etc.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation costs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: La señora Ruth, es madre soltera, tiene una hija, por quien trabaja duro ya quien le quiere brindar un futuro mejor,  vive en San José en el municipio la guardia,  a 25 km. De la ciudad de Santa Cruz. Vive en la casa de su madre la Sra. Clementina quien cuida a su nieta, mientras su hija a vender sus productos, su actividad económica es la venta de pollo y queso en el mercado central desde hace un año. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería (compra de carne de pollo,  embutidos y quesos) es cliente nueva y agradece por la confianza que depositan en ella.
texts.en: Señora Ruth is a single mother. She has a daughter, for whom she works hard and to whom she wants to offer a better future. She lives in San José, in the town of La Guardia, 25 km from the city of Santa Cruz. She lives in the house of her mother, Sra. Clementina, who cares for her granddaughter while her daughter sells her products. Ruth's business is the sale of chicken and cheese in the central market. She has had this business for a year. The purpose of the loan is the purchase of merchandise (chicken meat, sausages, and cheese). She is a new loan client and is grateful for the confidence that is shown in her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (chicken, sausagaes, and cheeses)

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 35 años, es separada de su esposo, pero tiene un hijo con quien vive en su casa propia, ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Bertha es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica en la venta de bebidas y comidas típicas de esta parte de la región, y con este trabajo trata de salir adelante. Bertha cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes que gracias a ello tiene un buen ingreso económico que le satisface algunas necesidades primordiales.En un futuro próximo desea ampliar su restaurante y construir una piscina y algunos juegos recreativos, para que sea más atractivo su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo ella se compromete en efectivizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de productos para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Bertha is 35 years old.  She is separated from her husband and has one son who lives with her.  She lives in her own home which is located in Pichari district.

Bertha is a hard-working woman who sells drinks and meals which are typical of this part of the region.  Through her work, she tries to get ahead in life.  Bertha has a good customer portfolio which means that she makes good income which covers some of her basic needs.  In the near future, she would like to expand her restaurant and build a swimming pool and some recreational games to make her business more attractive.

This is Bertha's first loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will invest her 1,500 soles to buy products for preparing her meals.

loans.use: to buy products for preparing meals

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 29 years old and a married lady. She runs a beauty salon in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last five years. 

This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the loan to add more stock of "hair food", relaxer, shampoo and buy a dryer. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to add more stock of "hair food", relaxer, shampoo and buy a dryer.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 30 years old and lives in the airport community. She is married and her husband works at Firestone. They have six children between 4 and 18 years old. 

For the past eight years she been selling oil, rice, pepper, and onion in the local market, having learned it from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and onion for her business. Her plan is to build a house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and onion for her business

loans.name: Maryam's Group

texts.en:
A talented lady, Maryam operates an animal sales business. She has been operating her business for the past 10 years. Her father was also involved in this business and she got knowledge about animals from him. She buys animals from the animal market and sells to the required customers for a good profit. Her husband is involved in an agriculture profession. He is a farmer who grows different seasonal crops and sells for a good profit. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business. With the loan, she will buy animals like goats & sheep to sell. She is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her business.

loans.use: To buy animals to resell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel de 62 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace varios años, cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en general. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y no tiene otra competencia cerca de su negocio.  Con esta actividad él solventa sus gastos económicos y ayuda  su familia.

Daniel observa que va creciendo favorablemente su negocio, desea seguir ampliándolo con la compra de más mercadería como productos comestibles y abarrotes en general.  Al comprar sus productos en grandes cantidades le ayuda en bajar el precio que paga a su proveedor. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles. Daniel es muy trabajador y dedicado frente a su negocio. Desea lograr mayores ingresos para brindarle mejores opciones en la vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel, 62, lives with his wife and son in his own house that has all basic utilities and is located in an urban part of Cayaltí District which belongs to Chiclayo Province.  This zone is noted for farming and animal husbandry.

He’s had a home-based grocery store for several years.  He stocks various daily consumption staples and groceries in general to sell to his neighbors and customers from the zone.  He has an established clientele and no other nearby competition.  He is able to cover expenses and help his family with this activity.

Daniel has been noticing favorable growth in his business so he wants to continue to expand it buying more merchandise like foodstuffs and groceries in general.  Buying products in large amounts will help him lower the price for the consumer.  Because of this, he’s felt it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new sol loan.  Daniel is very hardworking and dedicated to his business.  He wants to attain higher income to provide the best life options for his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, de 40 años, es un mujer muy emprendedora. Viven en compañía de su pareja y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos a los que quiere mucho. Tiene una casa propia la cual adquirió con el apoyo de su pareja.
La actividad a la que se dedica Nilda es la crianza de ganado vacuno, para ello cuenta con un terreno propio para las 30 vacas que posee, Se siente orgullosa con el trabajo que realiza, ya tiene 5 años continuos y hasta el momento su pareja es quien más la apoyado. Lo que le gusta de su actividad, es el poder tener un ingreso económico con el que pueda cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y así sacar adelante a sus hijos. Sin emnbargo ha tendio inconvenientes con algunos robos de sus vacas, por lo que ahora debe asegurar más su establo. Este sería el crédito número cuatro con MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo que viene recibiendo y considera a su grupo comunal como personas responsables y puntuales en sus pagos. Con el préstamo recibido, comprará más alambre y así mejorar el cerco de su terreno para evitar que le roben otra vaca más.
texts.en:
40-year-old Nilda is a very entrepreneurial woman who lives together with her partner.  The couple have two children who they love very much.  Nilda owns her own home which she acquired with the support of her partner.

Nilda's business is raising cattle and she owns a plot of land where she keeps the thirty cows that she has.  She feels proud of the work that she does.  She has been in this business for five years and, up to now, her partner has been the person who has supported her the most.  What Nilda enjoys about her business is having an income which she can use to cover her household needs and provide for her children.  However, her business has also had problems as she has suffered some thefts of her cows.  For this reason, she must now provide her stable with more security.

This will be Nilda's fourth loan from MFP.  She feels happy with the support that she is receiving and she considers the members of her community bank to be responsible people who are punctual in making their loan repayments.  She will use her loan to buy more wire so that she can improve the fence around her land in order to prevent anybody from stealing another of her cows.

loans.use: to buy wire to fence round her stable

loans.name: Wilma Antonieta

texts.es: La señora Wilma tiene su tienda de barrio, donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad,  es casada su esposo es albañil vive en la casa de sus suegros  en Villa Copacabana su tienda esta en plena esquina en un lugar estratégico, le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes,  el préstamo lo utilizara ya que le ofrecieron abarrotes en cantidad y quiere para comprar abarrote como  arroz,   azúcar , fideos, harina  tiene dos hijos menores una ya va al colegio el otro todavía por ser muy pequeño,  la Sra. Wilma es una persona trabajadora y se siente feliz por el apoyo que se le brindo.
texts.en: Wilma has a neighborhood store where she sells basic household products.  She is married to a builder and lives in her in-laws' home in Villa Copacabana.  Her store is located on a corner, in a strategic location.  Her business is going very well as she has a lot of customers.  She will use her loan to buy some bulk groceries which she has been offered.  She would like to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles and flour.  Wilma has two dependent children.  Her daughter goes to school but her son doesn't go yet because he is still very young.  Wilma is a hard-working person who feels happy with the support that she has been given.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is a married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She runs a tailoring business from her home, earning 8,000 PHP each month from it. Charlyn also sells detergents to her community. She works hard to support her family and save for her child's education.

Charlyn has requested this loan to purchase clothes, thread and other materials. Charlyn hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, thread and other materials

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es: Javier de Jesús, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene un negocio que es la venta de medicamento naturales, tiene bastante competencia pero busca como salir adelante buscando estrategias para poder vender su producto. Javier está solicitando un financiamiento para poder invertir en medicina naturales que son las más buscadas por sus clientes, para ello va comprar: panadol, vitaminas, jarbes, suplementos, dolovitalgia entre otros productos que son los demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en: Javier de Jesús, is 37 years old and has a natural medicine business.  He has plenty of competition but he looks for strategies to be able to sell his products.  He is asking for a loan in order to invest in natural medicines, which are sought out by his clients.  He wants to buy Panadol, vitamins, tonics, dietary supplements, among other things that his customers ask for.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 33-year-old married woman with five children, all in school. She has operated a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan for one year. Grace is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans for resale.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La señora Maria Cristina es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ofrecer a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Hace años compro su terreno y poco a poco construyo su casa para comenzar habitarla ya que para ella es una buena inversión a futuro y un patrimonio para su hijo. En este momento solicita un préstamo para enjarrarla dentro-fuera y pintarla para que se vea bien este fin de año ya que es cuando recibe más visitas y quiere ofrecerles un lugar acogedor donde se puedan hospedar. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar cemento, arena, pintura y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
María Cristina is a very hardworking woman who likes to offer her child a better quality of life.  Years ago she bought her land and little by little built her house to begin living in it because it is a good investment in the future and a legacy for her son.

Now she is requesting a loan to plaster the house inside and out, and paint it so it looks good at the end of this year, because this is when she gets more visits and she wants to offer them a welcoming place to stay.

To realize her project she needs to buy cement, sand, and paint, and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, chilies, apples etc.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa sells fruits and vegetables for a living. She sells bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes. Diosa is able to help buy her family's basic needs with her income. She works hard for her family, which comprises her husband and eight children aged between 9 and 26. Six of her children still go to school.
Diosa has requested this loan to buy more bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes to sell. She hopes to earn a better income and sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Loma Buenavista Group

texts.es: El grupo de "Loma Buenavista" está integrado por 12 integrantes son cuatro hombres y dos mujeres, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle así ya que el lugar donde viven está en la cima de un cerro y desde ahí se puede observa un bello panorama boscoso donde las heladas no han perjudico a los arboles el grupo ya existía anteriormente. Don Carlos quien es el represntante del grupo platica que tiene 43 años de edad esta casado con la señora Eulalia juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos que aun dependen de ellos de los cuales solo uno asiste a la escuela. Don Carlos es un hombre muy trabajador siempre esta al pendiente de que su familia no le hago falta lo necesario es por eso que desde hace 2 años inicio con la crianza de borregos junto con su esposa Eulalia ya que es ella quien cuida de los borregos mientras que don Carlos trabaja en otro parte del pais, Es por eso que Don Carlos esta solicitando un credito a la institucion para poder comprar sus borregitos pequeños para criarlos y esperar hasta cuando ya estan grandes para venderlos Don Carlos comenta que es un poco dificil encontrar un buen comprardor ya que los que comunmente se encuntra le pagan muy poco y a el no le conviene eso, Don Carlos comento: "Me gusta mucho la crianza de estos borregos ya que son animales que crecen muy rapido y los podemos vender cuando estamos en una situacion dicildil podemos vender y asi nos ayudamos o tambien cuando estoy sin trabajo" la unica dificultad que presenta Don Carlos es cuando sus borregos llegana a enfermarse y mueren  para don Carlos esto es una perdida de ganacia e inversion, pero apesar de todo tiene grandes metas las de hacer crecer su actividad poara poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y la educacion de sus hijos ya que para el es lo mas importante. Los integrantes del grupo son Santos, Juan, Bonifacia, Beatriz, Omar, Tomasa, Rosario, Yonic quienes invertiran en borregos, Epifania, Armando, Fernando quines invertiran en pollos.
texts.en:
The group "Loma Buenavista" (Loma Beautiful View) is comprised of twelve members, seven men and five women. The members of the group decided to name it that because the area where they live is at the top of a hill and from there you can see a beautiful wooded landscape where the frost does not harm the trees. The group has existed before.

Carlos is the group’s representative. He says that he is 43 years old and is married to Eulalia. Together they have formed a family of four children who are still dependent upon them, and only one of whom attends school. Carlos is a very hard-working man who always makes sure his family doesn't go without their basic needs. It’s for that reason that he began to raise sheep with his wife two years ago. She takes care of the sheep while he works in another part of the country.

Carlos is requesting a loan from the institution in order to purchase sheep so that they can raise them and sell them once they are grown. He states that it is somewhat difficult to find a good buyer, because the ones that are usually around pay him very little and that does not do him much good. He states that: “I really like to raise these sheep because they are animals that grow fast and we can sell them when we are going through difficult times or when I am without work.” The only difficulty that he is presented with is when his sheep get sick and die, which for him is a loss of income and investment.

Despite everything, he has big plans to expand his business. This will help improve his family’s quality of life and his children’s education, which is the most important thing to him.

The members of the group are Santos,Juan,Bonifacia,Beatriz,Omar,Tomasa, Rosario,and Yonic,who invest in sheep. Epifania, Armando,and Fernando invest in chickens.

loans.use: to buy sheep and chickens to raise them

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a single mother of four children and three go to school. She also takes care of additional family members . She operates a bar and has been for 2 years.

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of beer, soda, spirits and wine. She generates additional income from selling snacks. She works seven days a week and sells of retail basis only. Her major business challenges include defaulters. She would like to buy better seats and a fridge. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, soda, spirits and wine.

loans.name: Linnet

texts.en: Linnet is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Bam

texts.en:
M. Ban is married and father of 8 children. They are all living at the same place. His wife is growing rice in a field near their house for the family consumption, while their two eldest sons are employed in factories and their eldest daughter is waitress in a restaurant. 

M. Ban is selling watches and glasses on a mobile stand on different places such as markets and bus stations in and around Phnom Penh. For the moment, he is walking from one place to another or sometimes hiring a moto-taxi. He is selling his glasses for around 3000 Riel ($0.75) and his watches for 4000 Riel ($1). On sunny days he can sell for $20 and earn around $5 profit.

M. decided to borrow $500 from CREDIT. He will first purchase a cheap second-hand motorbike for $300, so that he could move to more places and increase its profit. M. wants to raise a pig the family house as well. It will cost $200 but they expect and exceptional income from the sale.

loans.use: purchasing a motorbike and a pig

loans.name: Wilman

texts.en:
Wilman S. is a rice farmer from a rural town named Salitre. He and his wife Blanca have 4 children together, all of which are grown up and contribute to their farm. They own a small number of cows and bulls, as well as chickens and other livestock. Like most people in the area, they depend on rice farming for their income.

Wilman is part of the first Communal Bank in the new Mifex Rural Finance Program. All the members of the Resistencia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named Resistencia. They will use the microloans to prepare the land and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Resistencia Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural area in the Province of Guayas which is known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture, which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to rice farming and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when during the rainy season on the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There is not a single financial institution that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The only access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous area despite its rural location. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in the fact that many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention force.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding during the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worst when El Niño occurs, the rice farmers lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Prepare his lands for cultivating rice

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem K., 62, is the landlord of a small rental house in Phnom Penh.  She earns $2/day and her husband earns $1.50/day working as a gardener.  They have 5 children.  Chem K. will use this loan to repair their house to protect it during the rainy season.  In the future, she wants her children to finish University, and if successful, buy a larger home.

loans.use: To repair house to protect it from leaking in rainy season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber and tools

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
I have three children, all of whom go to school. I am a homemaker and my husband drives a rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle). We bought the rickshaw on installments a couple of years ago and it is in need of repairs now. Since the rickshaw is our only source of income, we need to do the maintenance work before its condition deteriorates. For this, we need a loan.

Rehana M., Pakistan

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Ridwan

texts.id:
This time Ridwan has a motorcycle taxi business. Every day he works from the Ubung terminal from mornings to evenings. His nett profit is about Rp25,000.00 (about US$2.75)/day. His numbers are calculated after he subtracted operational expenses, for gasoline of about Rp25,000.00 ($2.75)/day. The expected loan, would be used to buy a motor cycle. He sees an opportunity for motor cycle taxi at night. If he could do this, his nett income could increase to between Rp25,000.00-Rp50,000.00 (about $2.75-$5.50)/day. Ridwan lives in a rented home with his wife and 2 children. This business are the only income for Ridwan family, since his wife is jobless. Daily living expenses are Rp20,000.00 ($2.20), and children education expenses are Rp60,000.00 (about $6.60)/month. He has to work very hard for it.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Saat ini Ridwan mempunyai usaha tukang ojek. Setiap harinya dia bertempat di terminal Ubung dari pagi sampai sore hari. Keuntungan bersihnya mencapai Rp 25.000,00/hari. Angka itu diperoleh setelah dipotong biaya operasional, yaitu bensin ± Rp 25.000,00/hari. Pinjaman yang diperoleh akan dipakai untuk membeli sepeda motor. Dia melihat peluang untuk ngojek di malam hari. Apabila dia melakukannya, penghasilan bersihnya bisa mencapai Rp 25.000,00 – RP 50.000,00 per harinya. Ridwan tinggal di rumah kontrakkan bersama isteri dan kedua anaknya. Usaha ini merupakan satu-satunya tumpuan harapan bagi Ridwan sekeluarga, karena isterinya tidak bekerja. Biaya hidup per hari Rp 20.000,00 dan biaya pendidikan anak Rp 60.000,00 per bulan. Dia harus kerja keras untuk itu.

loans.use:
To buy a motorcycle

Membeli sepeda motor

loans.name: Domitila T.

texts.es:
Doña Domitila is 49 years old, she lives in “Centro Poblado Menor San Luís, District of Salpo, Province of Otuzco, Department of La Libertad. She belongs to “Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Communal Bank for Working Women).

She studied until second grado, elementary school and has no children. She started selling used garments in small quantities and today she sells shoes in her community especially at the market of the District of Carabamba on Sundays. The shoes are manufactured by her husband. She also sells cereals part of which is from her own crop and part which she purchases from other communities.

A previous loan from Manuela Ramos, approximately $100, was invested in cereals and the funds requested, $775, will be invested in the purchase of material for the manufacture of shoes, such as leather, glue, needles and synthetic material. She plans to repay the loan in a period of 4 months.

Doña Domitila’s dream is to buy her own house at Trujillo and adopt a child as she did not have the opportunity of giving birth herself.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Domitila tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el Centro Poblado Menor San Luís, Distrito de Salpo provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras".

Estudió solo hasta el segundo grado de primaria y no tienen hijos. Inició su negocio vendiendo ropa usada en pequeñas cantidades y actualmente se dedica a la venta de zapatos tanto en su comunidad como en el mercado del Distrito de Carabamba, esto lo hace los días domingos. Estos zapatos son confeccionados por su esposo; además vende también cereales que ella siembra y otros que compra en comunidades más alejadas.

Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.300 (aproximadamente $100) el cual lo invirtió en la compra de cereales. Con el reciente préstamo de S/. 2,300.00 (aproximadamente $772) para cancelarlo en 4 meses, comprará materiales para la elaboración del calzado como: cuero, pegamentos, agujas y material sintético. La señora Domitila sueña con comprarse una casa en Trujillo y adoptar un niño porque no tuvo la oportunidad de tener uno propio.

loans.use: Purchase material for the manufacture and sale of shoes.

loans.name: Sayina's Group

texts.en:
Sayina N. is requesting a loan in order to buy more charcoal and sugarcane to increase her sales.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Mrs. Dy S., 35, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She runs a stand selling fish to the people in her community and generally makes on average around $2 each day in revenue. Her husband works selling charcoal and wood, making around $2 each day of profit. Mrs. Dy S. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more fish to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing more fish to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha lives in "anticretico" [Translator's Note: an "anticretico" is a special rental agreement offered in Bolivia, see: http://www.escapeartist.com/OREQ3/Rent_Free_Bolivia.html] with her two children. Her home is located on Abdón Saavedra street, in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz. She works in promotions at an institution but her wages are very low. She decided to start selling clothes, perfumes, shoes, etc. to earn extra income since she is separated from her husband and she is the one who supports her children.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase merchandise and to offer more products.

Martha does not have a previous record with Impro, this will be her first loan, but the socio-economic analysis shows that she is capable of making the payments and supporting her family at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Martha vive en anticretico con sus dos hijos en la calle Abdón Saavedra de la zona de sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja como promotora en una Institución pero su sueldo es muy bajo por lo cual ella se dedicó también al comercio y vende ropa, perfumes, calzados, etc para aumentar sus ingresos ya que esta separada del esposo y ella mantiene a sus hijos.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar mercadería y poder surtir más sus productos.

No tiene antecedente con Impro; este será su primer crédito, pero el análisis socio económico muestra que ella es capaz de cumplir con los pagos y al mismo tiempo mantener a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as clothes, perfumes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Farah's Group

texts.en: Farah Y. was married ten years ago and has one daughter and two sons. Her daughter is five years old and attends kindergarten, whereas her sons are three years old and three months old, respectively. Farah has lived in the small city Depalpur, Pakistan, since birth. Her husband trades livestock to earn a living, and to help improve his business, she would like to borrow funds from Kiva.  The other women in her group are: Rani L., who wants to expand her family's grocery store; Farzana T., who needs a loan to improve her family's agricultural productivity; Ramzana N., who is borrowing for her family’s tea stall; and Talat B., who is borrowing for her son, who runs a shoe-selling business. As a group, they are requesting a loan of $1,325.00.

loans.use: To expand livestock trading.

loans.name: Anne

texts.fr:
Born January 12, 1957 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Mrs. Anne O. is married to Ramane Tidjani, a motorcycle taxi driver in Cotonou. She has five children, including Aziz, a high school senior, and Djemilou and Haniath, high school freshmen. She has lived in Irede, a Cotonou shantytown, for over 20 years, where she has been selling boiled corn paste, firewood and other products. She is requesting this loan because she currently needs financing to increase the size of her business, satisfy her customers and meet her children’s needs in order to provide them with a decent standard of living.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 12 janvier 1957 à COTONOU dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame O. Anne est mariée à TIDJANI Ramane, conducteur de taxi moto dans la ville de COTONOU et mère de 5 enfants dont Aziz en classe de terminale, Djemilou et Haniath en classe de troisième à sa charge.Elle s’est installée à IREDE un bidonville de COTONOU depuis plus de 20 ans où elle exerce son activité de vente de la pâte de maïs bouilli, des bois de chauffage et autres. Actuellement,elle a besoin de financement pour augmenter le niveau de son activité, satisfaire sa clientèle, pourvoir aux besoins de ses enfants afin d’avoir un niveau de vie acceptable d’où la sollicitation de ce prêt.

loans.use: Purchase of five bags of corn and five bundles of wood

loans.name: Atsou

texts.fr:
Born September 13th, 1978 in Bolou-Kpéta in the Zio prefecture, Mr. Atsou W. is married and the father of two children. Very early on he left his studies to enter the workforce. Employed as a maintenance man in a company near where he lives in Tsévié, his salary barely covers his family expenses. This led him to begin selling cell phone credit recharge cards. His wife, a retailer of fresh fish, earns very little money which means all of the household expenses are the responsibility of Mr. W.. He is very energetic and is seeking a loan to strengthen his credit recharge card business and to set up a private telephone booth. This project will allow him to increase his income to improve his family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 13 septembre 1978 à Bolou-Kpéta dans la Préfecture du Zio, Monsieur W. Atsou est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Très tôt, il a abandonné ses études pour se lancer dans la vie active. Employé comme agent d’entretient dans une société de la place à Tsévié où il vit actuellement, son salaire suffit à peine à couvrir les dépenses de la famille. Ceci l’a amené à initier la vente des cartes de recharges. Sa femme, revendeuse de poissons frais gagne très peu, ce qui fait que toutes les dépenses du ménage sont prises en charges par monsieur W.. Dynamique, il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer le commerce des cartes de recharge et installer une cabine téléphonique. Ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour une amélioration de ses conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To set up a private telephone booth and sell phone credit recharge cards

loans.name: Joicy D.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Joicy M.. She is married and has five children aged between 2 and 14. She has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 2005, Joicy established her genge business (a type of outdoor stall). She opens her business seven days a week and nine to twelve hours a day. She is assisted by her husband. Joicy requires a loan in order to buy oil, tomatoes, salt, soaps, sugar, and rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy oil, tomatoes, salt, soaps, sugar, and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Rano G. is 46 and lives in Vahdat district. She and her husband have four children. Rano has a secondary school education and grows vegetables for a living. She has a small plot of land where she can plant everything her family needs. She sells the rest of her produce at the local market or to her neighbors. Right now it's the best time to re-plant and Rano wants to take advantage of the moment. She needs good quality seeds and mineral fertilizer in order to plant. In order to buy these supplies, she has applied for a 10-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Гафорова Рано жительница района Вахдат. Возраст 56 лет , замужем , имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее. Рано занимается растениводством.Она имеет небольшой участок земли , где сеет все необходимое для своей большой семьи. А лишнее реализует на местном рынке и соседям. Сейчас самое время для повторного посева и этим моментов хочет воспользоваться Рано .Но для посева ей нужны качественне семена и минеральные удобренияюДля этого она хочет получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa belongs to the Esmeralda ("Emeralds") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "provincia" of San Martin. She operates a business, located in her house, selling aggregates like stone, sand, fill, etc. for building. She also sells food, providing daily meals to the missionaries at her church.

With this loan of S/.2,500 (2,500 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy the supplies that she needs to make her daily meals: sugar, rice, cooking oil, pasta, etc. along with the ingredients that she has to buy every day such as chicken, beef, pork, fish, vegetables, platanos, eggs, coffee, oats and tea. She also has to buy tools and permits to be able to extract the aggregates she sells and deliver them to her customers on time.

Teresa, 39, lives with her husband and son. She relies on the support of her husband to sell the construction aggregates because it's a family business. She's an active woman and she works every day to help her family get ahead. Her goal is to see her son settled in a professional career. She also wants to buy a truck to make it easier to move the aggregates.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa se dedica a la venta de material agregado para la construcción como piedras, arena, ripio, etc. también vende comida, da pensión a los misioneros de la iglesia a la que pertenece.

Con este crédito de S/.2500.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará los insumos que necesita para la preparación diaria de sus comidas, como azúcar, arroz en sacos, aceite en galón, fideos en paquetes, y demás insumos que compra a diario como carnes de pollo, res, cerdo y pescado, verduras, plátanos, huevos, café, avena, cajas de diferentes tipos de té. Además tiene que invertir en combustible mano de obra, pagos de permiso en la municipalidad para poder sacar los agregados y llegar con puntualidad a sus clientes.

La señora Teresa tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo sobre todo en la venta de los agregados, por que es un negocio familiar, ella es una mujer muy activa, trabaja diariamente para sacar adelante a su familia, tiene como meta ver a su hijo realizado con una carrera y también desea comprar un volquete para que le sea mas fácil el traslado de los agregados.

loans.use: Buy materials and supplies for businesses.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo N. is a farmer in Trapaing Run Village in Takeo Province. 

On her plantation, she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile soil. To solve this problem, Mrs. Keo N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field. 

Her husband, Mr. Horm Chhuon, is policeman in the provincial town, and he can make a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Keo N. is 43 years old and the mother of eight children -- four are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida has been selling food in Dodoma, Tanzania for two years. She is currently earning a profit of approximately US$ 45 each month but hopes that taking out her first loan will enable her to increase her profit. If she succeeds in earning a greater profit, Farida intends to put the money towards paying her children's school fees and buying more food for her family. She is 37 years old and married. Farida has 7 children, ages 3, 5, 7, 9, 13, 15, and 18. She also cares for two additional dependents.
