Farida hopes to buy more wheat, flour, rice, sugar, oil, yeast, and charcoal with this loan. She will sell some of the items and use others to prepare food that she will sell at her shop. She will be sharing this loan with her sub-group members Elizabeth and Amina.

loans.use: To buy more wheat, flour, rice, sugar, oil, and yeast for her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Villa Huatatas Village Bank, named for the area where most of the group members live. 

Marina is 36 years old and married with four children.  Marina sells food from a mobile cart on the highway en route to Huatatas.  She works from 4am to noon each day selling breakfast and lunch.  She also owns a car, which her husband drives as an inter-district taxi. 

Marina needs a loan of 900 soles to buy sacks of rice, sugar, and oil.

Marina dreams of owning a house near her business, buying another car, and seeing her children graduate from school. 

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Marina es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Marina vende comida de manera ambulatoria en la carretera  de repartición a Huatatas, actividad que realiza desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 12 del día, vende desayuno y almuerzo. Además Marina tiene un carro con el cual trabaja su esposo realizando trasporte interdistrital.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite por sacos.
Marina sueña con tener una casa cerca de su negocio, otro carro y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Nail

texts.en: Nail was born in 1984. He lives in Khachmaz town. Three years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts for his truck. He transports loads.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hạnh năm nay 52 tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 nguời con trong đó có 3 con đã trưởng thành. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Trong suốt thời gian tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị Hạnh luôn chấp hành tốt các quy định của Quỹ sử dụng vốn hiệu quả và hoàn trả vốn đúng hạn. Hiện tại công việưc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Hạnhh là từ chăn nuôi gà với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị Hạnh  mong muốn được vay  10.000.000 để đầu tư vốn mua thêm gà về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 52 years old. She has four children, three of them are grown up. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2000. During the time participating in the Fund, Mrs. H. always complies with the Fund's policy, she uses the loan effectively and pays back on time. Currently, the main source of income of Mrs. H.'s family is from raising chickens, with a monthly income of VND5,000,000. In this loan cycle, Mrs. H. would like to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy more chickens to raise them up.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising chickens

loans.name: Muhtabar

texts.ru: Шахимова Мухтабар проживает в городе Турсун_заде. Возраст 38 лет . Замужем и имеет троих детей. Уже пять лет занимается торговлей . Торгует продуктами питания. Имеет свой магазин. Товар привозит из города Душанбе. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhtabar S. lives in Tursunzade. She is 38 years old. She is married and has three children. Muhtabar is a store owner. For the past five years she has been selling groceries that she purchases in Dushanbe. Now she is applying for a loan that would allow her to increase cash flow. She would be able to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas es una mujer soltera de 38 años, vive en una casa alquilada, en la cual funciona su tienda y desea mucho mejorar su futuro. En San Antonio de Putina (Provincia de la región de Puno), se encuentra el centro poblado La Mina Rinconada (Poblado predominantemente minero), es aquí donde Felicitas tiene su tienda en la cual vende de todo a todos. Lleva 15 años en este negocio y le ha ido muy bien, pero el incremento de la población a hecho que la mercadería que lleva no le alcance. A ella le gusta mucho su negocio siente que lleva progreso a la Mina Rinconada, sin embargo se le hace muy difícil transportar todos los productos desde Juliaca, así que siempre tiene que ingeniárselas para hacerlo, ella desea hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar su mercadería, con lo cual pueda satisfacer la demanda de la numerosa población de la Mina Rinconada. Este es el tercer préstamo de Felicitas con MFP, ella siempre ahorra para poder pagar sus cuotas, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a su banco comunal, en donde es una de las socias más alegres y responsables. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más mercadería para abastecer a la creciente población de la Mina Rinconada.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a single, 38 year old woman. She lives in a rented house where she has her store and wishes very much to improve her future. In San Antonio of Putina ( a province in the region of Puno) there is a town center called La Mina Rinconada (as in Corner Mine, since this is primarily a mining town), this is where Felicita has her store where she sells everything to everybody. She has been in this business for 15 years and is doing very well, but the increase in the population has caused shortages in her merchandise. She likes her business and feels that she brings progress to the Mina Rinconada, however, it is hard for her to bring all her products from Juliaca, so she always has to engineer ways to do so. She wishes to grow her business and increase her merchandise, and thus be able to satisfy the demand of the larger population of Mina Rinconada. This is the third loan that Felicita has with MFP, she always saves to be able to pay the installments, since she does not want to cause problems to her community bank, where she is one of the happiest and responsible members. With the money that she is requesting she will buy more merchandise to be able to provide for the growing population of Mina Rinconada.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise of her store.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth owns a small food vendor store in the Kihesa neighborhood of Dodoma. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works for nine hours at her business.

She belongs to the Dodoma Road "F" West group loan. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business, increase her profit, and grow her business.

Janeth is 54 years old, married, and has four children: ages 30, 24, 18 and 16. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
El señor Dionicio V. Rivarola tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su esposa en la casa de su suegra donde tiene su despensa la cual formo gracias a un dinero que estuvo ahorrando cuando trabajaba en una empresa.

Don Dionicio es una persona muy sacrificada ya que diariamente se levanta muy temprano para ir a la Ciudada de Clorinda de donde compra sus mercaderias para su negocio.

Su pequeño negocio empezo en el mes de Enero de 2007, y según comentario del mismo le esta yendo muy bien gracias a la buena atencion a los clientes.

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de mas mercaderias para surtir con mas variedad ya que va creciendo la clientela.
texts.en:
Señor Dionicio V. Rivarola is 22 years old and lives with his wife in her mother's house where they have their store. He got it started thanks to the money that he saved up when he was working for a company. Don Dionicio is a very selfless person who gets up early every morning to go to the City of Clorinda where he buys the merchandise for his business. He started his small business in January 2007 and by his own account things are going well for him thanks to the good service he gives to the customers. The loan requested is for the purchase of more merchandise to provide a greater variety as his customers increase.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meats, sugar, rice, cooking oil, disposable diapers, soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en:
Mr. Restituto L. is very hardworking man who sells a variety of goods in his mini grocery store. Restituto wants to improve his living standard which is the reason why he is spending most of his time in managing his business. He opens his store everyday with the help of his children.

Restituto wants to add additional grocery items for sale in his store to eventually increase his sales and income. HSPFI assisted him through its microfinance program. Right now, Restituto needs an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional grocery items for sale like sugarcane, dairy products, beverages and rice.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for sale such as rice, sugar, beverages and dairy products

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Filomena es socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 5 hijos.  Vive en el Jr. Santa Cruz y cuenta con estudios de 2do de primaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió comprar mas abarrotes para su negocio.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de S/ 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de abarrotes como arroz, ázúcar, huevos, etc., para agrandar su negocio y surtirlo con más productos.  Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando en la ferias.
texts.en:
Filomena is a member of the Manuela Ramos community bank in the Mazocruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 58, married, and has 5 children. She lives on Jr. Santa Cruz. She has a second grade education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 10 years. She started with a loan of 300 PEN, and she bought groceries for her business. She currently needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy more groceries like rice, sugar, eggs, etc. to expand her business and stock it with more products. Her biggest desire is to continue working at the fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries like rice, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria D. is engaged in managing a general store business. She lives in the simple village of Ubong Solana, Cagayan. She has four children. Chrismelet, 21 years old and a high school graduate, is now married. Jonalyn, 19 years old, is also a high school graduate. Maryrose, 17, graduated from high school and Marinela, 10, is in grade school. 

Maria wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 23000. She will utilize the amount to purchase added grocery products to sell in her store like soft drinks, some snacks or breads, basic kitchen commodities and many more. According to her, she is able to earn a daily net income of PHP 300. It is a great help to provide her family's basic needs. Her husband, Pomelo D., is a farmer. He patiently tills their little parcel of farm lot to have a harvest. Somehow, said Maria, with the financial support of KIVA lenders, she may able to improve her business more, support the education of her youngest child and even repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel A. is from the village of Acad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 30 years old and married with five school-age children. To make a living, Romel operates a business buying and selling bananas in the local community. Romel has been engaged in his business for more than five years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Romel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Romel from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Teo's Group

texts.en:
Teo M. is the leader of the Abateesa group in Kabowa. She is 52 years old and married with four children, aged between 28 and 13 years old. They are all in secondary school. She also cares for two grand-children.

She has a tailoring business in which she sews school uniforms and sweaters, a business she started in 2004. She is able to make a profit of 50,000 per month. She is doing well because she has the help of her loans. She hopes to acquire more sewing machines so that she can make more sweaters and increase her profits. She needs a loan to be able to buy more threads and clothing materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy more threads and clothing materials for her business.

loans.name: Cruz Macarena

texts.es:
La señora Cruz Macarena O. tiene ya más de ocho años con su negocio de abarrotes este es la fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que es una persona discapacitado y solo así puede salir adelante.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar una mercancía que le están ofreciendo a muy buen precio, pero no tiene el suficiente capital para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar su negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que genere el negocio con está nueva mercancía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cruz Macarena Otera has had her grocery business for more than eight years. This is the source of income for her family, since she is a handicapped and this is her only way of going forward. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy merchandise, which she will offer at a very good price, but she doesn’t have enough capital for the investment without the loan and doesn’t want to undercapitalize her business. She plans to repay the loan with the earnings that her business will generate with this new merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: add to his inventory

loans.name: Vergelita

texts.en: 40-year-old Vergelita and her farmer husband are into a rice production (rice farming) business seven years now. Profits from this business was used by Vergelita to send her four children to school. Two now are in college and two are in high school. Vergelita wants to grow their rice production business to be able to enhance their profit and to be able to send her two younger children to college in a couple of years. She started with this business through a loan from Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI)when she became a member in 2005 therefore, she will also be using her loans to enhance her business. Now, Vergelita intended to use her loan for buying a hand tractor and rice seedlings for the and season of planting. Though harvest of harvest of rice takes place every after five months, Vergelita's husband support her weekly payment in ASHI through his fishing business which is daily. Verogelita chooses longer mode of payment to avoid overburdening herself with bigger payments weekly versus her weekly income. Fortunately, with this principle she has, in all her loans, she has maintained a very good performance.

loans.use: Will be used to enhance her rice farming business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Managing a general store is the business operated by Erlinda. She requests a loan amounting to PHP4,000 from Kiva lenders to further improve her small store. She hopes that her business will become productive and earn a higher income to support the daily allowance of her children and provide for the needs of their family. 

Erlinda is married to Edelberto. He helps her whenever she needs assistance in managing her store. Expanding her store is Erlinda’s goal to sustain the needs of her family, especially for the education of their seven children. One of their children is still studying while the other six are already married.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Pastor 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Evelin O. (third from left in the photo) is a young entrepreneur who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for a borrowing group called El Señor es mi Pastor (The Lord is my Shepherd), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Evelin lives in Boca Chica, a small coastal town about 30 minutes west of San Pedro de Macorís. She is 22 years old, and this is her very first loan with Esperanza. Evelin lives with her mother and father, two siblings, and her two children. With her loan, Evelin hopes to expand her business as a shoe saleswoman. Typically, customers will order a certain style or color of shoes, and Evelin will buy them and bring them to the customer’s home. This business plan helps differentiate her from shoe salespeople who only sell on the street or in shops. Evelin is taking out this loan to help her diversify the selection of shoes available to her customers.

Evelin hopes that she can continue to receive loans after her first loan is repaid. Eventually, she would like to have her own store and greatly expand her line of offered products. Her children are very young, and Evelin hopes to send them to the best schools possible so they can have businesses of their own when they grow up. Thank you for lending to Evelin and to El Señor es mi Pastor group!

loans.use: Purchasing new styles of sandals and shoes

loans.name: Rubaba

texts.en: Rubaba I. sells cosmetic products in her own store. She is 46 years old, married and has three children. Rubaba has been running the store for the past seven years. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Rubaba is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again. Rubaba is trying to sustain her business and has requested a loan of 1607 AZN to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Rubaba reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: To diversify and increase inventory for resale

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa started her fish business twenty years ago at a community market where she lives. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty fish and for that reason she has many fans.  She buys fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.  Yaa is 50 years-old, married and the mother of seven children. Two of her children are in school while the rest live independently. She supports her children from the business proceeds. She depends on that for their food, school bills and sometimes their medical bills. She is asking for a loan in order to increase her stock of assorted fish and therefore to increase her income so that she can support her children's education and the business growth. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Adela Ignacia

texts.es:
La socia ADELA IGNACIA pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 63 años de edad, es divorciada, tiene tres hijos (dos varones y una mujer), ellos son casados y alternan sus actividades con el hogar y el trabajo, cada uno de los hijos tienen su propia familia. La socia es enfermera cesada.  

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de manualidades, bisutería artesana, artesanía, cerámica al frió y por esta navidad ella hace arreglos navideños y los envía a la ciudad de Lima.  La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de manualidades.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Adela Ignacia is a native of the city of Cusco and a member of the Amauta Communal Bank. She is 63 years old, divorced, and has three children (two sons and a daughter). All of her children are married and have their own families. They divide their time between home and work.

Adela is a retired nurse who divides her time between her household activities and selling handicrafts, handmade jewelry, and ceramics. For this Christmas season, she is making holiday arrangements to sell in Lima. Adela is requesting a loan so that she can sell more of these products.

She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicraft materials

loans.name: Sairi

texts.en:
I. Sairi is 45 years old and married, and she is the loving mother of four children. Sairi’s husband is currently unemployed, so her business is the main source of income for her family.

Sairi has a grocery store where she sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, detergents and other products. She has been in this business for more than twenty years. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Sairi is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again. Sairi wants to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of $800 to increase the inventory she has for sale.

One of her dreams is that her children progress by means of their studies. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Sairi realize all of her aspirations. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to increase the inventory she has for sale

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en: Alfreda F. is from the town of Capas Arwas, Binalonan, Pangasinan. She is 33 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Alfreda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Alfreda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Alfreda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia P. is engaged in rice farming and trading. She grows rice and sells her harvest for additional income for her family. She said her harvest is what she uses to buy her family food and provide for their basic needs. The farm is very important to her, especially because it is the only source of income for the family.

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy the farm supplies she needs to grow her rice well. The loan will help not just to improve her harvest but to increase her family's income as well.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 32 years old. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Charlotte is a trader. She trades in vegetables, specifically tomatoes. She procures the tomatoes from nearby farming communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She sometimes treks to other towns to sell. Charlotte has been in business for 15 years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama K. is a married small businesswoman with one child.  She runs a business selling firewood to customers at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the firewood wholesale from the suppliers and sells it retail to her customers. She has been in the business for five years and she manages to live based on the business income. Her business plan is to diversify the business into a foodstuffs shop but her lack of capital is very limiting. She needs a loan of T.shs 700,000 to diversify the business.

loans.use: To diversify the business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella D. C. is from the village of Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur Province. She is 40 years old. Stella is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Stella owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, noodles, salt, eggs, soy sauce, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Stella has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Stella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Stella is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Stella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Duyunbubu's Group

texts.ru:
В серой действительности повседневной жизни, даже проходя по улице среди огромного количества людей, нам трудно даже представить себе, как живут другие люди. Иногда человек очень прилично одет, но оказывается, что он не очень – то богат. А иногда наоборот: идёт человек, в довольно поношенной старой одежде, а оказывается это его рабочая одежда, а он сам – владелец какого – нибудь заведения. Как бы там ни было, герои нашей истории обыкновенные люди, из тех самых, что окружают нас каждый день на улице. Но людей этой категории, от серой массы отличает один аспект. Этот аспект заключается в том, что у них есть сильное желание и стремление изменить собственную жизнь к лучшему. И их желание выражается конкретными замыслами и чувством ответственности. Например, Джакыпова Дуйунбубу. Она – лидер этой группы. Она живёт в г. Токмоке вместе с дочкой, которая в данный момент работает продавцом сувениров в Объединённых Арабских Эмиратах. Дуйунбубу разведена и чтобы обеспечивать себя и дочку в свои пятьдесят шесть лет, Дуйунбубу шьёт национальные изделия, также так называемые на кыргызском языке - «тошоки» (patchwork quilts). Когда Дуйунбубу осталась без работы, она быстро сообразила, что пришло время самой находить себе работу, и она начала шить тошоки на продажу. Сейчас это занятие приносит ей немногим не малым около четырёх тысяч сом ($100) в месяц. Дуйнунбубу обратилась за кредитом с целью закупить материал для пошива в преддверии праздников. 

У Дуйунбубу три партнёра по группе:

Сариевой Зине пятьдесят лет. Она вдова, но у неё четверо детей. Дети уже взрослые и сами себя обеспечивают. Однако Зина никоим образом не зависит от своих детей и сама занимается бизнесом. Она продаёт халаты. Продажа халатов приносит Зине около десяти тысяч сом в месяц. Зине нужен кредит, чтобы купить контейнер.

Жумалиевой Жылдызкан сорок четыре года. Её супруг работает строителем. Жылдызкан торгует национальными изделиями: тошоками, подушками и коврами. У Жылдызкан также один сын, который работает слесарем в СТО. 
Жылдызкан сейчас нуждается в кредите. Она хочет купить разные цвета материалов, чтобы изготавливать ковры.

Атакановой Нургул тридцать лет. Вместе с мужем Нургул воспитывает одну дочь, которой пять лет. Муж Нургул работает в ОсОО Умут и Ка, а сама Нургул занимается торговлей шарфов. Нургул решила обратиться за кредитом, так как ей нужны средства, чтобы закупить товар.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
In the gray reality of everyday life, even passing among a large number of people on the street, it is difficult for us to imagine how other people live. Sometimes a person is very well dressed, but turns out that he is not rich. And sometimes it is the opposite: a person walks by wearing fairly old, worn clothing, but turns out that this is his work uniform, and he is an owner of some type of company. However it may be, the heroes of our story are ordinary people, those who surround us every day on the street. But people in this category differ from the gray masses in one aspect, which is the strong will and drive to change their lives for the better. And their will is expressed in concrete ideas and responsibility. Take, for example, Duyunbubu D.. She lives in the city of Tokmak together with her daughter, who currently sells souvenirs in the United Arab Emirates. Duyunbubu is divorced, and at fifty-six years old, in order to support herself and her daughter, she sews traditional goods, also called “toshoki” (patchwork quilts) in the Kyrgyz language. When Duyunbubu lost her job, she quickly realized that the time has come to find work for herself and started sewing toshoki for sale. Now this business yields her around four thousand som ($100) per month. Duyunbubu requested this loan in order to purchase fabric for sewing in anticipation of the holidays. Duyunbubu has three partners in this group: Zina S. is fifty years old. She is a widow and has four children. The children are already grown and provide for themselves. However, Zina is in no way dependent on her children and has her own business. She sells robes. The sale of robes yields Zina around ten thousand som per month. Zina needs a loan in order to purchase a container. Jyldyzkan J. is forty-four years old. Her husband is a construction worker. Jyldyzkan sells traditional goods, such as toshoki, pillows and rugs. She also has one son, who works as a mechanic at the technical service station. Jyldyzkan currently needs a loan. She wants to purchase materials of various colors in order to make rugs. Nurgul A. is thirty years old. Together with her husband, Nurgul is raising one daughter, who is five years old. Nurgul’s husband works at the Umrut and Ka milk processing factory, and Nurgul is involved in selling scarves. Nurgul decided to request a loan because she needs the means in order to purchase merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric for sewing in anticipation of the holidays.

loans.name: Abduvosit

texts.en:
Raising calves is a very common business in the village of Uzbekkishlok in Dj. Rasulov region. Abduvosit has dedicated himself to this business with great effort in order to provide for his wife and three school-aged children. To support his family, he sporadically purchases calves to raise them, fatten them, and then sell them or butcher them to sell the meat. Today, his major need is acquiring a calf for his business. For this reason Abduvosit looks for support to IMON International, to buy more cattle that will make his family’s sustenance possible.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to develop business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha, 46 years old and married with seven children, has been farming since 2008. She sells milk to earn income and also practices other forms of farming. Since she joined Faulu, her living standards have really improved because she can access loans. She hopes to grow her business and improve her living standards and is now requesting a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy a dairy cow. Tabitha describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
Iris es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyar a su familia. 

Iris, tiene 30 años, es conviviente y es docente. Su principal actividad económica es enseñar en el colegio nacional “Fortunato Herrera” de la ciudad del Cusco. La institución educativa le va contratar por un año. Ya son varios años que ejercer su profesión y le va muy bien gracias al esfuerzo que cada día pone en su trabajo, ella requiere el crédito para ahorrar y luego se va comprar una computadora portátil.  

Iris pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la Asociación Arariwa es socia nueva, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación que brinda la Asociación. 

Iris se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Iris is a young, hardworking and enterprising woman that looks for opportunities in each moment to get ahead and with her daily efforts, support her family.

Iris is 30 years old, has a live-in partner and is a teacher. Her main economic activity is teaching at the national school “Fortunato Herrera” in the city of Cusco. The educational institution is hiring her for one year. She has already been in the profession for several years and it has gone well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work every day. She is requesting the loan to save and later buy a laptop computer.

Iris belongs to the “Los Diamantes” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa. She is a new member and shows that she is happy and satisfied with the loan, savings, and training services that the Association provides.

Iris is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means and similarly, she promises to make her loan repayments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a laptop computer

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Composé de huit femmes, les membres du groupe Sabougnouma sont toutes des femmes mariées vivant en majorité dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, co-épouses, frères, sœurs et enfants. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et  5 enfants. Ces femmes résident dans le village de Kangaré, région de Sikasso  république du Mali. 
Par des relations de voisinage et de mariage, ces femmes se sont connues et font le commerce d’articles divers tels, les céréales, les vêtements, les condiments alimentaires etc.
Afin d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire et mieux satisfaire la  clientèle, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe. Les précédents n’ont pas l’objet de mauvais remboursement. Madame Kany S. qui excelle dans l’habillement, veut avec  ce prêt acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes qu’elle va  d’abord coudre avant la vente. Sa production est revendue ensuite au marché de Sélingué, au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elles comptent obtenir un bénéfice de 40 000 FCFA par mois qui sera réutilisé  dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is composed of eight married women, who live mainly in extended traditional families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers, sisters, and children. They average 35 years of age and 5 children. These women live in Kangaré, a village in the Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali, and got acquainted through links of neighborhood and marriage. Their businesses consist in selling various items such as cereals, clothing, food condiments, etc. In order to bolster their revenue and better meet customer demand, they joined Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now seeking their second group loan. Previous loans were repaid without problems. Mrs. Kany S., who excels in selling clothing, wants to use this loan to buy 10 lengths of pagne (colorful African cloth) that she will sew and then sell. She sells her production at the Selingué market, for cash or on credit, to a clientele comprising mostly women. These women intend to turn a monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80), to be reinvested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 lengths of pagne (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Chemetet

texts.en:
R. is 30 years old. She is married and has three children between 2½ and 8 years old. Two of her children are attending school.

R. is a farmer in Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been farming for ten years and has two employees. Her main product is milk which she sells to the middlemen who later sell to the local market. She also earns income by selling maize to the local market. Her main challenges are the fluctuating prices of milk and lack of enough water for farming.

R. successfully completed her first loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 30,000. She has requested this new loan of KES 40,000 from Juhudi to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will increase her family's sources of income and enable her to pay school fees for her children.

In future, R. would like to acquire quality dairy cows which can produce about 20 liters of milk per day. She appreciates the work Juhudi is doing in providing loans to small-scale farmers.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: María Lorena

texts.es:
La señora María Lorena P. C. es casada de 37 años, habita con sus 2 hijos adolecentes en el barrio Laureles Norte, ellos tienen un comedor desde hace 5 años, y fue su madre quien la apoyo económicamente a  iniciarse en esta actividad y tras eso ha sido el sustento diario a sus hijos. 

Es para el negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios de cocina que le permitan aumentar la productividad del personal, a futuro espera tener las posibilidades de comprar un local y poner un restaurante. Este apoyo le brindara la posibilidad de mejorar económicamente sus racursos y ofrecerle a sus hijos los estudios academicos y que ellos tengan las herramientas para sobresalir profesionalmente en el medio.
texts.en:
María Lorena P. C. is married, 37 years old and has 2 teenage children in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. The have run a diner for 5 years. Her mother gave her the economic support to start this business, which has been the daily sustenance for her children.

For this business, she requests a loan to purchase kitchen utensils that will allow her to increase the productivity of her employees. In the future, she hopes have the possibility to buy a local shop and open a restaurant. This support brings her the opportunity to improve her resources and offer academic studies to her children, so that they have the tools to succeed professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase kitchen equipment

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro y los prestamos son de mucha ayuda para su negocio.
Aydee es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 12 años que están estudiando, Aydee vende ropa variada de acuerdo a pedidos de sus clientes, sus ventas los realiza en la selva ayacuchana, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Ayde junto a su esposo tienen carros que realizan transporte de pasajeros, uno de ellos es conducido por su esposo y el otro por un chofer. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de pantalones, polos.
Sus sueños son equipar su casa y que su hijo viaje de promoción de estudios.
texts.en:
Aydee is a member of the Buena Suerte (Good Luck) communal bank; what she likes best about it are the savings incentives and the loans that are of great help to her business. Aydee lives with her life partner; has two children, who are 15 and 12 years old, who are students. Aydee sells assorted clothing on order to customers in the Ayacucho backcountry; she gets her merchandise in Lima. In addition, together with her husband, Aidee has vehicles with which they provide public transportation services; one of them is driven by her husband and the other one by a driver. She will use the funds to buy pants and polo-type shirts. Her dreams are to furnish her house and that her son goes on his class graduation trip.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants and polo-type shirts.

loans.name: Sam Oeun's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 14 members who live in Pou Khvet village, TaK. province. Mrs. Sam Oeun S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member of the group will use his or her loan to support a different purpose.
Mrs. Sam Oeun S. is 20-year-old married woman. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, while her husband, Mr. Tharath Un, is a bird breeder at home who is able to earn a small income to support his family. He also helps his wife on the farm. Mrs. Sam Oeun S. will use the loan to buy bird food to support her husband's business. The couple has a two-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy bird food to support her husband's business

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra D. is from the village of Obay, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 53 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Alejandra owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2007,Alejandra joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 4,800 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Alejandra from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking businesswoman who sells charcoal and fish to earn a living. She offers good service in selling her products to people in her village. She has been in this business for five years.

Marilyn belongs to a group of young entrepreneurs where she saves her money, having secured access to capital from ASHI. She appreciates that the organization has helped her improve her business, hence her standard of living. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy more charcoal and fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to buy more inventories of charcoal and fish for better sales. She sees herself venturing into a wholesale business in the next five years. Marilyn is hoping that her envisioned business will help her support her 4 children's financial needs so that they are able to graduate from college. By then, Marilyn thinks their lives would be positively changed and she will have her dreams achieved.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and fish to sell

loans.name: Lynda

texts.en:
Lynda is 32 years old.  She is married and has one child who is in school.  She is a tailor who mainly makes children's outfits to earn a living.  She started the business two years ago and has two employees.  She was previously selling second-hand clothes.

She joined Favour Self Help group in Faulu Kenya.  The members guarantee each others loans. Through the group, she has been able to set up a business premise and bought a sewing machine.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy fabric and thread.  She hopes to educate her daughter so that she may have a bright future.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Julius Kipkemei

texts.en:
Julius R. is 37 years of age, is married to Irine Kobilo, and is the father of a boy aged 14. Julius operates a small-scale horticultural farm. He resides in Kapkiamo a few kilometers from Kabarnet town.

Julius has borrowed a loan of Kshs 30,000; he intends to use Kshs 1,000 to purchase tomatoes, Kshs 3,000 to purchase tree seedlings, Kshs 15,000 to purchase water pipes for irrigation, Kshs 8,100 to purchase fertilizer and Kshs 2,900 to purchase insecticides.

Julius was introduced to KADET by an existing client. Most of his clients are residents of Kapkiamo and Kabarnet town. If this loan boosts his business, he intends to save his profits and later start dairy farming.

Julius describes himself has hardworking and ready to help his community.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married. She is 35 year old with four children whose ages range between 4 and 12 years. They all go to school. Her husband is a driver. 

Mary sells maize and it's now been three years since she started her business. Mary will buy more maize for sale with the loan she hopes to get. With the profit, she will pay school fees for her children. In the future, she wants to have a lorry (truck) to transport maize from the villages to her workplace.

loans.use: Buying maize for sale

loans.name: Gulnora Mehmanova's Group

texts.en:
Gulnora M. is the leader of this group. She is 44 years old and a widow who has two daughters and three sons. All her children are students. In order to make money, Gulnora started to breed livestock 12 years ago. By reselling farm animals after fattening, she earns 3,500 KGS per month. With this loan, she wants to purchase livestock animals for breeding. In the future she wants to save money and open her own grocery store. Zarina B., 26, is the treasurer of the group. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS, she started to sell convenience goods. In this way she makes 11,700 KGS per month. She hopes to obtain a loan to purchase convenience goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. Adam S., 58, is married. He has two sons and a daughter. His sons are working in Russia and his daughter is at school. Adam and his wife breed livestock to make money. With this loan, Adam wants to purchase more farm animals for breeding. In the future he plans to repair his house. Kudaiberdi A., 49, is married. He has a daughter and two sons. Kudaiberdi breeds livestock and his wife works in Russia. With this loan he wants to purchase two sheep for breeding. In the future he wants to build a new house.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff. arn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

loans.use: To purchase livestock animals

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina tiene 33 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Luz Marina vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Anta provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La comunidad de Compone se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco donde la mayoría de pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. Luz Marina alterna las actividades del hogar con las actividades de su negocio. Su actividad económica principal de la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, aceite  y muchas cosas más. 
 
Luz Marina desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Luz Marina con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 700 nuevos soles, ella invertirá para aumentar sus negocios y desea comprar mas comestibles como por ejemplo sacos de arroz y azúcar. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Luz Marina is 33 years old, lives with her common-law husband and has two children. She currently lives in the community of Compone, district of Anta, department of Cusco, Peru. Her community is located about 45 minutes from the city of Cusco, and the majority of its inhabitants make a living in agriculture and raising livestock. Luz Marina alternates her household and business responsibilities. Her main source of income comes from selling food products, such as rice, noodles, oil and many other items. She has belonged to the San Isdro de Compone community bank and Kiva partner Asociacion Arariwa in Cusco for quite some time. Luz Marina plans to use her next loan of 700 soles to invest in expanding her business and purchasing more food products, such as sacks of rice and sugar. She is grateful for the opportunity made available through this medium and promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase more food products such as bags of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Moises Adali

texts.es:
Moisés, de 30 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de medicinas, este negocio lo inicio por la necesidad de llevar a su familia la alimentación diaria, no tiene horario fijo para realizar las ventas y por el momento enfrenta la situación de poseer suficiente medicinas para ofrecer a los clientes, lo que lo lleva a solicitar un préstamo que le ayude a compra diferentes clases de medicinas para toda clase de enfermedades, y de esta manera que sus clientes puedan comprarle y contar con la preferencia de estos.
El sueña convertirse en un vendedor mayorista y recibir jugosas ganancias para dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
30-year-old Moisés lives in San Rafael Oriente, in the department of San Miguel. He sells medicine. He started this business because of the need to provide for his family’s daily food needs. He does not have a fixed schedule for making his sales. At the moment, he is facing the situation of not having enough medicines to offer his customers, which is what leads him to request a loan that will help him to buy different types of medicine for all kinds of sicknesses. This way his customers will buy from him, and he will be their preferred seller.
He dreams of becoming a wholesale vender and earning substantial profits to give his family greater economic stability and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy medicines

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad A. B. is from A. Ashrafia, Jordan. He is 24 years old and owns a cereals and herbs shop. Ahmad started his business three years ago with a very humble beginning, struggling to keep his doors open!

In 2007, with his continuous hard-work and unlimited ambitions, Ahmad started his business with the necessary cereals and herbs product, opening his first store.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 1500 JD (2113 USD), which will be used to purchase additionA. raw materials and increase capitA. to expand his business.

Ahmad is passionate about his work, and nothing will stand in his way of fulfilling his dreams and ambitions. Now he is looking to open a new store and import the needed raw materials from Africa.

loans.use: To buy raw materials (cereals and herbs) to expand his business

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia L. G.: se dedica a la venta de alimnetos y compra de pollos ella vende en el mercado de forma ambulante ella solicita este credito para compra de productos comestibles, y compra de pollos, ya que en esta epoca es cuando mas ella vende su producto, y asi poder agrandar en poco mas su venta y poder tener un lugar mas estable para vender le da gracias a Dios por darle la oportunidad que fape le ayude con el prestamo solicitado. su sueño es agrandar mas su negocio tener mas productos que ofrecerle a su clientes.
texts.en: Marta Alicia L. G. sells food and also buys chickens which she sells in the market as a street trader.  She is requesting a loan to buy food products and chickens since this is the time of year when she sells a lot of her products.  In this way, she will be able to increase her sales a little and have a more stable place from which to sell.  She thanks God for giving her the opportunity to receive a loan from Fape.  Her dream is to expand her business some more and have more products to offer her customers.

loans.use: To buy food products and chicken

loans.name: Juana Elvira

texts.en:
Juana is fifty years old.  She maintains a stable home, living with her husband and their three children.  The family lives in the district of TambogranD..  TambogranD. is a semi-tropical zone which is populated primarily by farmers.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals.

Juana raises animals in corrals near her home.  She raises sheep and fowl, specifically ducks and chickens.  She raises the animals for eggs and meat.  She feeds and cares for her herd until the animals reach the appropriate size and weight to be sold in local markets.  The animals play an important role in the nutrition of the local populace and the culinary traditions of the region.  Juana’s husband works outsiD. of the home and spends the entire day in the field.

Juana plans to use her loan to purchase balanced feed for her animals.  She hopes the feed will improve the health of her animals and the productivity of her business.  This will be her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.

Juana is a hard-working woman with good references from the community.  She dreams of being able to finance a full education for her children, including college.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas U. is from the village of Nuesa. She is 47 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Felicitas owns and operates a business making fermented rice and fish mixtures and dried fish for sale in the community. Felicitas has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Felicitas joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Felicitas from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long T., 46, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. T. sells food, earning an income of USD 2.36 per day. One of her children sells car spare parts, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 80 on food and USD 34 on the other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a truck to transport vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a truck to transport vegetables to sell

loans.name: Randolph

texts.en:
Randolph P. is from the village of Labo Ozamiz City. He is 45 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Randolph owns and operates a transportation business. His main source of income comes from providing motor transport services. Randolph has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

Randolph joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Randolph is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle and provide better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Randolph from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair vehicle

loans.name: Novelita

texts.en:
Novelita M. lives in the village of Brgy. Model Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old, married and has five school-aged children. For the last five years, she has made a living by providing transportation services to people in her community, and now makes about PHP 4,200 a month from her work.

In 2010, Novelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Novelita used that loan to buy tires and other items and is now applying for a new loan, for PHP 8,000, to continue improving and expanding her business. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and women and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to improve her ability to provide transportation services

location.town: Brgy. Model Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcay

loans.name: Jeanny

texts.en:
Jeanny B. is from the village of Daanglungsod. She is 39 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeanny runs a general store, where she sells different kinds of products to local community members. Jeanny has been engaged in her business for more than 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Jeanny joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jeanny from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to have access to working capital

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra C. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Silvestra is married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Silvestra owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products, canned goods, junk foods, instant noodles and beverages in the local community. Silvestra has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Silvestra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Silvestra is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and detergents. This loan will be the first taken out by Silvestra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and detergents

loans.name: Mariana Del Socorro

texts.es: Mariana Del Socorro tiene 60 años, se dedica a una pulpería y venta de cajetas, vive con su hijo que es menor de edad. Es una persona muy trabajadora este negocio lo aprendió con el apoyo de sus padres fue así que poco a poco Mariana decide establecer su propio negocio y realizar  esta actividad. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de dulces, bolsas, canela,vasos,leña, casuelas entre otros productos. Así  le da la oportunidad de estar preparada para atender la demanda. Su objetivo es crecer en el negocio y ayudar a su hijo para tenga todo lo necesario y también pueda iniciar ya sus estudios.
texts.en: Mariana del Socorro is 60 years old and she has a grocery store and she also sells caramel. She lives with her young son. She is a very hard working person and she learned this business with her parents’ help. This is how Mariana slowly established her own business and how she learned the work. She requests a loan to purchase sweets, bags, cinnamon, cups, firewood, cooking pots and other products.  This will help her become ready to meet the demand. Her goal is to make her business grow and to support her son so that he will have all that he needs and to be able to start school.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, bags, cinnamon, cups, firewood adn other products for her business

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn C. is from the village of Amoyong, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 30 years old. Jerlyn is married and has two school-aged children. Jerlyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Jerlyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Jerlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. 

This loan will be her sixth from HSPFI. Jerlyn is requesting 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk food & beverages. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk food, & beverages

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo es un padre de familia de 32 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en la casa de sus padres y cuenta con servicio de agua y luz solamente.  Su casa se ubica en el distrito de Tumán a una distancia de 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  En éste distrito sus pobladores laboran en el cultivo de la caña de azúcar para su posterior procesamiento y convertirlo en azúcar para elconsumo de las personas.
Leonardo se dedica ha manejar su mototaxi (transporte público utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas con un cupo máximo de 3 personas),  lo realiza trasladando a las peresonas que viven en su distrito de un lugar a otro. Pero también tiene su propia clientela e incluso lo contratan para llevar a niños a los diferentes centros educativos de la zona, ésto le  permite tener mayores ingresos para poder ayudar  de algún modo a solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar.  Otra forma de obtener más dinero es vendiendo algunas aves de corral que cría en su casa.

A solicitado un préstamo ha Edpyme Alternativa Leonardo de 2000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi, ya que lo utiliza diariamente mañana y tarde y necesita realizar algunos cambios de respuestos, permitiendole garantizar un mejor servicio y obtenga a largo plazo mejores ingresos.

Leonardo es muy cocnocido por ser una persona  de confianza, muy respetuoso y responsable con su clientes que utilizan sus transpoprte, con el objetivo de seguir mejorando en la vida y mas adelante poder vivir con su familia en su casa propia.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a family man of 32 years of age who lives with his wife and children in his parents' home where they have only electric and water service. His home is located in the district of Tumán, 15 minutes away from the province of Chiclayo. The inhabitants of this district work growing sugar cane to be later processed and turned into sugar for consumption. 

Leonardo earns a living driving his moto-taxi (public transportation which is used on short runs with a maximum occupancy of three persons), carrying people living in his district from one place to another. However he also has his own regular customers who even hire him to carry their children to the various educational centers in the region. In this way he generates greater income in order somehow to help pay the daily living expenses in his household. Another source of money is through the sale of poultry which he raises at home. 

He has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to do maintenance on his moto-taxi, since he uses it every day, mornings and afternoons, and must replace some parts, which will allow him to guarantee better service and, in the long run, better income. 

Leonardo is well known for being dependable, very respectful and responsible towards the customers who use his service. His goal is to continue improving in life and in the future to be able to live with his family in their own home.

loans.use: to maintain and buy replacement parts for his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Alexandra Isabel

texts.es: Alexandra de 34 años vive en el barrio Montes de la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene una fritanguería donde también vende jugos de naranja, desde hace más de dos años;  ella inició en un puesto de trabajo alquilado  que luego compró y poco a poco lo ha ido adecuando con herramientas y equipos para ir día a día mejorando la oferta y lograr cada dia que pasa atraer muchos clientes. Aunque su capital de crédito no es de gran tamaño, Alexandra tiene un sueño y es tener un local grande en el cual pueda condicionar un restaurante,  para aprovechar al máximo el potencial de clientes que ya la conocen y se lo han pedido. Credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprará insumos en mayor volumen,  para disminuir la frecuencia de compras y ganar descuentos por compras superiores a las que actualmente  acostumbra a hacer. Mientras Alexandra trabaja en la construcción de sus sueños, continua haciendo todos los esfuerzos para lograr la sostenibilidad permanente de su negocio y su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Alexandra is 34 years old and lives in Montes neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla.  She has a fried snacks stall where she also sells orange juice.  She has been in this business for more than two years.  She started out with a rented sales location which she later bought and gradually she has been equipping it with tools and equipment so that she can improve her offerings every day and manage to attract more customers.

Although she doesn't have a lot of capital, Alexandra has a dream of owning large premises where she can set up a restaurant to make the most of her customer potential as her customers already know her and have asked her to do this. 

This Kiva loan is the first loan that Alexandra has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy supplies in larger volumes in order to decrease the frequency with which she buys her supplies and to gain discounts for making larger purchases than those which she is currently used to making.  While Alexandra works towards accomplishing her dreams, she continues putting all her efforts into achieving permanent sustainability and growth for her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, corn, sugar and oil in larger quantities

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 30-year-old lady. She not only carries out her responsibilities as a housewife but also offers her sewing services to community clients. She is very skillful in her work and can sew designer and non-designer clothes very well. She does this work to supplement the income of her family.  

Her husband is involved in a Punjabi food business. He runs a small restaurant in the market where he sells Punjabi food items like "Biryani" (made with rice and chicken served with salad & pickle) and "Dahi bhalay" (made with yogurt and potatoes and served with spicy sausages). He has obtained a good number of clients in his region due to the good quality of his food. 

Fouzia is the mother of six children: three of them are studying while the others stay at home. Due to financial constraints, Fouzia couldn’t provide them all an education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy required ingredients such as rice, chicken, spices and cooking oil, etc. to improve the quality of his food and expand his business. He has been operating this business for the past eight years and Fouzia hopes that an investment will help him increase his profits further.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for Punjabi food business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria es tejedora artesanal; teje y trenza mantas las mismas las comercializa en las distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para cubrir los gastos de la operación de vesícula biliar que se realizará, pues le ha estado molestando por mucho tiempo. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Seke de la ciudad de El Alto; es divorciada  y tiene tres hijos. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: María is an artisanal weaver.  She weaves and knots blankets that she sells in various markets in the city of El Alto.  She needs the loan to pay for a gall bladder operation she’s going to have because it’s been bothering her for a long time.  She lives in her own house located in the Seke sector of the city of El Alto.  She is divorced and has three children.  This is her first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her gall bladder surgery.

loans.name: Benita De Los Angeles

texts.es: Benita De Los Ángeles es madre soltera, Benita ha salido adelante con su hijo que todavía necesita de su apoyo. Ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de comida, hace más de 10 años que trabaja en este negocio, por lo que le ha ido muy bien y ha sido muy beneficioso. El sueño de Benita es tener un restaurante ya que a ella le gusta mucho cocinar, además este sería un gran negocio en su comarca. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, verduras, frutas, platos desechables, bolsas y frutas para sus refrescos.
texts.en:
