Benita De Los Ángeles is a single mother who has been able to move forward with her son, but she still needs assistance. She prepares and sells food. Her business has been in existence for more than 10 years. She has done very well, which has been very beneficial. Benita’s dream is to have a restaurant since she love to cook. In addition, it would be a great business to have in the area.

She is requesting this loan to use as operating capital for buying rice, beans, oil, vegetables, disposable plates, bags, and fruits for her refreshments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, vegetables, disposable plates, bags, and fruits.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep, a 50-year-old woman, is divorced and has 2 children. She and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City.

To earn a living and provide for her children, Hiep has been selling food from her food stall for nearly 22 years. This business is the only source of income for her family. 

Hiep would like a loan to buy good quality raw meat, rice and fresh vegetables so she can cook many good dishes for her customers. She hopes that this loan will enabL. her to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice and fresh vegetables

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 34-year-old married woman who has worked as a tailor for 11 years; she enjoys her business. Zeinab is a hardworking woman, helping her husband earn their livelihoods. In addition to tailoring, Zeinab also has a small area in her shop where she sells household appliances. Most of the clients who come for tailoring needs are attracted by the appliances and vice versa.

Zeinab is skilled at what she does and works hard on improving her business as much as she can. That is why she is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to buy a specialized tailoring machine and to increase her home appliances capital.

Zeinab's business increases a lot during the holy Eid Al Fitr celebrations, a three day Muslim holiday that marks the end of Ramadan, since most people mend old clothes or request new tailored dresses and many other items. An updated machine would help a lot during this season and the coming days. Zeinab hopes to expand her business by opening two big separate shops in the future.

loans.use: To buy a specialized tailoring machine

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 46 years old, married to Esther, and they have four school-going children. He has practiced farming for the last fifteen years. 
 
He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Estela Marys

texts.es:
La señora Estela tiene 42 años D. edad, es casada, vive en la ciudad D. Villarrica, tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales 4 están casadas ya y se independizaron, ella junto con su esposo viven es su casa propia.
Ella se dedica al al bordado en lienzo y ao po'i con este trabajo ella pueD. ayudar a su esposo quien es quinielero (vendedor D. juegos D. azar) y maestro D. obras, para poder educar y alimentar a sus hijos y hacerlos estudiar. Ella comenta que sus bordados son muy solicitados, ya que el bordado en ao po'i es muy querido, en especial por los turistas. Comenta que ella lucha diariamente por el sustento D. su familia, le gusta sentir que su trabajo ayuda a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas, que luego ella y por medio D. su creatividad ira perfeccionando, así también para la compra D. hilos y agujas necesarios para los bordados que ella hace. Agradece a la Fundación, la confianza depositada en ella. Está con mucha esperanza en el crédito, pues D. obtenerlo le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Estela is 42 years old, married and lives in the city of Villa Rrica. She has 6 children, of which 4 are married and live on their own. She and her husband live in their own home. Her business is embroidering cloth and ao po’i (fine embroidered cotton fabric typical of the area), and with this work she can help her husband who is a “quinielero” (vender of games of chance) and foreman, to be able to educate and feed their children and make them study.  She comments that her embroidery is much in demand, since embroidered ao po’i is cherished, especially by the tourists.  She says she fights daily to proviD. for her family. She likes to feel that her work helps her family.
She is requesting the loan to buy cloth that later she will perfect by means of her creativity, and also to buy the threads and needles necessary for the embroidery that she makes.  She is thankful to the Foundation and the confidence it has in her. She is very hopeful about the loan, since obtaining it will be of much help.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread and needles for embroidery.

loans.name: Luis Mercedes

texts.es:
En el Municipio de santa rosa del peñón, departamento de león, el señor Luis Mercedes Se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bien estar de su casa y a logrado mantener a su familia que tanto ama y aprecia en mejores condiciones. El se caracteriza por ser un excelente trabajador y con buenos valores morales ha hecho que se gane el aprecio de muchas personas.
 Actual mente a acudido a Ceprodel El Sauce, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para reparar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como: Sementó y Arena, con esto empezara a la mejora de su vivienda, para las mejores condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Mercedes lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñon in the Department of León. He is known for being a hardworking person who is able to provide for the welfare of his household and has managed to maintain good living conditions for his family. Luis is known as an excellent worker with good values, thus enabling him to earn the respect of many people.

He came to the CEPRODEL branch in El Sauce to request a loan so that he could make repairs to his home. The loan he requested will be used to buy construction materials, such as cement and sand, so that the improvements to his home can begin and his family will have better conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand for making home improvements.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman with six children, two boys and four girls, all of whom attend school. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a retail business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business.  She dreams of expanding her business and educating her children. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur is 52 years old and lives with his wife, Aida, in Nerqin Hand village in the Kapan area of Armenia. Khachatur is now head of Nerqin Hand’s village community. His wife is a librarian who works in the village library

Khachatur and his wife operate a farm where they breed cattle, pigs and chickens, and raise bees. Also they grow vegetables, beans and wheat. They sell their agricultural produce at the Kapan city market.

Khachatur has a caterpillar tractor, a wheeled tractor, a utility truck, and mowing machine.  The last tractor he bought was with money from his first Kiva-funded loan. He uses these implements on his farm and also rents them to people in the village.  Now, Khachatur is requesting a 1,000,000 Armenian dram loan to buy hay pressing equipment for his farm.

loans.use: to buy hay pressing equipment

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 43 years old. He is married and they have four children between 5 and 20 years old. He raises and sells livestock and has been in the business for the past 10 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from the business.

This is his third loan term from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan amount to purchase livestock for resale. 

The anticipated profits will help him feed his family and meet his financial needs. He hopes to expand his business to acquire more profits, helping him provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Gabino le esta haciendo falta las escalera para los cuartos que esta construyendo en la planta alta de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el materia que es (Block, cemento, arena y barrilla), ya que el se encargar de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su empleo. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio y que tengo un mejor lugar donde vivir, los cuartos que esta construyendo serán las recamaras de sus dos hijos, necesitan su propio espacio en la casa. 
Don Gabino planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleado de un centro comercial, ya que su esposa la señora Bertha Alicia se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares, con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de elaboración y venta de platillos Mexicanos.
texts.en:
Gabino’s house needs a stairway up to the rooms he’s building on the second story of the house.  He’s asking for the loan just to buy building materials (concrete blocks, cement, sand and rebar) because he’ll do the work himself in his free time from work.

He wants to improve his assets and have a better place to live.  The rooms he’s building will be bedrooms for his two children who need their own space in the house.

Gabino plans to repay the loan with the salary he earns as an employee at a shopping center since his wife, Bertha Alicia, will take care of family and school expenses with the profits she earns in her business making and selling traditional Mexican food.

loans.use: to build a wall and a stairway up to the second story.

loans.name: Los Claveles Group

texts.es:
La señora Matilde  tiene 37 años de edad vive en unión libre con el señor Ramón  y con quien procreo ocho hijos quienes  dos ya están casados y seis aun están a su responsabilidad y viven en una ribera muy pequeña  en una casa muy humilde.



   Ella  es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de materiales, como son: palmas, tintes para elaborar petates, y lleva trabajan quince años  y le va bien ya que también  hace chicharrones para vender  y manda a sus niños a vender de casa por casa  así mejorar un poco mas sus ingresos.

   Para dedicarse a esta actividad de los petates lo  animo su esposo ya que el también los elabora casada que tiene tiempo en cambio ella es todos los días para tener cuando menos tres petates, a un así también  manda a sus hijos vender chicharrones de casa en casa para tener un poco mas de ingresos,

   Lo  que más  desea es que con el préstamo que le han otorgado pueda mejorar su actividad para que con ello siga trabajando con  más calidad y sus ingresos  mejoren  y darles lo más necesario a sus hijos.

Quienes  integran en el  grupo son las señoras:

   Margoth quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra  y venta de pollos, y la señora Antonia  invertirá el préstamo  en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes.
texts.en:
Matilde is 37 years old and in a common law marriage with Ramón. With him she has had eight children, two of whom are married and six of whom are still under her care. They live in a little town on the river in a very humble house. 



She is a housewife and asked for the loan to invest in buying materials such as: palms and dyes to make woven knapsacks. She has been doing this for fifteen years and it is going well for her. She also makes chicharrones to sell and send her children to sell door to door to improve her income a little more.    

Her husband encouraged her to work in the activity of making petates, since he makes them as well, when he has time. She makes at least three a day and still sends her children out to sell chicharrones door to door to have a little more income.     

What she wants the most is that with the loan she has been granted, to improve her activity so that she can work with a higher quality and improve her income, giving her children more of what they need.  

The members of the group are:  

Margoth, who will invest the loan in buying and selling chicken, and Antonia, who will invest the loan in buying ingredients to make bread.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of materials and to make woven knapsacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets of metal and beams

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 49 years old and a single mother of four children. She has owned a cereals store in the Mosoriot trading centre for 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000.

Jane has recently joined KADET LTD. She has taken out her first loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase five sacks of dry maize, two sacks of beans and 50 kg of rice for resale. Jane plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and save up for the family's upkeep. Jane dreams of improving her business and her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase cereals for resale

loans.name: Lauiula

texts.en:
Lauiula is a 47 year-old woman living in the town of Satupaitea Satufia.  She is married and has 5 school-aged children.  To make a living, Lauiula owns & operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Lauiula has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 800 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lauiula joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lauiula has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  Lauiula is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones (herbicides).  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Lauiula plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones (herbicides).

loans.name: Nadija

texts.en:
Nadija is from Catadman, Ozamis City. She is 62 years old. Nadija is married having two children. To make a living, Nadija owns & operates a business venture, providing boarding house rental services to local community members. Nadija has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Nadija joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nadija is requesting a loan of 12,516.67 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials for boarding house renovation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for boarding house renovation

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 51 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Carmelita has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from fruit vending.
Carmelita is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She runs of selling of vegetables and charcoal within their house and has been in the business for almost five years. She is earning a monthly profit of about 2,000 pesos. 

She is applying for a loan of 12,000, which she intends to use to buy additional stock of charcoal, beans, legumes and other demands vegetables to sell.  Her profits earned through this loan will save for their daily necessities and help pay school fees for her two children. 

In future, she hopes to uplift their poor living with her business and industriousness.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal, beans, legumes and other demands vegetables to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alonso

texts.es:
Carlos es un moto taxista que presta su servicio de transporte y encomiendas en su municipio, el cual le ha brindado la posibilidad de acceder a ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Carlos se encuentra casado y es padre de 1 hijo de 7 años, quien es su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio todos los días. Carlos tiene la gran dificultad de que sus servicios no son utilizados en las temporadas de lluvia, por lo que en las fuertes temporadas de invierno sus ingresos se ven fuertemente perjudicados, además, Carlos presenta la dificultad de que su moto es de un motor de 2 tiempos, lo que hace que su consumo de gasolina y lubricantes sea muy alto. Gracias a que ha sido muy ordenado con su dinero, Carlos tiene unos ahorros que busca destinar al reemplazo de su moto por una moto de 4 tiempos, de modo que su consumo de gasolina y lubricantes sea menor. Es por esto que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a completar el dinero que le hace falta para reemplazar su moto de 2 tiempos por una moto de 4 tiempos de modo que su consumo de gasolina y lubricantes disminuya considerablemente.
Carlos espera que de esta manera sus ingresos sean mayores, ya que se ahorrará gran cantidad de combustible en su moto. Además, espera que de esta manera su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida. Carlos sueña con ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor educación y en un futuro permitirle el acceso a una educación universitaria. Carlos también sueña con tener una moto-carro que le permita transportar sus clientes aún en temporadas de lluvias.

loans.use: Completar el dinero que le hace falta para reemplazar su moto de 2 tiempos por una moto de 4 tiempos de modo que su consumo de gasolina y lubricantes disminuya considerablemente.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a farm where he grows egg plant, onions . He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will expand the business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of produce

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with a grown daughter. She started her business selling leather gloves, wallets and purses 6 years ago. Low competition and high market demand have enabled rapid growth in the business. Currently Yelena has 4 container-stores at one the busiest city markets. Yelena is a very hard-worker. She has a saying, “You are a bad market vendor if you don’t get income by the end of a working day.” Yelena has proven to be very prudent client of “Nadiya Ukraine” – she never asks for a bigger loan than she can pay back. Lending services in combination with her perseverance, trustworthiness and responsibility have helped to guarantee success in her business. Yelena is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase her inventory. She would like to purchase assorted leather gloves at wholesale prices to re-sell in her container-stores. She is able to reduce her transportation expenses by purchasing more inventory in bulk when she travels to remote wholesale centers. Yelena’s long term goal is the continued expansion of her business. She would like to purchase another container-store in the Nikolaev area and eventually open a whole network of leather goods stores in Nikolaev and further away in Kiev, the capital of Ukraine.

Олена – одружена, в неї доросла дочка. Вона почала займатися бізнесом з продажу шкіряних виробів ще 6 років тому. Низька конкуренція та високий попит на ринку сприяли швидкому зростанню її бізнесу. Сьогодні Олена – власниця чотирьох крамниць-контейнерів на одному з найбільших ринків міста. Олена – дуже працьовита. Вона завжди каже: „Ви – поганий продавець, якщо в вас немає виторгу на кінець робочого дня.” Олена – дуже відповідальна. Вона вчасно сплатила усі позики від „Надії України”, тому що ніколи не брала більше, ніж могла б сплатити. Отримані кредитні послуги та її наполегливість сприяли успішному зростанню її бізнесу. Олена просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент товарів. Вона хотіла б придбати різноманітні шкіряні перчатки за оптовими цінами для подальшого продажу в крамницях-контейнерах. На оптових складах Олена може закупити велику партію товару одночасно, а це дає їй змогу зменшити власні транспортні витрати. Олена планує і надалі розвивати свій бізнес. Вона хотіла б придбати ще одну крамницю-контейнер десь в іншому районі Миколаєва, а в майбутньому також відкрити цілу мережу крамниць з продажу шкіряних виробів в своєму місті, а потім й у Києві, столиці України.

loans.use: To purchase leather gloves in bulk

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Need a place to get the latest styles in jean clothing? For friendly service and great help finding something that is just right, stop by Alexander’s little kiosk at the market in Melitopol. He’s been in business for seven years and has an attractive supply of quality, stylish clothes. In fact, he keeps about $10,000 worth of inventory on hand to choose from. He typically sells about $3,000 worth of clothes each month, earning enough to support himself and his wife who is unable to work. His focus is mainly on jean jackets, which are very popular, and on men’s pants. Ladies, he may have to refer you to one of his fellow vendors if you don’t find what you’re looking for.

Alexander has requested a loan for $1200 that will enable him add to his inventory and create more choices for his customers. It is important for him to keep a good selection of clothing on hand so he can maintain his competitive edge and continue to earn enough to support his family.

Потрібно знайти стильний джинсовий одяг? Ви отримаєте те, що шукаєте, й насолодитесь приємним обслуговуванням, зупинившись в кіоску Олександра на ринку в м. Мелітополь. Він займається цим бізнесом 7 років, завжди пропонує широкий вибір якісного, вишуканого одягу. Зараз в Олександра приблизно 10 000 доларів в товарі. Зазвичай його щомісячний виторг складає 3000 доларів. Цих грошей вистачає для того, щоб забезпечити себе та дружину, яка ніде працює. Торгує Олександр в основному джинсовими куртками та чоловічими брюками, які завжди користуються попитом. Намагається допомогти кожному клієнту, якщо в нього не знайшовся потрібний товар. Олександр просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб розширити асортимент товарів та задовольнити попит з боку покупців. Він розуміє наскільки важливо запропонувати широкий вибір одягу для того, щоб залишатися конкурентноспроможним й надалі забезпечувати власну родину усім необхідним.

loans.use: Increase product variety

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Amada

texts.es:
Mrs Amada I. is 61 years old. She is married and her husband Apolonio Torales is retired. He used to work as Municipal Inspector at the City Hall. They have four children all already of legal age. Amada has always been an enterprising and sacrificed woman. She studied in spite of the lack of means of her family, and even when she had to look after her 9 younger brothers and sisters, after her parents died when she was 20 years old. Amada is a retired teacher and today she works in the confection of handmade of tablecloths of "encaje ju" a Guarani term (one of two official languages in Paraguay) that means lace done with needles. “Encaje ju” is a typical weave of Paraguay, and it is a beautiful handmade work that takes time and great dedication to make it. At present she sell her products in different cities, since her clients love her work and come up to the city of Carapegúa to buy them. She makes them together with her sister who studied this craft and taught her. Amada is asking for a loan to buy more threads and fabric, since they have received wholesale orders of their tablecloths to export them to neighboring countries like Argentina.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Amada I. tiene 61 años de edad, está casada, su marido se llama Apolonio Torales y es jubilado, el trabajaba como Inspector Municipal en la Municipalidad de la ciudad. Ellos tiene cuatro hijos todos ya mayores de edad. Amada siempre fue una mujer emprendedora y sacrificada, estudio a pesar de las carencias de su familia, y aún cuando quedo a cargo de sus 9 hermanos menores, pues sus padres murieron cuando ella tenía 20 años. Amada es un profesora jubilada y hoy día se dedica al tejido artesanal de manteles de “encaje ju” termino en guaraní (uno de los dos idiomas oficiales de Paraguay) que significa encaje hecho con agujas. El encaje ju es un tejido típico del Paraguay, y es un hermoso trabajo hecho a mano y que lleva cierto tiempo y mucha dedicación realizarlo. Actualmente sus productos se venden en diferentes ciudades, pues sus clientes gustan mucho de su trabajo y vienen hasta la ciudad de Carapegúa para poder comprarlos. Ella realiza estos trabajos junto con su hermana quien estudio este oficio y le enseño a Amanda las técnicas del tejido. Amanda solicita el crédito para adquirir más hilos y telas, pues han recibido pedidos al por mayor de sus manteles para exportarlos a países limítrofes como Argentina.

loans.use: Buy threads and fabric

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: My parents work as day laborers who plant and farm corn. Their three children, who are 11, 13 and 15 years old, are in the 5th and 6th grade. My family’s average income is $12.50 per month per person. We would like to borrow $75 so we can raise pigs in order to save money for school. We will pay the money back after 5 months.

loans.use: Raise Pigs

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Sra. Ana María belongs to the Banco Comunal Luz y Paz (Light and Peace Community Bank) in the Manantay district of Ucayali in Peru. She is 29 years old and is the mother of three children. Her husband is a construction worker, but does not earn much money, so with an initial loan of 300 Peruvian soles from Manuela Ramos, Ana María decided to set up a small stall selling cookies and candies.

She currently has a grocery store, which she runs at the same time as looking after her children. Ana María and her husband get up very early to take care of their young children and then look after the grocery store. It is one of the few grocery stores in this area.

With the recently granted loan from Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid over four months, she will extend her shop and buy four crates of milk, one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, six crates of soda and one pack of cookies.

Ana María is very happy that her children are healthy, and that she has this business to help pay for household needs.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana María pertenece al Banco Comunal Luz y Paz, del A. H. Martha Chavez Mz 22 Lt 10 del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es operario de construcción civil, pero tiene un bajo ingreso, por esa razón Ana María, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300.00 soles decide poner un pequeño puesto para la venta de galletas y golosinas.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega, la misma que atiende junto a sus hijos, se levantan muy temprano para atender a sus pequeños hijos y luego atender la bodega. En este sector existen pocas bodegas cercanas.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, ampliará el local del negocio y comprará 4 caja de leche, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 6 cajas de gaseosa y 1 paquete de galletas.

Ana María está muy contenta de tener a sus hijos sanos y además de tener este negocio para ayudar a atender las necesidades de la casa.

loans.use: To buy various grocery store products.

loans.name: Pamella's Group

texts.en:
Pamella A. would like a loan to expand her business to sell more fresh food like cassava, Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To boost and expand her business

loans.name: Nengsih

texts.en: Nengsih is 40 and her husband, I., has no job. So to provide her family needs she sell meatballs at her wagon and earns $10 a day. She is asking for a loan of $125 to add her business capital and as a member of MBK, she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to business capital

loans.name: Nisveta

texts.en: Nisveta was born in 1980 and she is from Ribnica, a small  place near Zavidovići. She is married  and her husband  is a demobilized soldier. He has a monthly income of US$ 113. They have two children, 6 months and 6 years old. This is her first loan in the amount  of US$ 825. Nisveta is going to use this loan  to buy hay for a cow and  some chickens  for breeding. She wants to keep  this cow  as an additional  income  resource for her  family.

loans.use: Buy hay for a cow

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with 3 children, ages10, 5 and 2 years old. Tatu started selling food in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Hav

texts.en:
Hav S., aged 40, is a true entrepreneur with three children and resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband have two businesses to support their standard of living. She is a private tailor and earns around $2 a day. Her husband, Mr. Pov Phal, owns a plot of farmland and works as a farmer growing rice since 1980. On average, he makes $2 a day of profit. They have three children, two of whom are too young to attend the school yet, and one who is a student.

To respond to the growth of the tailoring business, she would like a loan from Kiva to replace the old and unreliable sewing machine. This will provide her more output and enable her to earn more income.

loans.use: To replace the old and unreliable sewing machine.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Nghĩa, 45 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2004. She lives with her husband and their 3 school aged children. After her first loan that she invested in her livestock, she switched her business to rice processing. It is a good business. She processes for a lot of farmers in her area. The service earns her 200USD monthly. The monthly payments are easy for her. She is applying for a loan of 950USD to invest in the business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Nghĩa, 45 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2004. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con trong độ tuổi đi học. Sau vòng đầu vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, chị Nghĩa chuyển sang đầu tư xay xát lúa gạo. Công việc ngày càng phát triển, rất nhiều bà con trong thôn đến xay xát gạo tại cửa hàng nhà chị Nghĩa. Thu nhập một tháng của dịch vụ xay xát khoảng 200USD. Nhờ có thu nhập thường xuyên nên việc hoàn trả tuần của chị Nghĩa rất thuận lợi. Vòng vốn tiếp theo chị xin vay 950USD mua gạo về xay xát.

loans.use: Rice processing

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Oumar is a master of the Koran who switched to raising poultry. He maintains a cassava field at home. With an initial loan of 150,000 francs CFA, he started raising broiler chickens. The income earned from his business enables him to cope with family expenses.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Oumar est un maitre coranique qui s'est convertidans l'aviculture .Dans sa maison, il entretien un champ de manioc .Avec un prmier pret de 150000F CFA il a demarré l'élevage des poulets de chaires. les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de faire face aux dépenses de sa famille.

loans.use: capital funds

loans.name: Amar Khary

texts.fr:
Amar Khary N. is a member of the Jammy Xaléyi bank. He's married and the father of one child. He's seeking this loan in view of increasing his income. He is very energetic and his business consists in buying cosmetics and fashion fabrics in Mauritania, that he then resells on the local market.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Amar khary N. est un sociétaire de la caisse de jammy xaléyi .il est marié et père d'un enfant .c'est dans l'optique d'améliorer ses revenus qu'il demande ce pret .il est très dynamique et son activité consiste à aller s'approvisionner en mauritanie en produits cosmétiques et en tissus de mode pour venir les revendre sur le marché local.

loans.use: To buy and resell cosmetics and fabrics

loans.name: Karla Faustina

texts.es:
Karla found it necessary to work as a household domestic in order to support her three children, as her family couldn't manage on the money earned by her partner. For some time she observed that the majority of houses hire furniture washing services, and the idea of providing this service to earn extra income occurred to her. Her clients accepted her for this extra work and little by little, she has gained clients to whom she provides this service.

She needs a loan of US$550, which she will pay back in 6 months, in order to buy an industrial vacuum cleaner so that she can provide a better sevrice to her clients. With your help Karla will be able to achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Karla se vio en la necesidad de trabajar como empleada domestica a particulares debido a que tenia que mantener a sus 3 hijos ya que no le alcanza con lo que gana su pareja desde hace algún tiempo observo que la mayoría de las casas a las que acude contratan el servicio de lavado de muebles, y se le ocurrió la idea de dar este servicio y ganarse un dinero extra si ella lo realizaba, sus clientes aceptaron darle el trabajo a ella y poco a poco ha logrado hacerse de clientes a los cuales les proporciona este servicio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una aspiradora industrial y darle mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo Karla podrá lógralo

loans.use: To purchase a vacuum cleaner

loans.name: Gulom

texts.en: Gulom M. is 45 years old. He is married with 4 children. Gulom is an optimistic, hardworking father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Gulom has been working in agriculture for more than 10 years. He draws on his personal strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-intensive job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to repair his family's house and save enough money to pay for his children’s school fees. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900), which he has committed to repay within 18 months. With the desire to realize his plan, Gulom appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Nasy

texts.en:
Mrs. Nasy M., 42, and her husband, Mr. Phat Pheng, 45, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, married twenty-one years ago and have six children: three daughters and three sons. Two of their children are silk weavers and other two sons are workmen. Two children study in a local school.

Nasy and Phat have been raising pigs and producing rice wine for five years. They sell the pigs and rice wine to the middleman in their village. Nasy is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase feed for raising pigs and producing rice wine.

loans.use: To purchase feed for raising pigs and supplies for producing rice wine

loans.name: Aicha

texts.fr:
Madame B. Aicha est née le 3 juillet 1988 à Sokodé dans la région centrale du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.  Elle a pour activité la vente de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois dans le quartier d’Agoè. Ses principaux clients sont les boulangers et les restauratrices de pâtes de maïs à Agoè. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 sacs de charbon de bois et 17 fagots de bois. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aicha B. was born on July 3, 1988, in Sokodé, in the central region of Togo. She is married and the mother of one child. Her business is the sale of firewood and charcoal in the Agoé neighborhood. Her principal clients make and sell bread and pâte [a local dish made of corn flour] in Agoé. The first loan that she is now seeking will permit her to buy 5 sacks of charcoal and 17 logs of firewood. With this new stock, she will be able to sell more products and realize more profits. Translated from French by Abby Gray, Kiva Fellow Madame B. Aicha est née le 3à juillet 1988 à Sokodé dans la région centrale du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a pour activité la vente de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois dans le quartier d’Agoè. Ses principaux clients sont les boulangers et les restauratrices de pâtes de maïs à Agoè. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 sacs de charbon de bois et 17 fagots de bois. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat du charbon et bois de chauffe / Purchase of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: Mrs. Chet S., age 27, has been running a small store in her home for selling groceries since 2007. She lives in Pursat Province. She has no child and is married to Mr. Clot Viet, 26, who makes a living by driving a taxi motorcycle. By transporting a passenger or merchandise and charging service, he earns approximately $2 per day. Recently, Viet has not attracted enough customers because his motorcycle often has problems. Hence, he and his wife decided to apply for a loan to replace the old motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi motorcycle to replace an old one.

loans.name: Math

texts.en: Math A. S., 38 years old, is a vegetable seller from Phnom Penh City. She runs her business in the area of the Toulsong Kei Market and sells different kinds of vegetables like cabbages, potatoes, and morning glories. She currently earns an average of $8 a dA. and has been running the business for more than five years. Math A. S. is married to Mr. Teur As Math who is a motorcycle taxi driver and also works with her in selling vegetables. She now cares for four children, all of whom are single; one of her sons is also employed as a vegetable seller. Since the pasted-fish season is coming, Math A. S. hopes to earn additional income; thus she is applying for this loan ($1,000) to purchase fish for orders and make pasted-fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase fish and produce fish products to sell

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Гафуров Фарход житель города Душанбе. Возраст 32 года , женат , детей не имеет. Работает в строительной организации. Жена занимается пошивом национальных платьев. И он решил получить кредит для того, чтобы купить швейную машинку. Таким образом его жена сможет зарабатывать деньги и помогать ему обеспечивать семью. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Farhod G. lives in Dushanbe. He is 32 years old and is married. Farhod works for a construction company, and his wife is a seamstress who specializes in national costumes. Farhod is applying for a loan that would allow him to purchase a sewing machine for his wife, so that she can also earn money. Farhod is planning to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Comite Serenidad Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres denominado Serenidad, es un grupo organizado por 15 integrantes y se han iniciado en el 1º ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendederas.
El grupo se caracteriza por el fuerte deseo de superación de cada una de las integrantes. 
Ellas manifiestan que contar con capacidad para comprender y ser solidarias unas con otras hará que el comité avance.
Comentan que el crédito obtenido es de suma utilidad ya que les sirve de recurso para emprender un negocio y así también les da la posobilidad de mejorar sus vidas y la de sus familiares.
El monto solicitado por cada una fue de Gs. 300.000.- y el monto retirado por el grupo es la suma de Gs. 4.250.000.-
Todas son vecinas y han demostrado que tienen la capacidad vital para trabajar en forma conjunta.
texts.en:
The women’s committee called Serenity has 15 members and has begun its first cycle in the Entrepreneurial Women’s Committee program. The group is known for each of its members having a strong desire to be successful. They maintain that they have the capacity to learn and be united with each other to help the committee grow. They comment that the loan will serve as a resource to begin a business and in this way provide the possibility to improve their lives and that of their families. The amount solicited by each member is Gs. 300.000, and the amount for the entire group is Gs. 4.250.000. They are all neighbors and they have demonstrated that the have the vital capacity to work together.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, clothing, snacks, cosmetics, shoes, groceries such as sugar, tea, meat, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en: Phoeun C. is 48 years old and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She sells rice noodles and grocery items to earn a living and is able to make US $2.00 every day. Her husband is a teacher and earns US $3.00 per day. This couple has one school-aged child. Mrs. Phoeun C. would like to take a loan to purchase a motorbike. The family will use the motorbike for transportation and to reduce the daily costs of their business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris F. desde hace 10 años inició su negocio de pulpería con poco capital financiero y con pocos productos. A medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo, ella ha logrado suplir mas sus estantes en el negocio..

El propósito por el que ella busca el apoyo en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito porque le urge comprar los productos de pulpería para ofertarlos a lo inmediato y así continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Damaris F. started her local store ten years ago with little financial capital and few products. As time has gone by, she's been able to fill her business' shelves. The reason for which she's asking for support from Ceprodel is to be granted a loan, urgently needing to purchase retails products to immediately offer her customers and thus to continue her business that requires so much support.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of retail products

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City with her husband and two children. She started her grocery-store business when she became a member of HSPFI, a Kiva partner. Carmela's business is very active due to the fact that her store is situated near the Lumbia International Airport. Her business is doing good.

Carmela's children are still young. Her eldest is 7 years old while her youngest is 3 years old. Her children inspire her to strive hard to prepare for their future. Her husband is assisting her in her grocery store.

Carmela wants to expand her store by adding additional stock to sell. Right now she is needing a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000.00 to buy additional canned goods and beverages as these are the most salable items in her store.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods and beverages for her store

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos del Distrito D. Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 6 hijos, vive en el Av. Tacna y cuenta con estudios D. 1er grado (primaria).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 2 año e inició su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. venta D. carnes.
En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto D. 1500.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual comprará mayor cantidad D. carne y asi seguir trabajando para su vejes.
Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones donD. recibe capacitación.
texts.en:
Aurora is a member of the Manuela Ramos Communal Bank in the district of Mazocruz, Collao province, department of Puno. She is 60 years old, married, and has 6 children. Aurora lives on Tacna Avenue and has a 1st graD. education. Aurora has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 2 years. She started out with a loan of 300.00 soles, which enabled her to increase her capital for her meat-selling business. Aurora currently needs a new loan. She is asking for 1500.00 soles, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of meat so that she can continue earning money for her retirement. What Aurora likes most about her communal bank are the savings opportunities and the meetings that offer training sessions.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing meat

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina S. is thirty-three years old. She is married with three children, one daughter and two sons. She says her children are currently in either junior high or primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a teacher by profession.

Augustina trades in smoked fish. She procures smoked fish from Dormaa and sells in the local market on a table top. She also treks to other towns to sell. Augustina has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure smoked fish in bulk. She is hopeful that she will expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish in bulk.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy C. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 26 years old. Mary Joy is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Joy owns & operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale, and from raising pigs. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Mary Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fertilizer, seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and materials for house repair. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Mary Joy from PMPC. She plans to have a comfortable shelter to live in, and to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and materials for house repair

loans.name: Afzal

texts.ru: Афзал Худойдатов проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 26 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Афзал, более 7 лет занимается торговлей. Он скупает лепешки и перепродает их или сдает  под реализацию. Ему в этом также помогает его сын. Клиент просит кредит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Afzal Hudoilatov lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 26 years old. He is married and has three children. Afzal has been in retail for more than seven years. He buys flat breads and resells them. His son also helps him in this business. The client is asking for a loan to increase commodity circulation.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Alvaro José

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, el señor Alvaro Cortéz se dedica esforzadamente a su negocio de venta de tomates vendidos por él mismo y a pesar que su localidad no presta las condiciones cien por ciento necesarias, eso no ha sido impedimento para él por lo que ha buscado la manera de invertir en el local y ofrecer sus productos para satisfacer a sus clientes.

La razón por la que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los tomates y de esta forma venderlos en su localidad ya que a diario los clientes le buscan para llevar a cabo las compras de los tomates que el señor Alvaro lleva a cabo.
texts.en:
In the department of León, Alvaro Cortéz works dedicatedly at his tomato-vending business. Although his town doesn’t give him the 100% best conditions, this has not deterred him from what he has accomplished. He has searched for a way to invest locally and to offer his products to satisfy his customers. The reason that he has come to Ceprodel is to ask for a loan to buy tomatoes and then sell them in his town since his customers daily come to him to buy tomatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es: A sus 58 años de edad, Amadeo se mantiene muy vigoroso y sano, es casado y padre de 8 hijos, de los cuales, todos de ellos ya tiene su propia familia y viven fuera. Él se quedó en la compañía de su esposa, viviendo en su casa propia del pueblo. Su siembra favorita son las hortalizas como las zanahorias y las espinacas, asimismo en sus chacras temporales siembran papas y arvejas; pero de todas sus cultivos, lo que mayor rentabilidad le genera son las espinacas y las zanahorias, ya que las cosecha son cada tres a cuatro meses. Por ello, Amadeo alegremente riega por las noches, sin importarle el frió ni el cansancio, puesto que gracias a su esfuerzo sus espinacas le son muy rentables, y más aun en los meses de enero a marzo, que llega a vender cada canasta entre 60 y 80 soles, mientras que el precio de la zanahorias no tienen un precio fijo, pero igualmente le deja buenos dividendos. Amadeo está muy contento de ser un hombre de campo y se siente muy orgulloso de dedicarse a sus siembras, y con el apoyo valioso de su esposa pudieron educar y mantener a sus hijos hasta hacerlos hombres de bien, que es su mayor satisfacción en vida. Este es su Q. crédito con MFP y durante estos ciclos viene trabajando responsablemente con su banco comunal, al no piensa fallarle por la confianza depositada. Asimismo, trata de colaborar en todas las actividades de grupo, de acuerdo a sus posibilidades, en gratitud a ello. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus chacras de hortalizas y también para sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en:
Amadeo is a very vigorous and healthy 58 year old. He is married and has eight children. The children all have their own families, and they do not live with him. He lives with his wife in their own house in town. His favorite plantings are crops like carrots and spinach. In his seasonal fields they plant potatoes and peas. But, of all of his crops, spinach and carrots are the most profitable because they are harvested every three to four months. To do so, Amadeo happily waters at night without minding the cold or how tired he is. Thanks to his effort, his spinach is very profitable and even more so from January to March. He sells each basket for between 60 and 80 PEN. The carrots do not have a fixed price, but they also bring good dividends. Amadeo is very happy to be a farmer. He feels very proud to devote himself to his crops. With the valiant support of his wife, they were able to educate and support their children until they became successful. This is his greatest satisfaction in life. This is his fifth loan with MFP. During these loan cycles he has been working responsibly with his Community Bank. He does not intend to fail the trust that has been given to him. He tries to collaborate in all of the group activities because he is grateful for the opportunities given to him. The money he is asking for is to buy chemical fertilizes to fertilize his vegetable and potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Kamelah Group

texts.en:
Kamelah wants a loan for her husband’s vegetable business and Madena wants a loan for her son’s business selling sticks. Pakey wants a loan for her husband’s general store. Rayhana wants a loan for a tailoring business.

Kamelah is the leader of this four member group. Each member wants to take a loan for expanding her business and they are requesting a total loan of 20,000 afghani. They are very thankful to AFS and to Kiva lenders who are able to support all the people in and around Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy materials for their businesses

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef is a 36 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Josef has been working as a taxi van driver since 1996. He also works as a school bus driver. Josef requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van before schools starts. This is the first time that Josef has requested a loan.

Josef is special in his work because he knows how to take care of his clients. His clients can be anybody from his region, as well as students. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work as well as he is known for his good reputation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by having a bigger bus.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Kae Yesu Group

texts.en:
Felicia is 32 years old and married. She is the mother of two children, both currently in school. She operates a drinking spot where she sells beverages such as canned and bottled soft drinks. She has built a wooden kiosk from which she sells her drinks. She is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to help her business expand and to provide her children with quality education. However, she worries that she will not have adequate funds to realize that dream.

She is been running her establishment for three years now. She is humbly requesting your help in the form of a loan that she will use to make her dream come true. With the loan, she wants to purchase an increased stock of assorted drinks from the wholesalers to restock her shop. Her goal is to gain more resources with which to take care of the family.

Felicia is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Kae Yesu,’ which means 'Remember Jesus.' She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi, and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.name: 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal “Villa Exaltación” se reúne la asociación  “3 de Mayo”,   se agruparon recientemente  por la necesidad de contar con un negocio propio  que  le permita generar ingresos, además desean  ahorrar  para cubrir gastos inesperados en sus hogares. Diversos son los negocios que tienen este grupo, como ser la venta de yogurt, artículos varios, ropa, pero la fabricación de ladrillos es una actividad en la que trabajan varias socias, tal es el caso de Rosalía, Rosmery, Antonia,  Juana, y Mario .Necesitan el préstamo para iniciar sus negocios con la  compra de materia prima.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary has been selling food around Naivasha town for the last 5 years. She is 34 years old, married to Julius Owino, and has 4 school age children. She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. With this loan, Rosemary plans to buy more food supplies, which she will use to cook with and then sell around town. She hopes to open a more permanent place one day where her clients will come and be served.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more food supplies which she will use to cook with and then sell around town

loans.name: Kissa Y.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 42 year-old Kissa K. from Mbeya. She is single with 2 children, between the ages of 10 and 15. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant because he is an orphan. 

In 1998 she established a store that sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. 

Her store also sells second-hand clothes which come across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything modern. 

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Kissa currently earns about $120 US from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more used clothes and vitenge in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quality of her business. Kissa thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes and vitenge in bulk.

loans.name: Rabeca

texts.pt:
Rabeca H. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, tem 43 anos de idade, separada e mãe de 5 filhos de 24, 22, 19, 16, e 7 anos de idade, 4 destes vão a escola. Fez somente 6ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos em Boane e ainda sustenta um sobrinho e 1 neto.

Nunca mudou de cidade, depois de casamento continuou a viver no mesmo Distrito. Tem um negócio Próprio, vende das 7h as 19h a mais de 25 anos, trabalha sozinha e rende cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês. Consegue poupar algum valor através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos e seus vizinhos. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, blocos, cimento e areia) para ampliar a sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt todos para comércio.

No futuro espera solicitar mais empréstimos para dar continuidade com a sua obra e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família assim como reforçar o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Rabeca H. was born in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo. She is 43, separated, and has 5 children who are 24, 22, 19, 16, and 7. Four of her children go to school. She only studied through 6th grade and didn't continue because of a lack of money. She lives in her own home with her children in Boane and she also supports a nephew and a grandson. She never moved out of her city. After she got married, she continued to live in the same district. She has her own business and has sold from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. for more than 25 years. She works alone and earns about 4,000 meticais per month. She manages to save some through a traditional rotating savings system known as Xitique. She has never had a loan with another bank. She became familiar with Hluvuku through friends and neighbors. This is her 4th loan and it is for 15,000 meticais. She will use it to purchase construction materials (metals sheets, bricks, cement, and sand) to expand her home. Her previous loans were for 5,000, 10,000, and 10,000 meticais, all of which were used for her business. In the future she hopes to request more loans to continue working on her home so she can offer better living conditions to her family and strengthen her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (bricks and cement)

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en:
D. Baasanjav is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her two sons are both serving in the Mongolian army and her daughter works as an accountant for the local power company. Her husband operates a PC gaming center.

Baasanjav has managed a small grocery shop in her town since 1996. Over the years she has built up a stable business and gained much experience in her trade. She has a large base of loyal customers and she takes great pride in providing them with good service.

Bassanjav has many plans for her grocery shop and says, “My children are all grown up now so I want to focus on growing my business for the future. She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug (~2800USD) loan to purchase food products for her business and to help her son buy a house.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase food products to sell

loans.name: Sourng

texts.en: Sourng L., 36, is married and lives with his three-year-old child and wife in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He is a police officer for a local market in the city, and he is also a skillful blacksmith. He has engaged those jobs since 2003 and is able to earn an income of US $8 per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife stays at home as a housewife to look after his young children and the family. L. and his family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, L. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase metals to expand his blacksmithing business. This is his first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. In the future, he hopes he will be able to a bigger business to save up more income. He also wants to build a new nice house for his family, and send his children to good schools.

loans.use: buy metal to expand the blacksmithing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks in bulk

loans.name: Yuri Anis

texts.es: La señora Yuri Anis H. R., vive en el Barrio La Francia, es soltera y tiene 24 años de edad la cliente se dedica al comercio de las frutas desde hace 10 años y uno de los problemas principales han sido la de un local apropiado para ofertar el producto, ella solicita un prestamo para la ampliación del local donde vende las frutas con el dinero compraría materiales de construcción, para comenzar con la primera fase de construccion, esto le ayudaría de gran medida debido a que la demanda de las frutas le han aumentado considerablemente y ella asegura que podría vender el doble del volumen de venta que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Yuri Anis Hernandez R. lives in the La Francia neighborhood, is single and 24 years old. For the past 10 years, she has worked selling fruit and one of the biggest challenges she faces is having an appropriate place from which to sell her fruit. She is seeking a loan to enlarge her current locale where she sells fruit; with the money, she will buy construction materials to start the first phase of construction. This will help her a lot since the demand for her fruit has increased substantially and she firmly believes that she could sell twice the amount of fruit that she currently sells.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda C., 55, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Rodulfo C., a farmer. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn income so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing a business selling seasonal products. Currently she is selling fruit and some vegetables.

Bernarda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of additional capital for her expanding business to buy more products needed to sustain and replenish her current inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and that she will be able to sustain the business for as long as it will last.  She also wishes that she will have good health to fully enjoy her years with her family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products to sustain and replenish her current inventory.

loans.name: Zoila Nieve

texts.es:
La señora Zoila es nuestra socia desde hace 4 ciclos, y pertenece al Banco Comunal Everes en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo en la provincia de Manabí, este sector donde ser reúnen Nuetras prestamistas esta rodeado de una gran vegetación una tierra muy productiva.

La señora Zoila ingresó a la Fundación motivada por una amiga que le aconsejo para que siga trabajando con los préstamo de la Fundación y ya tiene 4 ciclos.Nuestra socia se dedica desde hace dos años a la cría de cerdos y pollos, en la casa acondicionó un espacio para ubicar su pequeña granja, nos comentó que es un lugar espacioso donde tiene varios galpones, la manera de trabajar es la siguiente, compra pequeños los pollos y los cerdos y se encarga de hacerlos crecer, cada 8 meses cría de 3 a 4 cerdos tienen que pasar 6  meses para que estén aptos para la venta, por el sector donde vive es fácil venderlos hay  personas que le hacen pedidos con anterioridad, por otra parte los pollos se toman 6 semanas para terminar el proceso de cría.

Para la señora Zoila este negocio familiar lo manejan muy bien y le gusta todo lo que hasta ahora ha conseguido con su esfuerzo, con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en más críasde pollos, crdos  y productos alimenticios para su crianza y una parte del crédito invertirá en el sembrío de plátanos y limones.
texts.en:
Señora Zoila has been a member through 4 loan periods, belonging to the communal bank Everes, Pueblo Nuevo parish, province of Manabí. This area where our members meet is surrounded with vegetation, it is a very productive area. Señora Zoila came to the foundation encouraged by a friend who counseled her to keep working with loans from the foundation, and now she has already been through 4 loan cycles. She has been raising pigs and chickens for two years, working in the following manner. She buys the young chickens and pigs and she herself undertakes the raising of the animals, fattening 3 or 4 pigs every 8 months. They have to be older than 6 months to be ready for sale, but it is easy to sell them in her area, people give her orders ahead of time. Chickens on the other hand take 6 weeks to be ready. Señora Zoila handles this family business very well, and she has been pleased with everything she has been able to do up to now. With this new loan she will purchase more breeder chickens, pigs, and foods to feed them. One part of the loan will be invested in planting bananas and lemons.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock
